loans.name: Mach

texts.en: Mrs. Mach P. lives in Prey Chhoeur Tel village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who grows rice on a piece of land she owns. She also owns a small grocery store at home. Her husband, Mr. Nut Noeun, is employed by the state. Mrs. Mach P. is asking for a loan to purchase a pig and pig food. She would also like use the rest of the money to hire laborers to work on her field. She is 36 years old and the mother of three children who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is presented with her in the photo.

loans.use: A pig, pig food, and laborers to work on her land.

loans.name: Osim

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Осим 10 лет занимается продажей женской обуви в магазине Бадри Мунир города Худжанда. В бизнесе ему помогает сестра. Он закупает товар в городе Бишкек  республики Кыргызстан. Он старается расширить свой ассортимент для того, чтобы открыть еще одну точку торговли. На запрашиваемый займ он привезет ассортимент летней обуви.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Osim has been selling women's shoes in the Badri Munir store in the town of Khujand for ten years. His sister helps him in this business. He buys the merchandise in the city of Bishkek in republic of Kyrgyztan. He wants to expand the assortment of his inventory to open one more vendor location. He wants to use the loan to bring in the summer assortment of shoes.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy summer women's shoes

loans.name: Pav

texts.en: Mr. Pav T. is 38 years old and lives in Prey Chhoeur Tel village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who grows rice on a piece of land he owns. He also works in construction. He is a widower with six children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory. Four others attend the local school, while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Mr. Pav T. is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike to be a taxi driver. He hopes to increase his income and to provide a better life for his children.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to be a taxi driver.

loans.name: Kahor

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Кахор мужчина 49 лет. Женат имеет 3-х детей.Кахор занимается перевозкой строй материалов на разные точки города. У него автомобиль марки "Камаз", сезон работы у него в летнее время, так как сейчас все делают стройку и большой спрос на услуги его автомашины. Кахор планирует хорошо заработать в этом сезоне для того чтобы женить сына в осенний период. Кредит берёт на покупку новых шин.
texts.en:
Kahor is a 49-year-old man. He is married and has 3 children. Kahor is involved in transporting building materials to various sites in the city. He has a Kamaz truck. His work season is during summer time because now everyone is doing construction, and the demand for his transportation services is high. Kahor plans to earns well during this season in order to marry off his son in the autumn. He is obtaining this loan for the purchase of new tires.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new tires

loans.name: Sav

texts.en: Mrs. Sav N. lives in Samraung village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who grows both rice and vegetables to sell. She is a 63-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other stays at home to do housework. Mrs. Sav N. needs a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to earn income and improve her family's standard of living with this loan after she sells the cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: Kehinde is a 35-year-old mother of four. She sells building materials. Kehinde is requesting a loan of of 140,000 Nigerian naira (or about $950 US) to purchase more building materials to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey S. is a villager in Ou Phut village in Takeo province. She owns a small general store. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more goods to increase her profits. Her husband, Mr. Kum Sarun, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Together, they have two children, one of whom attends the local school while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for her general store to increase her profits.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sadbarg

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Садбарг – женщина, которая кредитуется в организации несколько лет. Садбарг родилась 1958 году и имеет 4 детей. Три года как она торгует мужскими брюками на рынке «Корвон». У нее много клиентов, так как она продает качественные товары. Закупает товар она на оптовом рынке «Корвон». Садбарг подала заявку на повторный займ, чтобы разнообразить и улучшить ассортимент товара. Она хочет получить займ на сумму 4000 сомони сроком на 8 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sadbarg is a woman who has been a client of our organization for several years. Sadbarg was born in 1958 and has 4 children. She has been selling men's trousers at the Korvon market for over 3 years. She has many customers because she sells quality merchandise. Sadbarg buys her merchandise at the Korvon wholesale market. She put in a request for another loan in order to vary and improve her goods assortment. She wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 4000 somoni.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding goods assortment

loans.name: Thu's Group

texts.en:
Thu Thị Nguyễn was born in 1969. (no: 010117140044). She lives in Xom Ngoai, Uy No, Dong Anh, Hanoi with her husband and four children. Her husband is a taxi driver. She sells building materials (cement, iron, steel, etc). The first child is learning in university. The next three children are going to school. She has a monthly income of about 4.500.000 VND. However, her income is not enough to cover the cost of the family and they have no savings. So, she has to earn more money to care for them and save. She has engaged in micro finance for five years. This time she wants to borrow 6.322.000 VND( or 350 USD) to invest in her construction materials store. There are three other Fund participants in her group: 
  Bích Thị Hồng Phạm was born in 1977. (no: 010117140042). She has two children. Her husband repairs motors and she sells soft drinks at home. She wants to borrow 5.886.000 VND ( or 330 USD)to buy spare parts for motorcycles. 
  Dung Thị Nguyễn was born in 1961. (no: 010117140046). She has three children. She wants to borrow 6.322.000 VND ( or 350 USD) to buy a cow. 
  Vân Anh T. Nguyễn was born in 1978. (no: 010117140006 . She has two children. She wants to borrow 5.450.000 VND( or 300 USD)to buy clothes to sell in the market.

loans.use: To invest in her construction materials store

loans.name: Alanni

texts.en:
Alanni C. is from the town of Canituan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 26 years old. Alanni is single. To make a living, Alanni owns & operates a business selling a variety of products "a la carte" (grilled meat, parts of chicken and beef) to the local community. Alanni has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alanni joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Alanni has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional business capital. Alanni is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Alanni from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to save for future emergencies. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Canito-an, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Hul

texts.en: 75% of Cambodian people have been involved farming businesses. Hul S. is the one of these people. She has been farming since she was single. At 30 years of age, she is a good mother of three children. All three of the children are teenagers in school. She is married to Chin Chen, age 32, who works driving a taxi. Hul S. will be using this loan to purchase 0.50 hectares of farmland and she will plant different kinds of crops. This loan will provide her with a new asset.

loans.use: To purchase 0.50 hectaresw of farmland.

loans.name: Obidamo

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Давлатова Обидамо занимается продажей мужских брюк на рынке "Корвон". Обидамо 1961 года рождения и имеет  5 детей. Имеет среднее образование. Так как ее муж не очень хорошо зарабатывает, она старается много работать и зарабатывать больше денег, чтобы прокормить семью. Обидамо  закупает свой товар из оптового рынка  «Корвон». Она хочет получить средства с помощью Кива кредиторов и расширить ассортимент своего товара, для привлечения клиентов.
texts.en:
Obidamo D. sells men's trousers at the Korvon market. Obidamo was born in 1961 and has 5 children. She has secondary education. Because her husband does not earn very much, she tries to work a lot and earn more money in order to support their family. Obidamo buys her merchandise at the Korvon wholesale market. With the help of Kiva creditors, she wants to obtain means to expand her merchandise assortment in order to attract customers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding merchandise assortment

loans.name: Chuc's Group

texts.en:
Chuc T. Nguyễn was born in 1960. (no: 010117120001). She lives in Phan Xa village, Uy No, Dong Anh, HaNoi. She has a girl. Her husband is a construction worker. She has a store at home where she sells water, fruit, coca cola, tea, etc. Her family has a monthly income of about 4.000.000 VND. She is a group leader. She has taken part in micro finance for three years. This loan cycle she needs 5.886.000 VND to buy goods to sell. There are seven other Fund participants in her group:

Mông Thị Nguyễn was born in 1968. (no: 010117120003). She sells soft drinks at home. She wants to borrow 4.142.000 VND to buy more goods to sell. Phương M. Nguyễn was born in 1985. (no: 010117120005). She sells clothes in the market. She wants to borrow 5.450.000 VND to buy clothes. Quyên Thị Lương was born in 1975. (no: 010117120026). She has two children. She wants to borrow 3.270.000 VND to repair her house. Thúy Thị Đặng was born in 1976. (no: 010117120004). She has two children. She sells bamboo shoots. She wants to borrow 2.398.000 VND to buy more bamboo shoots to sell. Luân Thị Nguyễn was born in 1972. (no: 010117120006). She has three children. She sells pork in the market. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to invest in her shop. Thêu Thị Nguyễn was born in 1980. (no: 010117120007). She has two children. She wants to borrow 3.270.000 VND to buy goods (cakes, sweets, smoker, fruit, etc) to sell. Hợp Thị Trần was born in 1978. (no: 010117120002). She has two children. She wants to borrow 5.886.000 VND to buy building materials.

loans.use: To buy goods to sell

loans.name: Kieng

texts.en: Mrs. Kieng S. was born in 1957 and she lives in Ou Phut village, in Takeo province. She owns a small grocery store. Her husband, Mr. Haem Pun, owns a piece of land on which he cultivates rice. Now Mrs. Kieng S. is requesting a loan to buy two cows for breeding and to reduce her costs for plowing the fields. This couple has four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others stay at home to do housework and help the parents work. Her husband is presented on the left of picture.

loans.use: To purchase cows for plowing the fields.

loans.name: Afolarin

texts.en: Afolarin sells jewelry and women’s slippers. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 140,000 to purchase more jewelery and slippers to sell. Afolarin is 32 years old, married and has two children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase inventory to sell.

loans.name: Sun Nak

texts.en: Mrs. Sun Nak C. is 25 years old and she lives in Ta Koem village, in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Soem Reang, sells duck eggs. This couple also uses rice to make wine that they sell, to earn additional income. With this business, Mrs. Sun Nak C. needs a loan to buy six pigs for breeding, pig feed and to use towards improving her business. She and her husband are presented in the photo together.

loans.use: To purchase pigs, for breeding, and feed.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol R. is from the village of Santa Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Carol is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Carol owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The primary--but not only--source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Carol has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3000 Philippine pesos (or about $40 US) a month from these activities.

In June 2009, Carol joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Carol is requesting a loan of 3000 pesos (or about $75) which will be used to purchase livestock and other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Carol from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to make improvements on her house. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Melenda

texts.en:
Melenda S. is from the village of Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 25 years old. Melenda is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Melenda owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The primary--but not only--source of income for this business comes from selling a variety of different products to the local community. Melenda has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (or about $250 US) a month from these activities.

In 2009, Melenda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Melenda is requesting a loan of 5000 pesos (or about $125) which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Melenda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Mrs. Phally S. owns a small business selling bro houk, salt and so on. Her husband, Mr. Sam Sok, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She is 42 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom sells bro houk in the local market while the others are enrolled in the local school. They are villagers in Bro Soung village in Takeo province.

Although they work hard, they still need more income to support their household. In order to improve their standard of living, Mrs. Phally S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase their income and improve their life with this loan. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Crisologa

texts.en:
Crisologa makes a living as a farmer. Her main source of income comes from selling rice to local community members. She is 51 years old, married and has four adult children. They are from the village of Navalan, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. Crisologa has been farming for over 25 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP quarterly.

In 2008, Crisologa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in rice field activities. Crisologa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in farming activities. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for a farm

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 40 year old woman. She is married and has three kids that she has managed to send to school. She lives with her husband and the children. She is a resourceful mother to her family. Her daily dream is to be able to work hard to provide her kids with a quality education and better future careers. She owns and operates a grocery shop in one of the busy local markets. She sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned foods, peanuts, evaporated milk etc. With the loan, she wants to buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil etc. to increase her stock. She takes delivery of stock from the Kumasi central market. She hopes to save more to finance her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy more grocery inventory

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Mrs. Phan P. is a villager in Pour Pras Sang village, in Takeo province. She owns a small grocery store in her house. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more grocery products to resell and earn a higher profit. Mrs. Phan P. is a 66-year-old widow with three children. One of her children is employed in a company while another is a beautician and the remaining stays at home to do housework.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Muidinjodja

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Шодмонов продолжает расширять свой бизнес. В ассортимент товаров он добавил подростковую одежду. Раньше он ездил за товаром в ближайшие города Согдийской области, а сейчас привозит товар из ближнего зарубежья , за это он благодарен кредиторам за поддержку в его бизнесе.На запрашиваемый займ он хочет закупить подростковой обуви.
texts.en:
S. continues to expand his business. He added adolescent clothing to his merchandise selection. Previously, he used to go to nearby towns in the Sogd district for his merchandise, but now brings the merchandise from nearest foreign countries. He is grateful to the creditors for supporting his business. He wants to use this loan to buy adolescent shoes.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of adolescent shoes

loans.name: Marifat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Марифат,женщина 49 лет.Замужем,имеет двоих детей.Муж подрабатывает на стройке.Она занимается продажей нижнего белья. Товар она закупает из оптового рынка Атуш. Она хотела бы расширить ассортимент своего товара, потому что хороший ассортимент привлекает больше клиентов.Для этого она предпочла взять займ для расширения своего ассортимента.
texts.en:
Marifat is a 49-year-old woman. She is married and has two children. Her husband works part-time at a construction site. Marifat sells undergarments. She buys her merchandise at the Atush wholesale market. She wants to expand her merchandise selection because good selection attracts more customers. For this, she preferred to obtain a loan and expand her merchandise selection.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding merchandise selection

loans.name: Victorine

texts.en:
Victorine Z. was born in 1978 in Abomey Calavie, in southern Benin.  She is married to Marcellin Dossa, a tailor, and she is the mother of four children. For ten years, she has been living with her family in PK10, a neighborhood in the community of Sèmè-Podji, not far from Cotonou.  

Victorine works in food sales. She sells rice and beans near the Cotonou to Porto-Novo autoroute. Her daily sales average around thirty thousand West African Francs, which is about sixty dollars. Victorine would like to buy ten sacs of rice, a sac of beans, and other goods. She likes to buy in bulk because it is cheaper and more efficient. With the help of a loan, Victorine hopes to increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy rice and beans in bulk.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Mom B. is a villager in Roeu Sey Srouk village, in Takeo province. She is a farmer and owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Lab Kaem Ra, is a construction worker. This couple has six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Mrs. Mom B. is requesting a loan to add her savings to build a better house for her family. She is shown, in the photo, with her husband.

loans.use: To build a better house.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina is a 24-year-old young lady. She is a married mother of one breastfeeding child, a boy. She lives with her husband in a rented apartment. She mostly depends on her husband for money and for other expenses. She complains that her husband is not able to give her enough money to take care of her business. She trades in fresh fish sales, a business she has done for four months now. She sells the fish through hawking. She has seen lots of improvement, but she is requesting for a loan to buy enough fish to upgrade her stock. She takes stock from the Kumasi central market, which is a nearby city. She believes the loan will boost her business to be able to include other food items frequently requested by her customers.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish to sell and to upgrade her stock.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen O. is 60 years old, a widow and she has 8 children. She sells provisions to make a living. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more provisions to sell in order to make more profits. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent is 25 years old. She is a married mother of one child (girl) who is currently in school. She lives with her husband in a rented apartment in their community. She trades in fresh fish sales, a business she has done for a year now. She takes stock of fresh fish from Kumasi. She sometimes buys on credit and repays her suppliers in a week’s time. She says she buys on credit because she does not have enough money to buy from the suppliers. She has increased her market share and lots of people buy from her stand in the market. She needs the loan to buy a bulk supply of fresh fish from the market. She dreams big, to provide support to her husband in taking care of their home. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy I. is 40 years old and married with 5 children. She sells provisions and she is requesting for a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is a 30-year-old young woman. She is married but currently has no children. She lives with her husband in a rented apartment in their community. She trades in fresh fish, a business she has done for three years now. She takes stock of fresh fish from Kumasi. She sometimes buys on credit and repays her suppliers when she finishes selling. She says she buys on credit because she does not have enough money to buy from the suppliers. She has increased her market share and lots of people buy from her. Currently she sells the fish at home rather than the market center. She needs the loan to buy a bulk supply of fresh fish from the market. She dreams to save more in order to rent a store and also to buy a fridge to enable her to buy more fish. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Nadège Sophie

texts.en: Nadège Sophie B. is married to Innocent Glanon, a carpenter by trade.  She is the mother of four children, who are all in school. Nadège lives with her family in Sèmè-Podji, a community not far from Cotonou, Benin.  Nadège's business activity is the sale of assorted goods, which she delivers to her clients’ homes. To supplement her activity, she also sells goods in a stall in front of her home. Due to the growing demand for her products, Nadège is seeking a loan from Alidé, a Kiva Field Partner. She would like to buy more bags of charcoal, boxes of spaghetti, oil, and fabrics. Nadège hopes to increase her sales with the help of a loan.

loans.use: To purchase of bags of charcoal, boxes of spaghetti, oil drums, and fabrics.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa is a 37-year-old local restaurant operator. She is married and has four children. Three are currently in school in the community where they live. She prepares and sells local foods like fufu, banku and other local dishes. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain and is eaten with all kinds of soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is eaten with hot pepper or soup. With her tasty meals, Yaa has attracted lots of customers in the area she serves. Therefore, it has become necessary to employ additional hands to assist her in food delivery. Yaa says the price of raw materials has gone up significantly and she needs the support of this loan to enable her to meet her production requirements. With this loan, she wants to purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood to prepare the meals. Her ambition is to provide educational support for her children.

loans.use: To buy maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 42 years old. She is a married and resourceful mother to her family. She has given birth to five children and three of them are in school. Cecilia has five years experience in selling. She prepares and sells pastries, like meat pie and doughnuts. She says it is a very lucrative business and she loves her work. She purchased her stock of raw materials from the Kumasi central market. Occasionally, she buys the ingredients at her community market. Demand for her pastries is on the rise because of its taste and moderate price. She wants a loan to buy bags of flour, margarine and yeast to enhance her business growth. She saves part of her profit to help her husband pay the children’s school bills.

loans.use: To buy flour, margarine, yeast etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase inventory to sell.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia A. from the village of Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur.  She is 48 years old. Lucia is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Lucia operates a retail flower garden selling flower products to tourists and local community members. Lucia has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns PHP 6,000 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lucia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Lucia is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Lucia from PMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To expand her flower business.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is 22 years old and single with no children. He works very hard to take care of himself and improve his business. He is a barber cum student: he completed the last two years of senior high but could not continue. While he was in school, he was barbering to make money to pay his school fees and other expenses. He takes his time to barber his customers well, so many like to come to his shop for their haircuts. Currently he is attending remedial classes to better his grades so he can continue his education to the university level. He is requesting a loan to buy barbering equipment such as a barbering machine, sterilizer, shaver, pomades and hair spray, etc. It is his dream to improve himself through higher learning.

loans.use: To buy a barbering machine, sterilizer, shaver, pomades and hair spray, etc.

loans.name: Kwabena

texts.en: Kwabena is 53 years old. He is married and father to six children, all in school. He is a trader and he trades in smoked meat. He takes stock of goods from Tamale, in the northern part of Ghana. He buys them in bulk and supplies to the food vendors in the community market, where he lives. In most cases, people place their order and he supplies to them as soon as he arrives. He started his business six years ago with lots of experience and with the atmosphere of creating a good environment. He requests a loan so that he can trek to the north of Ghana to buy stock. He also dreams of providing education for his children.

loans.use: To buy meat in bulk.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: In 1968, Jeannette S. was born in Lome, Togo, the country directly west of Benin. She is the mother of three children, who are all in her care.  Two of her children attend school. Jeannette has lived in Cotonou, Benin for nearly twenty years. She prepares meals for people to purchase in her neighborhood. Jeannette is seeking a loan to restock her supplies of corn and vegetables, to make condiments. This would be her fifth loan with Alidé, a Kiva Field Partner in Benin. These loans have all helped her profits.

loans.use: Purchase of sacs of corn and other vegetables.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie B. is from the village of Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur.  She is 30 years old. Elsie is married and has 5 children.  To make a living, Elsie operates sari-sari store. Elsie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately PHP 5,000 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Elsie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Elsie has successfully repaid a previous loan of PHP 5,000 from PMPC. This previous loan was use to invest in expanding the business. Elsie is requesting a new loan of PHP 8,000 which will be use to invest in expanding her business.  This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Elsie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Expansion for sari-sari store.

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
K. Rano is an enterprising business owner from Dushanbe, Tajikistan. She has an attractively arranged women’s clothing store, situated in the local market, “Ganjina”. Rano has been in business for 5 years. She is married and has 3 children, a son and two daughters. Her son is currently finishing college. Rano has requested a loan of $800 USD to purchase a selection of women’s clothing. She hopes to continue to make a good profit and to earn additional income for her family. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase inventory of women's clothing.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 50-years-old. She is a widowed mother to four children. All her children are grown up and they live on their own, easing many burdens on her. Her husband died mysteriously but she never gave up her business. She works hard to provide for herself and her business. She prepares and bakes bread. She has done this business for thirty-five years now, in spite of the challenges she faces. It is with her bread business that she managed to care for her children to this level. She has customers who come to her to buy in bulk. Her only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials to meet her demand. She requests loan support to remain in business. With the loan, she believes she can provide for her family and, most especially, her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for baking bread.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma makes a living primarily from selling products to local community members. She is 47 years old, married and has five adult children. They are from the village of Dumagoc, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur. Vilma has been in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Vilma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Vilma is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Dumagoc, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en:
K. Rahima lives in Dushanbe, Tajikistan with two children. She has been selling women's clothing in one of the local markets for 5 years. Due to her highly motivated entrepreneurial spirit and meticulous survey of the market, Rahima has found her niche and customer base. Her unique ability to market her inventory and meet her customers' needs is contributing to the rapid growth of her business. However Rahima believes her venture has only started to grow and there is still great potential for further expansion. She would love to open more vending facilities. Her strategy is to increase her stock and generate additional profits which will then be reinvested in her trade. That is why Rahima is asking for a loan of $500 US to purchase new inventory and help develop and upgrade her small business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase new women's clothing to diversify inventory

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 36-year-old man. He is married but currently has no children. He lives with his wife, who is also a fish seller, in a rented apartment in their community. He trades in fresh fish, a business he has done for four years now. He takes stock of fresh from Kumasi and supplies to his customers. He said he buys on credit occasionally because he does not have enough money to buy from the suppliers. He has a larger market share since he started the business. He needs the loan to buy a bulk supply of fresh fish from the market. He requests for a loan to buy a fridge, and more fish to increase his stock of fish. This, he believes, will help him save much to support his family.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish, in bulk, to sell.

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.en:
A. Ismoil is 59 years old. He is married and the father of 5 children. Ismoil is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and to educate his children. Today, his children are working adults, thanks to his example. Ismoil is an enterprising man who constantly tries to do things better and to improve, day after day. He works hard in his fields, where he spends as much time as possible providing the necessary care, fertilizing his land and spraying to prevent the diseases that might affect his yields. Ismoil needs seeds and fertilizers to continue his difficult work, tending his crops, so that they can be taken to the capital for sale. This is why he's applying for a loan of 1350 USD. Let's be the ones who reach out our hands to help Ismoil.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase mineral fertilizer and fuels and lubricants.

loans.name: Son

texts.en: Sơn Thị Tạ was born in 1975(female). (010117060014). She lives in Đản Dị village with her husband and 2 children. She washes bicycles and motorbikes and sells soft drinks from her home. Sơn has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 VND a month from these activities. Sơn is a lender of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent, or defaults. She is now requesting a loan of 5.014.000 VND (or 280 USD) to be used to invest in her bike and motor wash store.

loans.use: To invest in her bike and motor wash store.

loans.name: Roun

texts.en:
Roun K. currently cultivates a rice crop as well as raises poultry from her home, while her husband works in construction. Roun K. requested a loan to support her farming work during the coming growing season after the heavy rains fall. She will buy fertilizer and rice seed and hire labor to plow the farmland. 
The two persons shown in the photo are Mrs. Roun K. and her husband. They have two school-age children and live in Pursat Province.

loans.use: To support her farming work

loans.name: Trifona

texts.en:
Trifona O. is from the village of Navalan, Tukuran Zambonaga del Sur. She is 23 years old. Trifona is married and has 8 adult children. To make a living, Trifona operates her retail sari-sari store.  Where she sells to tourists and local community members. Trifona has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately PHP 6,000 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Trifona joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Trifona has successfully repaid her previous loan of PHP 14,900 from PMPC.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Trifona is requesting a new loan of PHP 14,900 to be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Trifona from PMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.en:
Sabohat is a loving mother of 3 children. Since starting a family of their own, she and her husband have dedicated themselves to making and selling buns, through which they have been able to cover the basic needs of their home. Sabohat begins her workday early in the morning. Her dream is to expand her business so that she can offer her products personally, in markets, throughout the regions of her country. She hopes to be earning a greater income to be able to arrange the wedding of her darling son. For this reason, Sabohat is requesting a loan of $ 1000 US to allow her to do these things. Let’s get behind this dedicated mother to help her keep making buns and making her children’s dreams a reality.

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. loans.use: Purchasing of a new electrical oven.

loans.name: Ergash

texts.en:
R. Ergash is a very hard-working and enterprising man who works cultivating his farmland. It is from his crop that he makes his daily bread, so he tries to take care of it as best he can. Ergash is one of the most dedicated farmers and every morning the town sees him walking to his work. He is one of the most respected people in the area and is known as an example for his children and the rest of the town. The courage and earnest he puts into his job as a farmer is what stands out in this man, devoted to his family and his farmland. Nonetheless, he has had difficulties and financial problems that are bringing him irregularities and losses. For this reason Ergash is requesting your help with a loan of $900 USD to increase his production by purchasing additional seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Izzatoi

texts.ru: Иззатой является актвнымклиентом нашей организации. Она получает кредит с 2003 года.  Торговать (тканью)материалами начала 20 лет назад, когда рабтала в магазине в советское время. Имея опыт торговли она начала ездить со знакомыми за товаром. Когда могла сдавала товар оптом. Сейчас арендует помещение и расширила ассортимент тканей , от дешевых до дорогих. Кредит получила для покупки летней тканей.
texts.en:
Izzatoi is one of our active clients. She has been receiving credit since 2003. She started selling fabrics 20 years ago, when she worked at a store during the Soviet time. Having gained retail experience, Izzatoi began to travel for the merchandise with her friends. When she could, she sold goods wholesale. Currently, she is leasing a space and was able to expand her selection of fabrics from cheap to expensive. She is obtaining this loan for the purchase of summer fabrics.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of summer fabrics

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua is 28 years old. She is married and the mother of one child, a boy who is currently in school. Akua loves selling goods and this is how she makes a living. Above all, she is dedicated and time conscious to her work. She trades in bulk supplies of onions. She takes delivery of stock from the northern region of Ghana; this, she said, prevents her from using middlemen who would supply to her at higher price. For lack of capital, she requests a loan to buy bulk onions to increase her stock of goods. She has been in business for the last two years and hopes to save more for taking care of the child and for the progress of her business.

loans.use: To buy supplies of onions in bags

loans.name: Zebi

texts.en:
S. Zebi is 36 years old. She is married with three children. Zebi is a market vendor who sells confectionery. She has been in this business for 11 years. As Zebi is very popular in her neighborhood for selling fresh and tasty pastry, she tries to maintain a wide range of goods. Thus, today Zebi requests $1,000 for purchasing confectionery for selling. She and her family appreciate your support in helping her improve her business.

loans.use: Purchasing confectionary for selling and fodder for the cattle

loans.name: Tserendulam

texts.en:
Tserendulam P. is 52 and currently lives with her two daughters in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband passed away three years ago. Tserendulam had worked for the local school as a guard for dozens of years and retired in 2004. 

Upon her retirement, she started a small business due to her inadequate retirement compensation. She started making traditional clothes for locals. As she is very talented in making traditional clothes, she has been making many clothes for local artists, herders and other locals. She is well-recognized for her talent and quality clothes in the town. She now mostly makes traditional clothes by request. In addition, she started making uniforms for students at the local schools. She has recently obtained an order to make student uniforms for a local school. She requests a loan to purchase materials for making uniforms for the school.

loans.use: To purchase cottons for her business

loans.name: Masuda

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Маъсуда торгует на Школьной ярмарке канцелярскими товарами. У нее большой  ассортимент товаров, поэтому есть постоянные клиенты из разных организаций. В бизнесе ей на каникулах помогают сын и дочь. Наступает школьный сезон,поэтому она хочет закупить учебные принадлежности. Она благодарно КИВЕ за  поддержку в ее бизнесе.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Masuda sells stationary supplies at the School fair. She has a wide variety of items and this is why she has regular customers from different organizations. Her son and daughter help her with the business during the recess. The school year is approaching and this is why she wants to buy school supplies. She is thanking Kiva for the support of her business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school stationary supplies

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is divorced and the mother of four children. She is 40 years old. Her four children are in school in the community where they live. She is a single mother, and for that reason she works hard to provide for her children in terms of food and school bills. She never gives up. 

She prepares and sells roasted corn and roasted plantains by the roadside in her community. Roasted corn and plantains is enjoyed by many Ghanaians and it’s superb if it is eaten with fried peanuts or hard coconut. She is requesting a loan to buy corn and plantains in bulk to prepare meals for her customers. It is her dream to save more to take care of the children's educational needs.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of maize and plantains.

loans.name: Munisa

texts.en:
Munisa S. is 46 years old. She started her own business two years ago in order to support her husband with the family's expenses. She is a market vendor in Istaravshan town. 

Munisa purchases sweets from a local confectioner and sells them in the local market as a wholesale. Munisa, being very polite and talkative by nature, has a lot of customers, which allows her to sell her goods immediately. The inventory she has for sale is of very good quality and selection. 

Munisa is seeking to keep her business sustainable and has requested a loan of $600 USD to increase the inventory she has for sale. One of her plans for the future is to open a vending facility in order to expand her business. We believe this current loan will enhance the potential of her business and help Munisa reach all of her aspirations. 
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Enlarging the range of goods and purchasing a private store with the increased revenue

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
  Гулчехра моладая девушка с малых лет помогала маме в торговле веников. Она торгует на рынке Панчшанбе города Худжанда. Товар она привозит из Бегобада который находится на границе Узбекистана. Из-за того что в Таджикистане существует  ограничение электроэнергии  спрос на веники большой, потому что нет возможности пользоваться пылесосом. Поэтому Гулчехра хочет на запрашиваемый займ закупить веники и благодарит КИВУ за поддержку в ее бизнесе.
texts.en:
Gulchehra is a young woman, who has been helping her mother sell brooms since childhood years. She sells at the Panchshanbe market in the city of Khujand. She brings the merchandise from Begobad, which is located on the border with Uzbekistan. Because there are limitations on energy use in Tajikistan, and it is impossible to use vacuum cleaners, demand for brooms is high. This is why Gulchehra wants to use this loan to buy more brooms, and she is grateful to Kiva for supporting her business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of brooms

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica, a 50-year-old trader, is divorced and the mother of four children. Three of her children work and the fourth is in school. She is a very resourceful mother to her family. 

She supports her children through the sale of used clothing and shoes. Selling used clothing has a very big market in Ghana as brand new clothes are very expensive. Therefore selling used clothing has created a market for many Ghanaian women like Monica. 

She buys her stock of goods from the nearby city center called Kumasi; she started her business four years ago. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing and shoes to increase her inventory. She believes this loan would help her to save more for her children's education and also to rent a store to trade.

loans.use: To buy increased bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Erdenebaatar

texts.en:
Erdenebaatar Batmonh is a 27-year-old and lives with his wife and newborn daughter in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. When Erdenebaatar got married recently, his parents let him and his wife have their own two-bedroom apartment and moved themselves to a ger (a traditional felt-walled tent) in the suburb of the city. 

Erdenebaatar runs a small motorcycle repair shop where he fixes motorcycles and sells various second-hand accessories.  His repair shop is very close to his home as well as the major paved road in the town that most of his customers use to visit to the shop.  He travels to Ulaanbaatar three to four times a month to get supplies for his shop. 

He would eventually like to expand his shop by offering more diverse services and products related to motorcycles. He also says that he works hard to make extra money with which he would like to build a new house for his parents. He says that his parents let him have their apartment and now are living in a tiny ger. He would like to give back to his parents as soon as he is financially able to accomplish it. 

He requests a loan to purchase more motorcycle accessories for his repair shop.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Subatullo

texts.en:
Subatullo S. was born in 1968. He is married with two children. As an aspiring and hard-working man, he has always dreamed of achieving success in whatever he does. For the past 12 years, Subatullo has been growing wheat and potatoes on his land. His sons help him with the business. 

Subatullo wants his children to get a good education, thus allowing them to have a better chance to succeed in the future -- this is what makes his sacrifice worthwhile. 

Currently Subatullo requests $1,100 USD in order to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer. He plans to use the profits from his business to educate his children, improve the structure of his home and improve the standard of living of his family.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora O. sells provisions. She is 50 years old and married with eight children. She is requesting a loan of N80,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Gulshoda

texts.en:
Gulshoda is a woman with much courage who strives to provide for her four children, including food on the table and an education. She has always worked to provide every member of her home with health and well-being. Every day, she goes to the fields, where she is now growing potatoes, wheat and maize. 

Gulshoda was taught farming techniques by her parents as a child and the nature of her work and her eagerness to get ahead in life motivate her in tending her farm every day. Consequently, her farm products are consistently of better and higher quality. Gulshoda needs your support, with this loan, in investing in high quality seeds and fertilizer and improving her harvest. This is why she requires a loan of $900. Let's support this great effort by a mother who wants the best for her children.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand business/ buy livestock

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Oyunchimeg N. is a 45-year-old widow who lives with her three sons and one daughter in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His children's ages range from 19 to 26. Oyunchimeg is a very entrepreneurial woman. Since 1992, she has been involved in many types of small business. Her first business was importing cheap clothes from Ereen, China, a border town from where many cheap Chinese products are imported. Since 2004, she has been selling cut wood to local carpenters. Within five years, she expanded the business, with her business capital increasing from 1,000,000 MNT to 3,400,000 MNT.

Now Oyunchimeg would like to open a small internet cafe to offer internet services and computer games to local people. She sees a great market opportunity as many local young people are really getting into internet surfing and computer games. She is committed to making the internet cafe a success as her private businesses are the sole source of family income. All of her children are top students at their respective high schools, and Oyunchimeg wants to make sure that they all continue their studies at the universities of their choice and pursue their dreams. She says that she works very hard to make all this come true.

Oyunchimeg is requesting a loan to purchase computers and internet access for her new internet cafe.

loans.use: To purchase computers and internet access for her internet cafe

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva is 32 years old and a married mother of three beautiful children. She lives with her husband and children in a single room apartment. She is a forceful achiever and is very committed to her work. She trades in assorted soaps and detergent, and she also sells sachet water in bulk. Eva takes delivery of soap from the nearby city of Kumasi. Mostly she sells her goods by hawking them at market centers and from house to house. Due to the nature of her business she has become very popular in her community. However, lack of adequate funds means that she is not able to buy more stock, making it difficult to make enough profit. Eva desires to save more for her children's education, and with her two years of selling experience she is sure that she can repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy assorted soaps, detergents and sachet water

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chickens and poultry food

loans.name: Norkul

texts.en:
K. Norkul lives in Shahrituz, Tajikistan, and is dedicated to the cattle business. From very early in the morning he tends to the animals. He returns in the afternoons, having been exposed to the sun and exhausted from all his dilligent work, in order to bring food to his table for his wife and beloved five children. Norkul says that he works with only one aim in mind – to provide his children with a proper education. Now, Norkul would like to expand his business and purchase two calves. For this purpose, he has applied for a loan of 5100 TJS and with your help he hopes to reach his aim. Be an important part of the growth of Norkul’s business.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. loans.use: To purchase two calves

loans.name: Rahima

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Атабаевой Рахиме 45 лет . Вдова имеет пятерих детей. Занимается откормом и продажей скота. Она откармливает скот дома затем их продает. В этом ей помогают дети. Она также занимается переработкой козьей шерсти и производством шерстяной нити.  На запрашиваемый займ хочет увеличить поголовье скота.
texts.en:
Rahima A. is 45 years old. She is a widow and has five children. She is involved in feeding and selling livestock. Rahima feeds the livestock at home and then sells it. Her children help her with this business. She also processes goat fleece and makes wool yarn. Rahima wants to use this loan to increase her livestock headcount.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of small livestock

loans.name: Subankul

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
 Эрматов Субанкул 1966 года рождения, женат имеет пятерых детей. У Субанкула есть стадо мелко-рогатого  скота. Его жена домохозяйка занимается переработкой молока и продает на рынке. Субанкул хочет приобрести коз для того чтобы в дальнейшем занимается переработкой шерсти и вязанием разных теплых вещей.
texts.en:
Born in 1966, Subankul A. is married and has five children. Subankul owns a herd of small livestock. His wife is a homemaker, who processes milk and sells it at a market. Subankul wants to purchase goats in order to process fleece and knit various warm items in the future.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goats

loans.name: Akram

texts.en:
A. Akram is 36 years old, and is married with two children. Akram sells sweets such as candies, cookies, pastries and fruit jellies. He has been in this business for about 18 years. The income he generates allows him to support his family, for whom he is the sole breadwinner. Now, Akram is requesting 8000 TJS to purchase sweets to enlarge the range of goods he offers. Akram thanks you for all your support and promises to repay the loan in time.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase confectionery to enlarge his range of goods

loans.name: Misséhounton Cléméntine

texts.en: Misséhounton Cléméntine L. was born on September 29, 1967, in southern Benin. She is married and the mother of three children, who are all still in her care. Cléméntine owns a small food stall where she sells food and drink. Her business is in Cotonou neighborhood near a Beninese company that manufactures fabrics, called Sobetex. This is a good location as there is always a steady stream of Sobetex employees who eat at her stall during lunch. Cléméntine is seeking a loan from Kiva partner, Alidé, in order to restock her supplies. She would like to purchase rice, corn, millet, and drinks. Cléméntine hopes to expand her operations and, ultimately, to increase her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice, corn, millet, and drinks

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina is 48 years old and a married mother of six children. Two of her children have finished senior school while the others are still in school. Georgina is a trader in salt, which she supplies to food vendors and others. She travels to Accra to buy her salt, but she is only able to buy a few bags at a time as she does not have enough money to buy more. This means she has to travel to Accra frequently. She spoke to her husband and some family members about financial assistance, but to no avail. She is requesting a loan to buy salt in bulk as this will reduce her travelling. She dreams of being able to save more so that she can support her children's education.

loans.use: To buy salt in bulk

loans.name: Ismatilla

texts.en:
U. Ismatilla is 42 years old and lives with his wife and four children, to whom he is a devoted father. He makes the most of every opportunity, such as when he started selling candies in the food market at Dushanbe. He gives his business constant attention all day long every day, and in this way he has attracted customers. His income enables him to contribute to the home finances. This is an activity Ismatilla enjoys because he can rest from his hard labor in the countryside. He is motivated in his work by the need to support the family finances and take care of his children's education in school. Ismatilla is requesting a loan with which he will invest in merchandise for his shop. He wishes to stock it with more products and offer the best products every day.

More about Tajikistan

It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others.
