To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase candies to enlarge his range of goods

loans.name: Hiroson

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 





Зарипова Хиросон женщина 1965-го года рождения, замужем, мать 4-х детей, образование среднее. Торгует на рынке около 3-х лет. Она занимается продажей мужскими одеждами на рынке «Корвон». Хиросон просит кредит для закупки новой партии летних мужских брюк. Она хочет получить займ в сумме 4000 сроком на 8 месяцев и благодарит кредиторов за поддержку.
texts.en:
Born in 1965, Hiroson Z. is married and is a mother of 4 children. She has secondary education. Hiroson has been selling at a market for almost 3 years. She sells men's clothing at the Korvon market. Hiroson is requesting a loan for the purchase of a new stock of men's summer trousers. She wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 4000 somoni and is grateful to creditors for the support.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of men's trousers

loans.name: Munovar

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
  Муновар 1987 года рождения замужем . С малых лет Муновар помогала родителям ухаживать за скотом. Теперь она самостоятельно занимается откормом мелкого-рогатого скота. В этом ей помогает муж. Она планирует на новый займ  купить барана и благодарит кредиторов за помощь   в осуществлении ее планов.
texts.en:
Munovar was born in 1987. She is married. Since childhood, Munovar had been helping her parents take care of livestock. Now, she is independently involved in feeding small livestock. Her husband helps her as well. Munovar plans to use this new loan to purchase a ram and thanks creditors for the help in accomplishing her goals.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a ram

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew is 30 years old and a married father of three children. He has managed to send all his children to school. He has been a carpenter for four years now, and carpentry is his main source of livelihood. Andrew is very hardworking and dedicated to his work. He owns a carpentry shop where he manufactures all kinds of furniture, such as chairs, wardrobes, beds etc. However, because he lacks adequate working capital, he is not able to pre-finance most of his customer orders. This slows his work down because he has to wait for funds from his customers before any work can begin, often resulting in delays. He is requesting a loan to procure useful working tools and furnishing materials such as polish, glue, sandpaper, wooden board etc. to improve his efficiency. Andrew believes this will improve his income and ensure a good standard of living for his family.

loans.use: To procure useful working tools and furnishing materials such as polish, glue, sandpaper etc.

loans.name: Sittinona

texts.en:
Sittinona E. is one of the pioneer members of the CCT Credit Cooperative in her community. She lives with her husband, a jeepney driver and mechanic, and their three school-aged children. Sittinona's family is also one of the earliest recipients of a row-house unit in the Habitat for Humanity Housing Project, in BASECO Compound, Port Area, Manila.

Sittinona started a small general store in 2003. When she joined CCT in 2005, she was able to keep her store going and growing. The store, located at the heart of the Habitat and near the school, caters to customers from all over. Sittinona took advantage of its location near the school by adding school supplies to satisfy the high demand from elementary students at a nearby school. Sittinona will use this loan to expand the inventory in her store.

Just last year, Sittinona received another heaven-sent blessing – she and her husband were able to buy a passenger jeepney, which her husband drives every day. They use their combined income from the store and the jeepney's daily income to support the education of their three children. Sittinona dreams of acquiring another vehicle to transport her inventory from the market.

About CCT
CCT is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered on the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: Inventory for her store

loans.name: Aktam

texts.en:
This is K. Aktam. He is married with 5 children. K. is filled with enthusiasm and works hard preparing and selling the a local pie called “sambusa” . In a small place which he rents, he makes the pies with course flour and meat baked in coals according to the old recipes.  He has big plans and dreams of improving his business. When he was very young, Aktam learned a great deal about sambusa preparation from his mother and that is why he decided to dedicate himself to this work. His goal is to have his own place where he can offer more comforts to his customers, and he'd like to buy a refrigerator so he can begin to offer cold drinks as well. Aktam is requesting an individual loan of 3000 Somoni. He wants to purchase the necessary supplies of foodstuffs for preparing  “sambusa” pies and also to improve his business. He is very motivated to grow his business and increase his income. With his efforts, and your important contribution, Aktam can reach his goals. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase supplies of foodstuffs for preparing  “sambusa” pies and improve his business.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is 42 years old. She is happily married with 4 children.  She sells cooked foods and drinks. Eunice has been in this business for the past 19 years and she has been able to use her years of experience to retain her customers. She lives in Lagos and she is requesting for the loan of N150, 000 to purchase more supplies of drinks and food stuff. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies of drinks and foodstuff

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 24 years old. She is married and mother with one (boy) child and he has been breastfeed. She works very hard supporting her husband to earn enough for their family's upkeep. She works hard to provide for herself and her business. She has been preparing and baking bread for four years.  She is also a teacher and teaches in the primary level at a community school. She manages to combines her busy schedule to meet her deadlines. Her only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials to meet her needs. She requests a loan support to buy raw materials to remain in business.

loans.use: To buy baking materials such as bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry and poultry food

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Мамлакат кредитор в организации несколько лет.Она берёт кредиты на увеличение ассортимента мужской, женской одежды и обуви.Следующий кредит Мамлакат хочет использовать на завоз мужской летней обуви.В день мониторинга Мамлакат отсутствовала, была в отъезде за товаром.Поэтому на снимке её муж продаёт мужскую обувь
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Mamlakat has been our client for several years. She takes loans to increase the assortment of men's and women's clothing and shoes. Her next loan Mamlakat wants to use to bring in men's summer shoes. During the screening Mamlakat was absent, she was out buying the merchandise. This is why her husband is on the picture selling men's shoes.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand shoe sales business

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina, a 38-year-old trader, is married and the mother of four children, all in school, the eldest attending university.  Georgina has been selling onions, rice, tinned tomatoes, pepper, etc. at the local market for 22 years, a business that has enabled her to support her children’s education.  For some time now, however, she has been facing challenges in her business due to inadequate funds and is therefore requesting a loan to enable her to buy increased stocks of tinned tomatoes, bags of rice, onions, and pepper in order to grow her business. She hopes to increase her savings to better support the children’s education to give them a future filled with hope. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy increased stocks of rice, onions, tinned tomatoes, pepper and other spices, etc.

loans.name: Mahmudova

texts.ru: Махфират Махмудова  1963 года рождения, замужем имеет  2 детей. Имеет среднее образование. Торгует на рынке детской , мужской и женской одеждой. Торгует на рынке более 15 лет. С нашей организацией сотрудничает более 5 лет. Предыдущий кредит получила для торговли летней одежды.  По ее словам в основном покупатели женщины. Они покупают женскую одежду, а также для своих малышей. Ей необходимо  закупить товар на осений и школьный сезон.
texts.en:
M. Mahmudova was born in 1963, she is married and has two children. She has secondary education. She sells children's, men's and women's clothing on the market. She has been selling for more than fifteen years. She has been working with our organization for more than five years. Her previous loan she received for selling of summer clothing. Mahrifat says that her main customers are women. They buy women's clothing and also for their babies. She needs to buy the merchandise for the fall and school season.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fall and school merchandise

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena is 26 years old. She is a wife and mother of three children who are currently in school. She has operated a clothing shop for the past six years and sells jeans, cloth, blouses, skirts, women slippers, dressing bags and headscarves. She is currently constrained with funds to operate the business as a result of a business expansion. She needs the loan to enable her to inject more working capital and scale up her business. She believes the loan will help her to upgrade her inventory by purchasing good quality and a larger quantity of products. With the loan, she wants to purchase jeans cloth, ladies wears, headscarves and slippers. Her plan is to save more for the children's future.

loans.use: To purchase supplies of jeans cloth, ladies wears and slippers.

loans.name: Nuriniso

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Нуринисо на полученный повторный кредит планирует съездить в Истаравшан и привезти несколько видов мужских летних брюк.Она пунктуальная заёмщица и ни разу не нарушала условий организации.Нуринисо благодарна KIVA за понимание и поддержку в финансировании.

Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Nuriniso plans to use this repeat loan to travel to Istaravshan and bring several kinds of men's summer trousers. She is a punctual client and has never broken the policy of our organization. Nuriniso is thankful to Kiva for understanding and financial support.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fulfill the assortment of men's clothing

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en: Gertrude is 38 years old and is a divorced mother of six children. Currently all her children attend school. She sells smoked fish and started her fish selling business 20 years ago at the community market where she lives. She buys her stock of fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana and sells them from a table stand and sometimes through hawking. She prepares and serves her customers with a very tasty and good quality fish and because of that many customers buy from her stand. She has a high customer base. Many travel from other parts and from the surrounding communities to buy her fish. She requests the loan to increase and upgrade her stock of fish. She hopes to provide her children with a quality education through the proceeds of the business. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more stock of smoked and dried fish.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 53 years old and lives in Lagos State.  She is married with 6 children. She has a small business selling eggs. Sarah has requested and hopes to receive a loan in the amount of N150, 000 to purchase more eggs to sell. She promises to pay back the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs to sell

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia is 45 years old. She is married and is the mother of three children. Her elder son is a carpenter, while the other two are still schooling.

Afia sells smoked fish at the community market where she lives and started her fish sales twenty-one years ago. She buys her stock of fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana and sells them on a table in the market and sometimes through hawking (selling door-to-door). She prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish and, because of that, many customers buy from her stand.

Afia requests the loan to upgrade her stock of fish. She dreams of giving her children a quality education through the proceeds from her business.

loans.use: To buy more smoked fish and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Diapo Pointe Sarrène Group

texts.fr: Nous avons décidé de créer un groupe restreint pour pouvoir mettre sur pied une entreprise durable avec un nombre limité de 05membres. Nous voulons faire du commerce de produits halieutiques que nous comptons acheter chez les producteurs , les transformer et ensuite les revendre en ville ou dans les marchés hebdomadaires qui s'organisent toutes les semaines autour de notre village, dans les hôtels de la région comme Pointe Sarrène est un site touristique , mais aussi dans les grandes villes du Sénégal. Ce financement nous permettra de faire des économies pour subvenir à nos besoins et ceux de nos familles.
texts.en:
We have decided to create a limited group to be able to establish a lasting enterprise with a membership limited to five. We want to do commerce in seafood products that we intend to buy from producers, to process, and then to resell in town or in the weekly markets that are organized every week around our village and in regional hotels, such as Pointe Sarrène, a tourist site, and also in the big cities in Senegal.  This financing will allow us to save some money to provide for our needs and those of our families.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To process and trade in seafood products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Norly

texts.en: Norly V. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 38 years old, is married, and has an adult child. Norly owns and operates a service-based business providing motor-cab-for-hire services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Norly joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Norly is requesting a new loan of 13,500 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate their house

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa started her fish-selling business fourteen years ago in a market where she currently lives. She prepares and serves her customers with very tasty fish in the market and for that reason she is popular with many. She buys stocks of fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Many people buy from her in the market place.

Adwoa is 40 years old, married, and the mother of four children. Currently two of her children are schooling. She requests the loan to buy an increased stock of assorted fresh fish to make increased sales and income to support her children’s education and her business growth. She hopes to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy more smoked fish and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna J. is a 53-year-old woman living in the town of Dasmarinas, Cavite. She is married and has three adult children. All but one are still in college.

Edna owns and operates a business running a bakery, primarily selling bread and pastries and other grocery items in the local community. She started with a meager capital of Php 7,000 when she opened her business four years ago. She now earns approximately Php 5,000 a day. Her bakery employs five bakers.

Upon the invitation of her friends, Edna joined CCT Credit Cooperative in 2007 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has applied for a Php 12,000 loan from CCT. She will use the loan proceeds to purchase additional grocery items to sell in her bakery/grocery store and raw materials like flour, sugar, and lard used in bread production. She dreams of owning a delivery van so she can also sell her bread and pastries in nearby towns.

About CCT
CCT is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered on the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: Grocery merchandise and raw materials for bread production

loans.name: Rahmatchon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Рахматчон мужчина , который занимается откормом и продажей скота.Помимо этого он занимается дехканским хозяйством, он имеет земельный участок и выращивает там лук и картофель.Имеет с этого хороший доход.Рахматчон на следующий займ хочет увеличить численность скота, купить ещё пару молодых быков и корм для них.

Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Rahmatchon is a man who feeds and sells cattle. Besides that he is also a supervisor in a farm and has a plot of land where he grows onions and potatoes. He has good income from this. Rahmatchon wants to use his next loan to increase the number of cattle and buy a couple more calves and fodder for them.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For feeding and selling of cattle

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is 32 years old, married and has three children attending school. She sells grocery products like rice, fresh tomatoes, tin tomatoes, cocoa products, skimmed milk, etc. in her neighborhood market. She started her business six years ago. Her experience in selling food products has made her one of the successful retailers in the market. She considers the loan a great opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy cartons of milk, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable and palm oil to increase her stock of goods available for sale.

loans.use: To buy cartons of milk, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetables etc.

loans.name: Noraida

texts.en:
Noraida T. is a 62-year old transport operator managing a fleet of three motorized tricycles plying the route of Baseco-Delpan-Divisoria in Port Area, Manila.  She lives with her husband Mama, 65 and their 3 adult children.  They belong to the Islam faith.

She started with her business in 2005 with just one motorized tricycle.  The demand for transportation in their community picked up with the establishment of Habitat for Humanity Community Housing. In the same year she purchased her first motorized tricycle and then had to purchase a second one.  She joined the CCT Credit Cooperative in 2004, at that time she was only managing two pedicabs (a manually operated tricycle with no engine).  She disposed off these manual tricycles in 2005.

Just recently, she bought her third motorcycle.  Her son is now test-driving this with a sidecar is mounted to it.  She has just finished paying off her CCT loan of Php 10,000.00 which she used to pay for the down payment for her third motorcycle.  She took a new loan in the amount of Php 12,000.00 to purchase and refurbish a second-hand side-car to be mounted on her newly purchased motorcycle.

Noraida is very proud of having been part of the CCT Credit Cooperative.  She is even delighted to see her neighbors taking rounds in driving her motorized tricycles for a living.  She dreams of owning a taxicab someday. 

CCT is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered on the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To purchase and repair of a second-hand sidecar for motrized tricycle operation

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is 31 years old. She is married woman with three children and currently all her children attend school. She sells frozen foods like chicken, mutton, fish, meat, etc. at the local market. She travels to Kumasi to purchase her supplies of goods from the importers. She makes sure she buys only what she can afford. She has realized that her capital is not sufficient enough to meet the demands of her customers. This has affected her operation, especially in the face of increasing food prices. With the loan, she wants to purchase additional cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken, pork and meat to enable her to expand her business. It is her dream to give her children an education and she would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken, mutton etc.

loans.name: Frozen Fish Mongers Group

texts.en:
This is Kadiatu T., Sama T., Kadiatu S., Hawa K., and Abie J.. They named their group Frozen Fish Mongers, picking a name that reflects their trade. They are all local entrepreneurs in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. This is not their first loan from Kiva through SMT. They all previously received several loans from Kiva through SMT. Each member of the group received a loan of Le 1,200,000 during the last loan cycle. That loan created meaningful impacts in the lives of these borrowers. They were able to use the proceeds to pay for their children’s school fees. They’re also able to feed and clothe themselves and their children with the income generated from the loans. Today, they are requesting a loan of Le 1,300,000 each to buy more cartons of frozen fish to add to their businesses.

Kadiatu (back row, right) is the leader of the group. She is forty-five years of age. She was born in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a businessman and the couple has four children. Two of her children are in college and two are in secondary schools. Kadiatu has been a businesswoman for over twenty years now.

Kadiatu, like the rest of the group members, sells frozen fish. With this new loan, she will expand her business. She will be able to buy about ten cartons of frozen fish. She usually travels to Freetown to buy the fish. The fare to Freetown is Le 12,000 and she usually pays a delivery fee of Le 1,000 per carton. In Freetown, the price for a carton of fish ranges between Le 65,000 to Le 95,000 depending on the type and quality.

So far, Kadiatu faces no serious challenge in her business that are worth noting. Business is going fine and well. She enjoys what she does for a living. To Kadiatu and her colleagues in the group, an increase in profit means making their lives better. They will be able to take good care of their children, specifically their educational and nutritional needs, and save some money for emergencies.

loans.use: To buy additional frozen fish to sell

loans.name: Nanoor Godaguene Ii Group

texts.fr: Nanoor Godaguene II  est un groupe de femmes habitant prés du village sandiara localité située à 25 km de la ville Mbour .Elles s’activent dans l’agriculture,  le petit commerce et l’embouche. Avec le début de l’hivernage elles sollicitent un prêt pour financer leurs différentes activités génératrices de revenus leur unique source de revenu pendant cette période. Les revenus tirés de cette activité leur permettent de nourrir leurs familles en attendant les récoltes.
texts.en:
Nanoor Godaguene II is a group of women living near Sandiara, a village located 25 km from Mbour City. They are active in agriculture, small-scale commerce, and the fattening of livestock. With the beginning of the off-season, they are requesting a loan to finance their different income-generating activities, which are their only sources of revenues during this period. The revenues enable them to feed their families while waiting for harvest time.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster their businesses

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 25 years old. She is a wife and the mother of four children who are currently in school. She is a trader who trades in clothing, such as jeans, blouses, skirts, women's slippers, and so on. She supports her children through the proceeds from the business. She sells through hawking (house-to-house selling).

Gladys is currently constrained by lack of funds to run the business as a result of business expansion. She needs this loan to enable her inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will help her to have the resources to purchase a large quantity of good quality clothing to upgrade her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase clothes such as jeans, ladies wear, and slippers

loans.name: Frozen Fish Monger Group

texts.en:
This is Marie I., Fatmata J., Rugiatu K., and Hawa S.. They named their group Frozen Fish Mongers. They are all local entrepreneurs in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. They have received several loans from Kiva through SMT. Previous loans have created meaningful impacts in the lives of these borrowers. They were able to use the proceeds to pay for their children’s school fees. They’re also able to feed and clothe themselves and their children with the income generated from the loans. Now, they are requesting a loan of Le 1,300,000 each to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Marie I. (right) is the leader of the group. She is thirty-seven years of age. She was born in Makeni City. Her husband is a teacher and the the couple has six children. One of their children is in college, one is not yet of school age, and the rest are in primary and secondary schools. Marie has been a businesswoman for over twenty years now.

Marie sells frozen fish. She will use this new loan to expand her business by buying more cartons of frozen fish. A carton of fish usually cost her in Freetown something like Le 65,000.00, 75,000, or 95,000.00, depending on the type and quality.

loans.use: To buy additional frozen fish to sell

loans.name: Young Tourist Group

texts.en:
This is Amidu K., Adamsay K., Alie K., and Mohammed K.. They call their group Young Tourists. This will be the fifth loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from Kiva through SMT. Previous loans were very helpful in the businesses and lives of these people. Their businesses, and thus their livelihoods, grow. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are requesting a new loan in order to further strengthen their businesses. They are seeking a loan of Le 1,300,000.00 each.

Amidu K. (middle) is the leader of this group. Amidu was born in Makeri, about twenty-two miles from Makeni City. He is thirty-seven years of age. Amidu is married to a business woman who sells slippers; they have three children. Two of their children are in primary schools and one is still young. Amidu sells slippers and has been in the business since 1994.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 62 years old and the mother of five children. Three attend school and the other two are working.

To support her household, Martha has been selling cereals like beans, onions, and groundnuts in the neighborhood to her loyal customers. She lives in a cocoa farming community, which makes her goods more in demand. She says that selling these products is very lucrative, and therefore she wants a loan to expand her inventory. She started her business with a small amount of working capital but now her customer base has increased. She wants the loan to meet those hard pressing demand. The loan will enable her make a better income to support her family, especially in their education.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cereals like groundnut, onions, and beans

loans.name: Nanoor Godaguene I Group

texts.fr: Nanoor Godaguene I  est un groupe de femmes habitant prés du village sandiara localité située à 25 km de la ville Mbour .Elles s’activent dans l’agriculture,  le petit commerce et l’embouche. Avec le début de l’hivernage elles sollicitent un prêt pour financer leurs différentes activités génératrices de revenus leur unique source de revenu pendant cette période. Les revenus tirés de cette activité leur permettent de nourrir leurs familles en attendant les récoltes
texts.en:
Nanoor Godaguene I is a group of women living near the village of Sandiara, located 25 km from the city of Mbour. The women are active in agriculture, small-scale commerce, and the fattening of livestock. With the beginning of the off-season, they are requesting a loan to finance their different income-generating activities, which are their only sources of revenues during this period. These revenues enable them to feed their families as they waiting for the harvests.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster their businesses

loans.name: Haitgul

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
     Хайтгул – молодая женщина 25 лет, замужем но пока детей не имеет. Её муж занимается купле -продажей скота на скотном рынке. А она откармливает крупнорогатый скот дома. Она помогает мужу в развитии его бизнеса, потому что хочет иметь больше прибыли, чтобы расширять семью, так как Хайтгул готовится стать матерью. За счет займа Хайтгул и её муж хотят увеличить количество скота и  получить больше прибыли. Хайтгул кредитуется в нашей организации два года. Это ее четвертый займ за этот период. Хайтгул всегда целенаправленно использует свой займ и поэтому она смогла помочь мужу для увеличения количества своего скота. Она благодарит нас и КИВУ за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Haitgul is a young 25-year-old woman. She is married and does not yet have children. Her husband is involved in buying and selling livestock at a livestock market. And she feeds cattle at home. Haitgul helps her husband with developing his business because she wants to have more profit in order to expand their family, especially since Haitgul is getting ready to become a mother. Haitgul and her husband want to use this loan to increase their livestock quantity and make a bigger profit. Haitgul has been a client of our organization for two years. This is her fourth loan during this time period. Haitgul always uses her loans purposefully and because of this, she has been able to help her husband in increasing quantity of livestock. She thanks us and Kiva for the financial support.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing livestock quantity

loans.name: Halimajon

texts.en:
A. Halimajon is an enterprising woman with a big desire to improve the quality of life of her family. She is a widow and has a son. Halimajon has been a seamstress since she was very young having learned in tailoring school. She has been successful because her customers recognize the high quality of her products. She is constantly adding new clients and has seen her business grow. Today Halimajon is applying for a loan from IMON International for the fourth time. She is requesting a loan of 9100 Somoni to purchase more materials for sewing national dresses. You can help improve the quality of life of Halimajon’s family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase materials for sewing national dresses

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana trades in Ghana-made slippers of different kinds. She has in stock women's, kids' and men's styles of slippers. She takes delivery of stock from Kumasi. Kumasi is the center for most of the made-in-Ghana manufactured slippers. The industry has created lots of marketing opportunities for many Ghanaians like Nana.

Nana is 41years old, divorced and the mother of two children. One has finished senior high school and the other is still in school. Nana works very hard to help the father take care of the family. The goods she purchases are very expensive because of the quality leather and materials used. She is requesting a loan to buy a supply of slippers in bulk to increase her inventory so that she can save towards her children's education.

loans.use: To buy Ghana-made slippers in bulk

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida is 42 years old. She is a married woman with four children who are all in school. Vida has been a retailer for the last seven years and with this business activity, she takes care of her children. She is a very hard working woman and her children love her dearly. She sells cereals such as maize, groundnut, beans and other food items. She buys from the farmers of these crops directly and at a relatively low price. She sells at the local market in the town where she lives with her family. As well, she treks with some of her goods to nearby markets to sell . She says she wants to use the loan to buy supplies of goods in bulk so that she can distribute to a greater number of customers.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of cereal for resale

loans.name: Sharafidin

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
       Шарафидин - мужчина 50 лет . Женат и отец 5-х детей. Шарафидин занимается купле-продажей скота на скотном рынке. Он закупает скот и продает сразу же, если найдется хороший клиент. Или продает через неделю или две недели. Шарафидин закупает скот дешево по 5-10 голов и продает их в розницу подороже. Таким образом Шарафидин зарабатывает на жизнь и оборачивает свой капитал. Шарафидин содержит всю семью. Ему помогают сыновья. Шарафидин кредитуется в нашей организации более 2-х лет. Он всегда целенаправленно использует свой займ. Шарафидин благодарен кредитной организации за финансовую помощь.
texts.en:
Sharafidin is a 50-year-old man. He is married and is a father of 5 children. Sharafidin is involved in buying and selling livestock at a livestock market. He buys livestock and sells it right away, if he finds a good customer, or sells it after one or two weeks. Sharafidin buys livestock at a low cost, 5-10 heads at a time and sells it retail at a higher cost. This is how Sharafidin makes a living and turns over his capital. Sharafidin support his whole family. His sons help him. Sharafidin has been our client for over 2 years. He always uses his loans purposefully. Sharafidin thanks our credit organization for the financial help.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Muidinkhoja

texts.en:
O. Muidinkhoja is 27 years old. He is in the business of selling DVD disks. He tries to have all the latest movies, concerts of the popular actors, singers and others. He also sells cell phones produced in China. Being the owner of the business, Muidinkhoja  travels to the neighboring country, China, to purchase newer and modern cell phones at wholesale prices. For that reason, the retail prices of his products are lower than his competitors, allowing him to maintain a large clientele in this market. Today, Muidinkhoja is requesting a loan of $2000 USD. He is planning to purchase a large supple of DVD disks and cell phones to increase the quantity and variety of his goods. Muidinkhoja thanks all for supporting him and promises to be diligent in his loan payment.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase a large supply of DVD disks and cell phones

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is 44 years old. She is a widow and mother of five children. Three of the children attend school and the elder children are farmers. As a single mother, she works very hard to finance her childrens education . For the past nine years, Abena has prepared and baked bread. In spite of the challenges she faces, her bread business brings hope to her family. 

She has customers who come to her to buy bread in bulk, and sometimes she sells through hawking. Her only problem now is finding adequate funds to buy raw materials to meet her customers demands. She is requesting a loan to support her business needs and improving her ability to save for her children education.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood etc.

loans.name: Juboo Beuge Khadim Group

texts.fr: JUBOO BEUGE KHADIM est un groupe de femmes habitant prés du village sandiara localité située à 25 km de la ville Mbour .Elles s’activent dans l’agriculture,  le petit commerce et l’embouche. Avec le début de l’hivernage elles sollicitent un prêt pour financer leurs différentes activités génératrices de revenus leur unique source de revenu pendant cette période. Les revenus tirés de cette activité leur permettent de nourrir leurs familles en attendant les récoltes.
texts.en:
JUBOO BEUGE KHADIM is a group of women living near the village of Sandiara, located 25 km from the city of Mbour. The women are active in agriculture, small-scale commerce, and the fattening of livestock. With the beginning of the off-season, they are requesting a loan to finance their different income-generating activities, which are their only sources of revenues during this period. These revenues enable them to feed their families as they waiting for the harvests.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama, a 45-year-old divorced mother of a daughter who is a seamstress, has sole responsibility for the child, and business progress rests on her shoulders. Determined to provide for her daughter through hard work and commitment, Ama has been hawking cosmetics including spray, powder, lip gloss, blouses etc., and baby products such as diapers, napkins, etc. for five years now.  She says that selling cosmetics is very lucrative, and she now wants to expand her inventory to increase her income in order to sponsor her child’s education. Ama is confident that your loan support will help her to achieve that goal.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of cosmetics and baby products.

loans.name: Ubaidullo

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
      Убайдулло пожилой мужчина 60 лет. Он женат и отец 6-х детей. Его жена нигде не работает. Она сидит дома и делает домашнюю работу, кормит скот. Убайдулло занимается откормом и продажей скота. Наступление лета для Убайдулло – это сезон закупа скота, потому, что летом скот и его корм стоит дешево. И для откорма скота не надо много тратиться. Скот ест горную траву, и Убайдулло экономит на корме скота. С наступлением зимы Убайдулло продает часть откормившегося скота. Но он не покупает скот. Он покупает корм, для откорма оставшегося скота.
texts.en:
Ubaidullo is an elderly 60-year-old man. He is married and is a father of 6 children. His wife is not employed. She stays at home, does domestic work and feeds livestock. Ubaidullo is involved in feeding and selling livestock. Summer time for Ubaidullo is the season for purchasing livestock because livestock and animal feed prices are cheaper during the summer. And he does not need to spend very much on feeding livestock. Livestock eats mountain grass, allowing Ubaidullo to save on livestock feed. At the onset of winter, Ubaidullo sells some of the fed livestock, but he does not buy new livestock. He buys animal feed for the remaining livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feeding and sales

loans.name: Asana

texts.en:
Asana is a 54-year-old woman. She is divorced and is the mother of three children. All her children are working except her little child who is schooling. She works very hard to support her children's basic needs.

Asana is a food vendor who sells rice and stew in the community where she lives. She started her operation about ten years ago to take care of her entire family. Her food production is on a small scale because of inadequate funds to support her business. She wants to use the loan to buy more meat, vegetables, and bags of rice to produce in larger quantities and increase her efficiency. She believes this will help expand her business to raise more income.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, vegetables, meat and firewood

loans.name: Sorbeh Ia Group

texts.en:
This is Musa S. B., Abu K. and Adamsay C.. They called their group Sorbeh IA. They are petty-traders in Makump Banna village, about five miles from Makeni City.

This will be their ninth loan from SMT/Kiva. With the help of SMT/Kiva loans, these entrepreneurs have been able to expand their businesses. Notwithstanding, they still want a new loan in order to further strengthen their businesses. Thus, they are requesting a new loan of Le 1,200,000 each.

Musa S. B. (in the middle of the photo) is the leader of this group. He was born in Makump village and is now thirty-six years of age. He is married with five children. He sells ready-to-wear clothes like jeans and women's wear and has been in this business for more than ten years now.

loans.use: To invest in his business

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 31-year-old man living with his wife and two children. He has owned a vegetable shop since 2005, which has helped him to live in good conditions. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 to purchase merchandise to increase his sales.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 57-year-old divorced woman and the mother of seven children. Through hard work, two are currently in school at the moment. She is a food vendor and sells kenkey in her neighborhood. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and eaten with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaian enjoy kenkey for breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use this loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to raise more money to support her children in school. She dreams of saving enough to build her own house before she dies.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Samira

texts.en: Samira is a 45-year-old married woman who is raising five children, four of whom are still attending school. Samira has owned an accessories and clothes shop since 2000 where she services the neighboring areas. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy merchandise for her shop in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Gulchamol

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
       Гулчамол – молодая женщина 33 лет, замужем и мать 1-го ребенка. Её муж занимается купле -продажей скота на скотном рынке. А она откармливает крупнорогатый скот дома. Гулчамол помогает мужу в развитии его бизнеса, потому что хочет иметь больше прибыли, чтобы расширять семью, так как в сельских местностях принято рожать больше 3-х детей.  За счет займа они хотят увеличить количество скота и  получить больше прибыли.
texts.en:
Gulchamol is a young 33-year-old woman, who is married and is a mother of 1 child. Her husband is involved in buying and selling livestock at a livestock market. She feeds cattle at home. Gulchamol helps her husband in developing his business because she wants to make bigger profits in order to expand their family. It is expected to have more than 3 children in the rural areas. Gulchamol and her husband want to use this loan to increase their livestock quantity and make bigger profits.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock purchase

loans.name: Zaki

texts.en: Zaki is a 50-year-old married man with four children. With 12 years of experience, he opened a carpentry shop to start his own business. Over the years, thanks to his business income, he has been able to meet his children's needs. Today, Zaki is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy merchandise and tools for his shop.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and tools

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy prepares and bakes bread. She started her operations 20 years ago. She is 45 years old, divorced and the mother of four children. Two of her children are in school and the older children are working. Mercy works very hard to support her children's education as a single mother. In spite of the challenges she faces, she has managed to acquire a portion of land where she wants to build. It is her bread business that brings hope to the family. She has customers who come to her to buy in bulk and sometimes she sells by hawking. Her only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials to meet the demand. She requests the support of a loan to remain in business and also to save some for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine started her fish business three years ago in a community market near where she lives. She is 42 years old, divorced and a mother with eight children. She prepares and serves her customers with very tasty fish in the market and she is one among many. She buys fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Many people buy from her in the marketplace.

All Josephine's children are currently in school. She supports her children from her business proceeds. She depends on that for their food, school bills and sometimes their medical bills. She needs this loan to increase her stock of assorted fish so she can increase sales and income to support her children's education and business growth. She hopes to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To increase stock of smoked and dried fish

loans.name: Imane

texts.en: Imane is a 21-year-old engaged woman living with her parents. She has been working for four years as a Research Analyst, providing reports for those in need of specific information. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,200 to be able to market her services more and to have more liquidity in her business.

loans.use: To be able to market her services more and to have more liquidity in her business

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 60 years old. She is married and has given birth to eight children. Currently they are all working and are living independently.

Amalia sells porridge in her neighborhood. Porridge is one of the local foods enjoyed popularly for breakfast by almost all Ghanaians. It is prepared from milled maize or millet grains, boiled and taken with sugar, milk and bread or taken with what we call Kose. Kose is prepared from milled beans and it is fried with cooking oil so in just about 20 minutes it is ready to be served with the porridge.

With her large customer base, Amalia wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of millet, beans, sugar and milk to increase production.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en: Mostafa is a 22-year-old single man living with his parents. He has been working in computer maintenance since 2004 with a previous eight years of experience in the field. He is cooperating with his brothers to satisfy the needs of the household. Today, Mostafa is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy tools that will help him develop his work.

loans.use: To buy tools that will help him develop his work

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 45 years old and is a married woman with four children, two of whom are currently schooling. She is a very hardworking woman and her children love her.

Cecilia has been trading for the last seven years and it is out of her income from this that she takes care of her children. She trades cereals such maize, groundnuts (peanuts), beans and other food items. She buys these crops directly from the farmers at a relatively low price. This, she said, protects her from middlemen who sell to her at a higher price.

Cecilia sells at the local market in the town where she lives with her family and also treks with some of her goods to nearby markets to sell as well. She also says that she wants to use the loan to buy the goods in bulk so that she can distribute to a larger number of customers.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en: Khalil is a 21-year-old single man living with his parents. In 2004, he decided to open his own barber shop in his village to begin a new career. After five years in the business he has decided to expand his business by purchasing merchandise for his shop and that is why he is requesting to borrow $1,000.

loans.use: To purchase marchandise for his barber shop

loans.name: Nader

texts.en: Nader is a 23-year-old single man living with his parents. In 2008, he wanted to build his career so he decided to open a shop for furniture painting. Today, Nader is requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase new painting tools to respond to the needs of the market.

loans.use: To purchase new painting tools

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia is 30 years old. She is a married woman with two children. Currently all her kids are in school. She sells frozen foods like chicken, mutton, fish, meat, etc. in the local market where she lives. She travels to Kumasi to purchase her stock of goods from the big cold-storage houses. She makes sure she buys only what she can afford, which mostly is not enough. She does not have adequate funds to support her business. This has affected her operation, especially in the face of increasing food prices. With the loan, she wants to purchase more cartons of frozen foods, like fish, chicken, pork, and meat, to enable her to raise enough income to expand her sales. It is her dream to give her children a better education.

loans.use: To buy cartons of frozen foods, like fish, chicken, mutton, etc.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 22-year-old young man living with his mother and brother. He has been working as a taxi driver since 2008 to provide, along with his brother, better living conditions for their mother. Today, Mohamad is requesting to borrow $1,000 to perform maintenance on his car to be able to continue his work.

loans.use: To perform maintenance on his car

loans.name: Aunty

texts.en: Aunty is a businesswoman. She trades in Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials. She mostly sells through hawking - a personal selling method that she says makes her goods move very fast. She is 46 years old and a married mother with three children. All her children are in school. She supports her family through the proceeds she makes from the business. She has eight years of marketing experience but progress has been persistently slow due to insufficient funds. She hopes this loan will enable her to revive the business and make it more profitable. She wants to purchase Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials in bulk to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase Dumas clothes in bulk

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 54, is a wife and the mother of eight children who are currently in school. She has operated a clothing shop, where she sells jeans, clothes, underwear, blouses, skirts and women's slippers, for five years. She at times sells through hawking to boost sales. 

Mary is constrained by funds to run the business. She needs the loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will help her to purchase a large quantity of good quality items to upgrade her inventory. She says she would be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To purchase jeans, clothes, ladies wear and slippers

loans.name: Najibeh

texts.en: Najibeh is a 50-year-old married woman and mother of four children. She has been working as a home-based bag producer to help her husband satisfy the household demands. Today, Najibeh is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy a paper-packaging machine to develop her work in order to increase her income.

loans.use: Buy a paper-packaging machine

loans.name: Kasmero

texts.en:
Kasmero G. is currently in the business of selling beans, rice, potatoes, etc., at a restaurant.  She is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs in the restaurant to sell. Kasmero is 28 years old and married to an army man. She has two children who both go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services. These are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. 

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more foodstuffs at the resturant to sell

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is 56 years old. She is widowed and is the mother of six children. Currently all her children are schooling.

Anastasia is a trader who deals in assorted products like cooking utensils and plastic bowls like lunch boxes, etc. She mostly sells through hawking - that is, house to house selling. She has been trading for ten years now and has attracted lots of customers who purchase from her.

Anastasia treks to Kumasi to purchase her stock of cooking utensils. Recently she has been facing challenges in her business as a result of inadequate funds to buy stock. She requests a loan to buy more supplies of the products she sells like cooking utensils, etc. With the loan she believes she will be more resourced to make lots of profits in order to build a store to reduce the frequent walking on the street to sell. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To increase her stock of cooking utensils to sell

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en:
Ophelia is 25 years old, is a wife and the mother of two kids who are currently in school.

Ophelia operates a clothing shop and sells jeans-clothes, blouses and skirts, women’s slippers, dress bags, etc. She started this business ten years ago.

Ophelia is constrained by funds to run the business. She needs the loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will help her to be more resourced to purchase good quality clothes and in larger quantities to upgrade her inventory.

Ophelia wants to use the loan to purchase jeans-clothes, ladies’ wear, headscarves and slippers. With the loan she hopes to increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To purchase jeans-clothes, ladies' wear and slippers

loans.name: Yasser

texts.en:
Yasser is a 28-year-old married man with one child. He has been working in the trade of sanitary products since 2002 with a previous seventeen years of experience in the field.

Today, Yasser is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy an electric machine specified for his job in order to expand his work after his long experience in the field.

loans.use: To buy an electric machine for his business

loans.name: Frejala

texts.en: Frejala M. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcohol and is requesting a loan to purchase more sugar and yeast for brewing. Frejala is 41 years old and is widowed. She has five children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, Frejala hopes to be able to buy a plot and rent it out. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar and yeast for brewing

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en: Ismail is a 27-year-old single man living with his parents. He has owned a car repair shop since 2004 where he services the neighboring villages. Today, Ismail is requesting to borrow $1,200 in order to purchase an air compressor to develop his work and satisfy the demands of the market.

loans.use: To purchase an air compressor

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas is a 42-year-old married man with three children. He owns an amusement center where the village boys come and enjoy their time. Today, Abbas is requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase a billiard table to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase a billiard table

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is a 33-year-old local restaurant operator. She is married and the mother of five children who are currently in school. She prepares and serves local food like banku and omotuo with soup and other local dishes. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. Omotuo is prepared from rice and it is also taken with any kind of soup. 

She started her local food production four years ago and sells in her neighborhood. She is working very hard to provide for the educational needs of her children. She says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her meet her production expenditure. With the loan, she wants to purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood to prepare her meals. She would be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther O. is 54years old and married with seven children. She sells provisions. She is requesting the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Nekhe Derete Group

texts.fr: NEKHE DERETE est un groupe de femmes habitant prés du village sandiara localité située à 25 km de la ville Mbour .Elles s’activent dans l’agriculture,  le petit commerce et l’embouche. Avec le début de l’hivernage elles sollicitent un prêt pour financer leurs différentes activités génératrices de revenus leur unique source de revenu pendant cette période. Les revenus tirés de cette activité leur permettent de nourrir leurs familles en attendant les récoltes.
texts.en:
NEKHE DERETE is a group of women who live near the village of Sandiara, located 25 km from the city of Mbour. They are active in agriculture, small-scale commerce, and the fattening of livestock. With the beginning of the off-season, the group members are requesting a loan to finance their different income-generating activities, which are their only sources of revenues during this period. These revenues enable them to feed their families as they wait for harvest time.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth O. is 55 years and married with six children. She has a grinding machine that she uses to grind tomatoes and beans. She fries akara (bean cake) to sell. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more beans to fry akara to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more beans to fry more akara to sell

loans.name: Keji

texts.en:
Keji B. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables like cabbages, okra etc and is requesting a loan to purchase smoked fish to sell. Keji is 50 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has six children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy seeds and initiate a little farm to grow green vegetables.


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase smoked fish to sell

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Pastor Groups 1 & 4

texts.en:
Juana S. is a mother of three and lives in Santiago, a crowded city in the Dominican Republic. She lives in a community called Los Salados, where many women have taken out loans from Esperanza. Seeing these women use their loans to start new businesses has encouraged Juana to get involved as well, and she became a group leader. 

This is Juana’s first loan, and she will use it to start her own small business. Juana plans to sell shoes. She will open a small street stall in her community and sell shoes to people on the streets. This small business will serve as supplementary income for family. 

Juana is excited to embark on her new business venture. She is thankful for the opportunity to take out her micro-loan, because it will provide her with access to capital that she would not have otherwise had. She hopes this will be the first step along a path that will lead to a better life for her family.

loans.use: Buy an inventory of shoes

loans.name: Ataro

texts.en:
Ataro L. is currently in the business of selling bread and is requesting a loan to open up a bakery. Ataro is 35 years old and is married to a husband who is a watchman. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a hotel.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Thư Nguyễn Thị (1407081658) is a 40-year-old woman living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has two infant children.

Thư owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily raising ducks for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over nineteen years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 2008, Thư joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

Thư is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase ducklings to raise and sell. The loan will be her 2nd from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase ducklings to raise and sell

texts.en:
T. Lê Thị (1720070541) is a 50-year-old woman living in the town of Quảng Xương.  She is married and has one adult child.  To make a living, T. owns & operates a business raising chickens for sale. T. has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 2000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.  T. is now requesting a new loan of 9000000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the third loan taken out by T. from TYM Fund.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Phạm Thị

texts.en:
Y. Phạm Thị (1727070762) is a 50-year-old woman living in the town of Quảng Xương.  She is married and has two adult children.  To make a living, Y. owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale.  Y. has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 2000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, Y. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Y. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.  Y. is now requesting a new loan of 9000000 VND, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  The loan will be the third loan taken out by Y. from TYM Fund.  Y. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (1727070772) is a 50-year-old woman living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is widowed and has two adult children.

H. owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.
