In 2007, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business.

H. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 3rd from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Zachariah

texts.en: Zachariah O. is aged 41 years and is a widower. He is the father of two: Amon and Cynthia. He has also adopted two other children: Edwin and Winnie. Zachariah owns a general store where he sells different building materials and electrical goods, and he has been in that business for three years. He also offers printing and photocopying services to supplement his store's income. This KADET loan marks his first from any lending organization to finance his business. He plans to buy bicycle parts, and other basic building materials in order to tap the ready market available as many people are putting up buildings in his neighborhood. In future Zachariah hopes to diversify his business by venturing into the freight transportation sector. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To purchase bicycle parts and basic building materials

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy Omorogbe sells drinks at wholesale and retail. She is 45 years old and married with 4 children. Dorothy is requesting the loan amount of 120,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: German

texts.es: German es un pequeño productor agropecuario dedicado a la produccion de arroz en pequeñas cantidades, las que actualmente vende en granza y a bajos precios, con la participacion del solicitante en la construccion de un trillo arrocero estaria logrando asociarse a este y ademas poder procesar el producto final y vender a mejores precios que le permitan mejorar sus condiciones de vida familiar y asi lograr que sus 2 hijos continuen sus estudios de primaria que cursan en la escuela de la comunidad.
texts.en:
German is a farmer dedicated to producing rice in small quantities, which he sells in their husks and therefore at lower prices. This loan solicitor is hoping to participate in the construction of a rice threshing machine. This would allow him to use the machine, process his rice to the final product stage, and therefore sell it at better prices. This would also permit him to improve his family’s standard of living, and his 2 children to continue with their primary school studies at the local school.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 30% contribution toward building a rice threshing machine.

loans.name: Jackall Sdamel

texts.es: El Sr. R. es pequeño productor agropecuario dedicado al cultivo de arroz desde muy joven, ahora cuenta con mayor experienciaen este rubro productivo, participa como socio de la cooperativa COPACSELES y solicita financiamiento para dar su aporte al 30% de contraparte y hace alcanzar una de sus mejores metas como es poder disponer de un medio de trabajo que le permita aprovechar sus cosechas en un 100% y mantener su asociatividad colectiva.
texts.en:
Mr. R. is a small-scale farmer who has dedicated himself to cultivating rice since he was young. He now has more experience in this productive arena, and participates in the COPACSELES cooperative. He is soliciting financing to contribute his 30% share toward the construction of a rice thresher. This would provide a means by which he can benefit 100% from his crop, and maintain his association in the collective.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 30% contribution toward the construction of a rice thresher.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: Don Jose Antonio es pequeño productor localizado en la comarca La Pitahaya jurisdiccion de San Lorenzo, por mucho tiempo se ha dedicado al trabajo productivo en el sector arroz, estableciendo el cultivo en pequeñas areas que le permiten obtener ingresos que le ayudan a la mantencion familiar. El participar como socio de el trillo de arroz COPACSELES  es su gran entusiasmo, ya que le permitira procesar su produccion de arroz y obtener mejores beneficios, sus hijos son menores y acuden a la escuela de primaria de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Jose Antonio is a farmer located in the community of La Pitahaya, in the San Lorenzo jurisdiction. He has dedicated himself for quite some time to production in the rice sector, establishing his crop in small areas that allow him to generate income to support his family. His chance to participate in the construction of the COPACSELES rice threshing machine is his great joy, given that it would allow him to process his rice and sell his product for a higher price. His children are young, and attend the primary school in the community.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 30% contribution toward building a rice threshing machine.

loans.name: Mame

texts.fr: Mame âgée de 51 ans est mariée et mère de 04 enfants à sa charge. Son activité est la vente de friperie (habits, couvres lit, etc.…) et de chaussures. Elle achète à Dakar pour revendre à Bignona. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mame, 51, is married and raising 4 children. Her business is selling used fabrics (clothing, bedspreads, etc.) and shoes. She buys her merchandise in Dakar and sells in Bignona. Her income allows her to improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and resale of clothing and shoes

loans.name: Friends Of Tilata Group

texts.es:
En la urbanización seis de junio de la ciudad de El Alto se encuentra el centro Cascada, a este pertenece la asociación “Amigas de Tilata”, recibe esta denominación ya que el grupo esta formado por vecinas y amigas que viven en la zona de Tilata (ciudad de El Alto). Está formada por dieciséis integrantes las cuales han demostrado ser un grupo responsable y unido.
Casadas en su mayoría, afirman que los ingresos que obtienen no son suficientes para cubrir las necesidades básicas en sus hogares ya que sus familias son numerosas.
Diversas son las actividades de este grupo, como ser; venta de frutas, material  escolar, artefactos electrónicos, artículos para el hogar, pollo cocinado al horno y otros. La asociación Amigas de Tilata necesita capital para la compra de insumos y mercadería, tienen la seguridad de generaran mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
The Cascada center can be found in the June 6th neighborhood of El Alto city, and the "Friends of Tilata" association belongs to the center. The association bears that name because the group is made up of neighbors and friends who live in the Tilata area (El Alto city). The group has 16 members and have shown themselves to be a responsible and united group. Most of them are married and they confirm that the income that they earn is not enough to cover the basic needs of their families because their families are large. The group has a variety of business activities, including sales of fruit, school supplies, small electronics, housewares, roast chicken, among others. The "Friends of Tilata" association needs capital for the purchase of ingredients, raw materials and merchandise, and they are confident that they will then produce more income.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials and merchandise

loans.name: Ndack

texts.fr:
SA/326
Ndack  F.  vend des fruits et des légumes  au marché de Sandiara village situé à plus de 25 km de Mbour  ville côtière. Elle   exerce ce métier depuis plus de cinq (5) ans. Les revenus tirés de cette activité lui permettent de contribuer aux  quotidiennes du manage au même titre que son mari. Le prêt sollicité lui permettra de renforcer ses activités  et de maintenir sa clientèle par la qualité de ses produits.
texts.en:
Ndack F. sells fruit and vegetables in the market of Sandiara village, situated more than 25 km from Mbour, a coastal town. She has been in this business for more than 5 years. The income from this business allows her to contribute to the daily expenses of her household just as her husband does. The requested loan will allow her to bolster her business and keep her clientele coming back due to the quality of her products. SA/326

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of merchandise for re-sale

loans.name: Lidia Esther

texts.es: Lidia Esther es originaria de la comarca La Peña donde habita junto a su familia, es apoyada por el papá a las actividades productivas, ya que como alternativa de trabajo se dedica a la produccion arrocera de baja escala, lo que le brinda ingresos que le permiten el sostenimiento familiar, es para la solicitante de sumo interes participar como socia del trillo de arroz, ya que esto le permitira mejorar sus condiciones de vida personal y familiar, es madre soltera, lo que le ha obligado a incorporarse al trabajo productivo.
texts.en:
Lidia Esther is from the La Peña region, where she lives with her family. Her father supports her in her work, and rather than having a job, she cultivates rice on a small scale. This generates income which allows her to support her family. She is extremely interested in becoming a part-owner of a rice thresher, because this will make it possible for her to improve the standard of living of her family, since she is a single mother, which is why she has to work.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 30% share in the construction of a rice thresher

loans.name: Yacine

texts.fr: Yacine est une femme mariée qui s’active dans la vente de jus de fruits. Elle veut renforcer son activité. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite va lui permettre d’acheter du pain de singe (fruit du baobab), du sucre, du bissap et d’autres produits pour la préparation et vente de jus.
texts.en:
Yacine is a young married woman who works at selling fruit juice. She wants to bolster her business. The loan that she is requesting will permit her to buy monkey bread (the fruit of the baobab tree), sugar, dried hibiscus flowers, and other products for the preparation and sale of juice.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: preparation and sale of fruit juice

loans.name: Marouba

texts.fr: Marouba F. est un commerce il gère une boutique de vente de produits de première nécessite  de plus de dix (10) ans. Tout le village s’approvisionne au prés de sa boutique. Les revenus tirés de son activité lui permettent d’entretenir  sa famille de payer les frais de scolarité  de ses enfants. En cette période d’hivernage les villageois n’ayant d’argent achètent à crédit pour ne payer qu’a la fin de hivernage pour faire face à cette vente à crédit Monsieur F. sollicite un prêt.
texts.en:
Marouba F. is a business man, he has managed a store which sells staples for more than ten (10) years. The whole town buys its provisions from his shop. The revenues from his business enable him to help his family and pay for his children's school tuition. During the off-season, the townspeople do not have the money to buy his products and they purchase these products on credit; they pay their bills at the end of the off-season. Marouba F. is requesting this loan in order to be able to finance these sales.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Financing credits for his business

loans.name: Future Of La Cascada Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de El Alto, en la zona Cascada se encuentra ubicado el centro focal que lleva el mismo nombre, a este pertenece la asociación “Porvenir De La Cascada”, grupo formado por trece miembros los cuales trabajan hace siete años aproximadamente junto a la familia de Pro-Mujer.
La asociación tiene negocios independientes, siendo los siguientes; Venta de verdura, confección de ropa, elaboración de comida, venta de medias y ropa intima, venta de frutas, otras tienen tiendas de barrio. Ahora necesitan capital porque desean ampliar sus ventas, para esto necesitan comprar mercadería en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
In the Cascada area of El Alto city you will find the Cascada center, and the "Future of La Cascada" association belongs to that center. The group is made up of thirteen members, who have been working together for approximately seven years as part of the Pro-Mujer family. The association has independent businesses, as follows: sales of vegetables, clothing production, food preparation, sales of stockings and lingerie, sales of fruit, and neighborhood grocery stores. They now need capital because they want to increase their sales. In order to accomplish this they need to purchase greater quantities of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Moustapha

texts.fr: Moustapha T.  est un mécanicien  garagiste automobiliste  qui vend des pièces automobile. Il  mène cette activité depuis plusieurs années. Il est l’unique fournisseur de pièces détachées de la zone. Les revenus tirés de cette activité lui permettent à 33 ans de soutenir sa famille. Avec le prêt qu’il sollicite il compte renforcer et diversifier les pièces des marques d’auto qu’il vend.
texts.en:
Moustapha T. is a mechanic specializing in automobiles who sells automobile spare parts. He has been in this business for a number of years. He is the only supplier of spare parts in his area. The income from this business permits him, at the age of 33, to support his family. With the loan he is requesting, he intends to bolster and diversify the inventory of parts that he sells for various types of automobiles.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of spare parts for re-sale

loans.name: Silvia Patricia

texts.es: Silvia Patricia es una pequeña productora de arroz como cultivo tradicional en la zona, junto a su marido ha venido desarrollando esta labor por mas de 5 años, con la apertura de la construccion de un trillo arrocero se motivo a solicitar financiamiento para participar como socia de este proyecto, segura que le permitira aprovechar al maximo su produccion de arroz, lo que le permitira mejorar sus condiciones de vida familiar, ya que es madre de 2 pequeños hijos, los que pronto asistiran al colegio, su mayor sueño es disponer de un bien colectivo que le permita obtener beneficios como socia del mismo.
texts.en:
Silvia Patricia is a small-scale rice farmer, a traditional crop in the region. Together with her husband, she has done this work for more than five years. When construction began on a rice thresher, she was motivated to request financing in order to be able to participate as a partner in this project. She is sure that this will allow her to take maximum advantage of her own rice production, which will allow her to improve her family's standard of living, because she is the mother of 2 young children who will soon be starting school. Her biggest dream is to have a good collective available to her which will allow her to benefit from being a member of the collective.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 30% share in the construction of a rice thresher

loans.name: Nadir Mariela

texts.es: Nadir habita junto a sus padres en la comarca La Peña, Tecolostote, desde muy pequeña sus padres la han orientado al trabajo productivo donde ha venido obteniendo experiencia con el culivo, lo que le brinda ingresos que le permiten apoyar a sus padres en el hogar, su principal motivacion de futor es ser socia del trillo arrocero, lo que seguro le traera beneficios a su familia y en su caracter personal le permitira aprovechar mejor los rendimientos de sus cosechas de arroz.
texts.en:
Nadir lives with her parents in the La Pena district of Tecolostote. Since she was very small her parents have guided her towards productive work through which she has obtained experience in cultivation. This offers her income which permits her to support her parents in the household. Her principal goal for the future is to be a partner in a rice thresher, which is sure to bring benefits to her family and will permit her to make better use of their harvests of rice.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Contribution of 30% of the cost of a rice thresher

loans.name: Valentín Antonio

texts.es:
Al señor Valentín Antonio G. tiene poco tiempo que le entregaron su casa por medio D. un crédito gubernamental, pero le está haciendo falta acabados del interior y exterior hay que L. casa esta en muy malas condiciones y no L. pueden abitar. 
   Están solicitando un préstamo para poder realizar los acabados del interior que es poner el cableado D. L. luz ya que no tiene y posterior mente toda L. pintura del exterior, y así poderL. abitar lo más pronto posible. 
   Planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos que genera D. su empleo como locutor D. radio. 
Cuando se realizo L. visita a L. vivienda quien nos atendió fue su esposa, L. señora Norma Leticia Mendoza, es L. persona que aparece en L. foto.
texts.en:
A short while ago, Valentín Antonio G. was given a home through a government loan. But, the interior and the exterior of the house are not finished. The house is in very bad condition, and they cannot live there. They are asking for a loan to be able to finish the interior, which is to install the wiring for the lights. Later they will paint the exterior. That way they will be able to live there as soon as possible. He plans to repay the loan with the income generated from his employment as a radio broadcaster. His wife, Norma Leticia Mendoza, is the person in the photo. When they maD. the visit to the house, his wife was there.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Change the wiring in the house

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
La señora Viviana L. y su esposo Anival Suárez están muy agradecidos por el gran apoyo que les brindaron en su anterior crédito, con el cual su negocio acrecido mucho, y le han dado trabajo a dos personas más. 
     En esté momento están solicitando nueva mente otro préstamo para poder comprar material ya que tienen varios vehículos para reparar por falta del material no los han podido terminar y entregar a tiempo.Desean pagar el crédito con las ganancias del negocio.
Quien nos atendió fue el señor Anival Suárez quien es la persona de la foto.
texts.en:
Viviana L. and her husband, Anival Suárez, are very grateful for the big help they were given in their past loan. With the loan, their business has grown a lot, and they have given work to two more people. They are now asking for another loan to be able to buy material. They have several vehicles to repair, but they have not been able to finish on time due to the lack of material. They want to repay the loan with earnings from the business. Anival Suárez is the person in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material

loans.name: Olga Elisea

texts.es: Doña Olga Elisea, es una persona de escasos recursos y huerfana que  trabajaba en oficios domesticos y a traves de esfuerzos a venido superando en los estudios, desea seguir superando a traves de sus estudios universitario por lo que acude a la Asociaciòn para un prestamo para los gastos de estudios, y ella ve la necesidad de estos gastos que no cuenta; para ser una persona competitiva y a la vez sea de provecho para mantener sus dos hijas a traves de esta supereaciòn.
texts.en:
Olga Elisea is a person with scarce resources. She is an orphan who does domestic work. With effort, she has been excelling in her studies. She wants to continue doing well in her university studies. That is why she has come to the Asociación to ask for a loan for educational expenses. She needs the money to pay the necessary expenses to allow her to fulfill her ambitions and support her two daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Educational expenses

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana es socia del Banco Comunal Manantial.
Maximiliana es separada, tiene 55 años y 4 hijos, Maximiliana vende pescado fresco y congelado en la puerta de su casa, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijas, además los días sábados vende pescado cerca del penal de la ciudad. Maximiliana también vende leña en su casa.
Maximiliana necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña.
Los sueños de Maximiliana son mejorar su negocio y ayudar a sus hijos a que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is a member of the Manantial Community Bank. She is 55, separated, and has four children. Maximiliana sells fresh and frozen fish in the door to her house. She does this with help from her daughters. Also, on Saturdays she sells fish near the city prison. Maximiliana also sells wood in her house. Maximiliana needs a loan for 3,000 PEN to buy wood. Maximiliana’s dreams are to improve her business and to help her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor es socia del Banco Comunal Manantial.
Leonor es casada, tiene 48 años y 2 hijos, Leonor vende cosméticos por catalogo, además vende ropa a pedido, que vende a amigos y familiares al crédito. 
Leonor necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa de acuerdo a los pedidos que obtenga.
Los sueños de Leonor son ampliar su negocio y tener capital suficiente.
texts.en:
Leonor is a member of the Communal Bank Manantial. She is 48 years old, and married with two children. Leonor works selling cosmetics, as well as clothing which she sells by request to friends and acquaintances on credit. Leonor is requesting a loan to purchase the inventory needed to meet her customers requests. Her goal is to have sufficient capital to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase the clothing inventory needed to meet her customers requests

loans.name: Forinda Tomasa

texts.es:
Esta persona desea ampliar su capital de comercio de productos varios la cual con esta actividad ha venido superando y le ha dado mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, la cual ve la necesidad de ampliar su producto por la demanda de clientes, y acude a la Asociación par solicitar un préstamo
para seguir brindando el servicio y mejorar los ingresos para sosotener a su familia y su negocio.
texts.en:
Forinda would like to increase her inventory of the various products she sells. Her business has enabled her to improve the quality of life for her family. She has requested a loan to purchase inventory needed to meet the demands of her customers. The loan will enable her to continue to offer good service and increase her profits, while supporting her family and her business.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business and continue to support her family

loans.name: Gloria Vilma

texts.es:
Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal Manantial.
Gloria es casada, tiene 40 años y 2 hijos, Gloria es casada, tiene 40 años y 2 hijos, Gloria junto a su esposo se dedican a la siembra de verduras en sus tierras y también alquila terrenos, sus ventas lo realiza en el mercado Nery García. 
Gloria necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de abono, semilla y peones.
Los sueños de Gloria son brindar una buena educación con sus hijos, ahorrar para tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the Communal Bank Manantial. She is 40 years old, and married with two children. Together with her husband, Gloria works cultivating vegetables on their own land as well as on land they rent. They sell their produce in the Nery Garcia market. Gloria is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds. Gloria's dream is to be able to provide a good education for her children, and save enough money to set up a shop in her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Manantial.
Nancy es casada, tiene 39 años y 2 hijos, Nancy tiene un puesto en el mercado Jesús de Nazareno en donde vende condimentos, menestras sancochadas, gelatinas y también vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ají, haba, leche y galletas.
Nancy sueña con tener una bodega en su casa.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Manantial Community Bank. Nancy is 39, married, and has two children. Nancy has a stand in the Jesús de Nazareno market where she sells condiments, stews, and gelatin. She also sells general groceries. She does this every day. Nancy needs a loan for 3,000 PEN to buy chili, beans, milk, and crackers. Nancy dreams of having a store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chili, beans, milk, and crackers

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo es socia del Banco Comunal Manantial.
Consuelo es soltera, tiene 28 años y vive con sus padres, Consuelo tiene una tienda en la casa de sus padres en donde vende abarrotes en general, algunos artículos de librería, servicio telefónico, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hermana.
Consuelo necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Consuelo son construir su casa en el terreno que compro y surtir con mas productos su negocio.
texts.en:
Consuelo is a member of the Manantial Community bank. She is 28, single, and she lives with her parents. Consuelo has a store in her parents’ house where she sells general groceries, some bookstore items, and telephone services. She does this with her sister’s help. Consuelo needs a loan for 3,000 PEN to buy rice and sugar. Consuelo’s dreams are to build a house on the land that she bought and to stock her store with more products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
Yanet es socia del Banco Comunal Manantial.
Yanet es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 2 hijos, Yanet vende frutas peladas como piña en rodajas,  sandia en rodajas, sus ventas los realiza en el mercado 12 de abril de manera ambulatoria.
Yanet necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido como parte de pago de un terreno.
Los sueños de Yanet son tener casa propia, tener una tienda estable.
texts.en:
Yanet is a member of the Manantial Community Bank. Yanet is 25, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Yanet sells fruit that needs to be peeled like pineapple slices and watermelon slices. She is a street vendor in the 12 de abril market. Yanet needs a loan for 1,050 PEN as part of a payment for a piece of land. Yanet’s dreams are to have her own house and a stable store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Part of a payment for a piece of land

loans.name: Noemi Liliana

texts.es:
Noemí es socia del Banco Comunal Manantial.
Noemí es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, Noemí junto a su esposo se dedican a la compra y venta de carros, su esposo tiene un taller de planchado y pintura, en donde pintan a los carros que serán comercializados.
Noemí necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pinturas.
Los sueños de Noemí son tener una tienda de pinturas y tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Noemí is a member of the Manantial Communal Bank Group.

She is 23 years old, in a common law marriage, and has one son. Together with her husband, they buy and sell cars. Her husband has an auto body shop where he paints the cars for resale.

Noemí is requesting a loan of 900 soles to buy automotive paint. She dreams of opening a paint store and having her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase automotive paint

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina es socia del Banco Comunal Manantial.
Sabina es soltera, tiene 53 años y 3 hijos, Sabina vende papa, producto que adquiere en los diferentes pueblos de los mismos productores, la venta lo realiza en el mercado de Las Américas.
Sabina necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa variada.
Los sueños de Sabina son comprar un terreno y construir una casa para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sabina is a member of the Manantial Community Bank. Sabina is 53, single, and has three children. Sabina sells potatoes, which she gets from different towns that produce them. She sells them in the Las Américas market. Sabina needs a loan for 900 PEN to buy varieties of potatoes. Sabina’s dreams are to buy a piece of land and build a house for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy varieties of potatoes

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Ana Julia M. se dedica a laborar arduamente en su actividad de venta de frutas y verduras y esencialmente la venta de naranjas comercializadas a diario en el mercado. 

Debido a que a diario son muchos los clientes que visitan el Mercado, ella decidió acudir a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las naranjas con el propósito de ofrecerlas en sus hermosos canastos y así satisfacer la petición de los clientes que le visitan.
texts.en:
Ana Julia M. Works arduously selling fruits, vegetables, and especially oranges. She sells daily in the market. Because so many customers visit the market every day, she decided to ask Ceprodel for a loan to buy oranges. She will sell them in her pretty baskets and satisfy the requests from her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Tomasa Josefa

texts.es: Doña tomasa josefa es una persona que vive a ocho kilometros del pueblo, la cual con todos los esfuerzos ha podido iniciar su negocio en compra y venta de ropa tipica, y tambien ella elabora ropa tipica para su ampiacion de capital y a base de esto ha mejorado sus condiciones de vida, y tiene la vision de seguir creciendo en su negocio, la cual se vio en la nesesidad de acudir a la asociacion asdir para pedir un apoyo de un prestamo para mantener la sostenibilidad de su negocio y mejorar el servicio a los clientes.
texts.en:
Doña Tomasa Josefa lives 8 kilometers outside of town. With great effort, she started a business buying and selling traditional clothing. She also makes traditional clothes as a way of increasing her inventory. In order for her to improve her living conditions, she envisions growing her business.

For this reason, she finds it necessary to approach Asociación ASDIR for assistance. She will use her loan to sustain her business and improve customer service.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her operating capital

loans.name: Jenny De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La joven Jenny de los Ángeles G. se dedica arduamente a su actividad de venta de bananos en el mercado Mayoreo en la ciudad de Managua, vendiéndolos a diario desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta el atardecer atendiendo a todos sus clientes en la venta de estas frutas.

Debido a que es una madre responsable y con un pequeño hijo, ella se esfuerza para mantenerlo y lograr sacarlo adelante. Es por ello que ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para  la compra de los bananos y de esta manera ofertarlos en su localidad en el mercado.
texts.en:
Jenny de los Ángeles G. works arduously selling bananas in the Mayoreo market in the city of Managua. She sells them every day from very early in the morning until dusk. She waits on all of her customers as she sells this fruit. Because she is a responsible mother with a small son, she works hard to support him and give him a good future. That is why is she has come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy bananas. She will sell them from her location in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bananas

loans.name: Luisa Lilliam

texts.es:
Desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana en el M. Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Luisa Lilliam G. se dedica a laborar arduamente en su negocio de venta de frutas y de verduras vendiendo principalmente la pitahaya el cual es muy vendida por lo que requiere tener mucho almacenamiento para ofrecerlas a sus clientes.

La razón exclusiva por la que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel una vez mas es porque necesita de un crédito para la compra de las pitahayas y al adquirirlas poder venderlas sin ningún problema en su localidad en el M. Mayoreo.
texts.en:
Luisa Lilliam G. works arduously in her business of selling fruits and vegetables. She works in the Mayoreo market, and she starts very early in the morning. She primarily sells pitahaya (national fruit also known as dragon fruit). A lot of pitahaya is sold, so she needs to have a lot of storage space to offer it to her customers. The reason she has come to Ceprodel once more is because she needs a loan to buy the pitahayas and be able to sell them without problem from her place in the Mayoreo market.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pitahayas (national fruit also known as dragon fruit)

loans.name: Amys Lucila

texts.es:
Con mucho empeño, como toda mujer nicaragüense la señora Amys M. labora para llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación. Ella se dedica a la venta de tomates en el mercado Mayoreo en la ciudad de Managua.

Actualmente requiere de la compra de tomates para ofrecerlos en su localidad y por esta razón ha acudido a Ceprodel esperando ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de dichos tomates y así surtir su establecimiento para venderlos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Like all Nicaraguan women, Sra. Amys M. works extremely hard to support her family. She sells tomatoes at the wholesale market in the city of Managua.

She wants to buy more tomatoes to sell from her vending location. For this reason, she has approached CEPRODEL in hopes of receiving a loan. She will use the funds to buy a supply of tomatoes to restock her vending stall so she can continue selling to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tomatoes

loans.name: José Dolores

texts.es:
Desde hace 18 años, el señor José Dolores S. se ha dedicado a su profesión brindando consultas médicas a las personas en su propia clínica que a pesar que es pequeñas cumple con las condiciones necesarias para funcionar. El señor S. está ubicado en las afueras del mercado Mayoreo en la ciudad de Managua.

Él ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de uso periódico como guantes, algunos medicamentos y otros materiales de uso médico. Espera que el crédito sea otorgado prontamente para continuar brindando sus consultas médicas a la población en su localidad.
texts.en:
For 18 years José Dolores Sequeiro has dedicated himself to offering medical consultations to people in his own clinic. In spite of being small, his clinic meets the necessary conditions to be functional. Señor S. is located outside the Mayoreo market in the city of Managua. He has come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy materials that he uses periodically like gloves, some medicines, and other materials of medical use. He hopes the loan will be granted as soon as possible so that he can continue offering his medical consultations to the population in his area.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy medical materials

loans.name: Jorge Alejandro

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Jorge Alejandro M. le está haciendo falta la barda ala rededor. 
Pero con su sueldo es muy bajo no puede compara el material y pagarle a la persona que se dedicara a elaborar la barda. Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para que su casa esté segura cuando su el y su esposa estén trabajado, ya les han robados en varios ocasiones. 
Don Jorge trabaja de despachador de una gasolinera en la ciudad y su esposa la señora María Teresa Mora  trabaja limpiando casa. Estos son los ingresos que tiene para salir adelante y con el cual pagaran el crédito.
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora María Teresa quien nos atendió ya que el señor Jorge se encontraba trabajando.
texts.en:
Sr. Jorge Alejandro M. is missing a security wall around his house. However, he does not earn enough money to pay for the materials and labor required to put up the wall. This is why he is requesting a loan to make his home safer while he and his wife are at work. They have been burglarized on several occasions.

Don Jorge works as a dispatcher for a gas station in the city. His wife, Sra. Maria Teresa Mora, cleans houses. Their incomes help them get ahead and will be used to repay this loan.

The woman in the photo is Sra. Maria Teresa, since Don Jorge was working at the time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a security wall around his house

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.es:
El señor Abelardo no aparece en la foto en su representación sale su esposa la señora Nora Nelly.
Abelardo R. P. es un señor con el trascurso de los años fue haciendo mejoras en su vivienda con ahorros propios, pensando el en bienestar de sus tres hijas para  dejarles un buen patrimonio y dar confort. Ahora el recurre a nuestra institución recomendado por su hermana que con crédito anterior también le ayuda a mejorar su casa el señor R. se interesa por que ya no tiene capital para terminar de hacerle los acabados como enjarre de la casa.
Su esposa es una señora emprendedora que aparte de atender su casa ella se dedica a la venta de tortilla de harina caseras para dar sustento a su familia y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares aunque el trabaja en maquiladora prefieren darle lo mejor a sus 3 hijas
texts.en:
Mr. Abelardo does not appear in this photo, in his place appears his wife, Ms. Nora Nelly. Abelardo R. P. is a man who, over many years, has improved his house using his own savings. He thinks about the well-being of his three daughters and wants to leave them comfortable and with a nice property.

Now he comes to our institution on the recommendation of his sister who, using a previous loan, also helped him improve his house. Mr. R. is interested because now he does not have any capital for the finishing touches on his house, such as plastering the outside of the house.

His wife is a very enterprising woman who, beside taking care of the house, sells home-made flour tortillas to help support her family and help her husband with the family expenses. Even though Mr. R. works in a factory, they want to give the best to their three daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plastering his house

loans.name: Percibal

texts.es:
Percibal Alarcón M. es una persona que hace ya tiempo se entregó su casa de interés social pero su patio de atrás es muy pequeño, la barda estaba como a un metro de largo y se veía la casa del vecino. Para tener su propia privacidad el opto por levantar la barda de madera; pero le falto una parte, el cual esta solicitando un préstamo  para comprar el material y terminar su proyecto.
Su esposa y el trabajan en maquiladora para mantener a sus tres hijos y darles mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Percibal Alarcón M. acquired a home through a public housing project but the backyard patio is very small and the fence was only a meter tall, so he could see his neighbor's house. For privacy, he decided to put up a wood fence, but there is still one part that is incomplete. He is requesting a loan to purchase materials to complete the project. He and his wife work in a maquiladora factory to support their three children and provide them with better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put up a fence

loans.name: Lea Del Socorro

texts.es: Lea M. S. labora como docente el colegio Jaas Anmus Comenium de Nueva Guinea, esta solicitando el 5to crédito para Mejora de vivienda, haciendo un porche y reparando su cocina que esta en mal estado, ademas cuenta con el apoyo de su marido que labora en la CURACAO Nueva Guinea y asume los gastos del hogar. Lea manifiesta que gracias a los financiamientos que le ha otorgado AFODENIC  ha salido adelante en la construcción de la vivienda y se siente sastifecha con la institución ya que los interes son bajos.  El mayor sueño de Lea es poder tener su casa bonita y con las condiciones basicas para su familia.
texts.en:
Lea M. S. works as a school teacher at Jaas Anmus Comenium de Nueva Guinea. She is requesting her fifth loan for home improvements. Her plans include building a porch and repairing her kitchen, which is in bad shape. She has the support of her husband who works for La Curacao (a national chain of appliance stores) in Nueva Guinea. He also assumes the household expenses.

Lea is grateful for the funding provided by AFODENIC and has proceeded with her home repairs. She is satisfied with the institution because the interest payments are low. Her biggest dream is to have a beautiful house that meets the basic living conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construct a porch and make kitchen improvements

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth es una pequeña comerciante (venta de ropa, calsado etc, alajas) de la zona de Nueva Guinea, solicita el 3er crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para realizar compra de cambio de techo de su casa pues en esta epoca de invierno se le moja parte de la sala, cuenta con el apoyo de su papá para esta solicitud, tiene capacidad y volunta de pago. Elizabeth expresa sentirse satisfecha con el sevicio recibido por AFODENIC ya que los interes son bajo, pues con los creditos que ha recibido de AFODENIC a logrado realizar obras de construción en su casa, mejorar así las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a small business owner (selling clothes, shoes, etc., jewelry) in the Nueva Guinea neighborhood. She is requesting her 3rd loan through AFODENIC to purchase a new roof for her house, since in the winter season part of her living room gets wet. Her father is helping her with this loan request; he is willing and able to make payments. Elizabeth is pleased with the service she receives through AFODENIC as the interest rates are low. With the loans she has received from AFODENIC she has been able to do construction projects on her home, thus improving her family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roof replacement

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: La señora Cristina atiende con el servicio de fotocopias, en una pequeña tienda ubicada en la ciudad, en un lugar muy concurrido, esta situado detrás de un colegio, por esto que le va bien en el negocio.  Vive en la zona de Pampahasi con su pequeño hijo y su mamá, ella apoya en los gastos de la casa. Estudiaba por la nocha en la facultad de medicina, terminó sus estudios con mucho esfuerzo y ahora tiene la oportunidad de abrir su propio consultorio en la plaza Garita de Lima, de la zona 14 de septiembre un lugar muy concurido ya que es zona comercial.La fotocopiadora la atenderá un familiar. El crédito será invertio en la compra del instrumental que le hace falta para su consultorio a inaugurarse muy pronto, atenderá en medicina general con costos bajos para que las personas de bajos recursos puedan acceder al servicio.
texts.en:
Cristina has a photocopying service. It is in a small shop located in the city in a well transited place. It is located behind a school and therefore business is good. She lives in the Pampahasi neighborhood with her young son and her mother, and helps out with household expenses. She studied medicine at night at the university, and with great effort she completed her degree. She now has the opportunity to open her own medical practice in the Garita de Lima plaza, in the 14 de septiembre neighborhood. It is a well transited area since it is a commercial zone. A relative will work at the photocopying service. The loan will be used to purchase instruments that she needs for her medical practice which will open very soon. She will provide a low cost general practice so that low income individuals can use her services.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase instruments for her medical practice

loans.name: Libio  Santiago

texts.es: El señor Libio y su esposa Cristina son dos personas muy responsables ya que ellos crían y cuidan a sus dos nietos. Ellos viven en la  Villa Salomé. Don Libio trabaja como chapista hace 40 años y actualmente tiene un Taller de Chapería de Movilidades en la misma casa donde vive. Él solicita el préstamo para la compra de una compresora nueva ya que su antigua compresora comenzó a fallar y tiene aún muchos trabajos por entregar.
texts.en:
Libio and his wife Cristina are very responsable people who are raising and caring for their two grandchildren. They live in Villa Salomé. Libio is a metalworker and has a workshop in his home for auto body repair. He is requesting a loan to purchase a new compressor because his old one is starting to fail and he still has a number of orders to complete.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a compressor

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
La señora Flora M. G. tiene 37 años y está casada por más de 17 años. Tiene 3 hijas, una niña de 15 años, otra de 8 años y la menor de 6 años. Las tres ayudan con el cuidado de las vacas después de la escuela. La señora Flora vive en la comunidad de Maica Central en Cochabamba, donde tiene 3 vacas, cuya leche vende a una microempresa que produce queso por más de 15 años.

La señora Flora cuida las vacas todo el día con la ayuda de la hermana de su esposo una chica de 17 años que por las noches va a la escuela. Su esposo trabaja como carpintero por en su domicilio, haciendo puertas, sillas, mesas etc. 

El préstamo será destinado para la compra de alimento para su ganado, silo, chala y alimento balanceado. Mejorando la  alimentación de las vacas lecheras incrementarán la producción actual de leche, y así mejoraran sus ingresos de tal forma que esperan poder comprar más vacas y mejorar su calidad de vida y sueñan en un futuro sacar otro crédito para poder comprar mas vacas.
texts.en:
Flora M. G. is 37 years old and has been married for more than 17 years. She has 3 daughters, ages 15, 8, and 6. The three girls help care for the cows after school. Flora lives in the community of Maica Central in Cochabamba, where she has 3 cows, whose milk she sells to a micro-business that has been making cheese for more than 15 years. Flora takes care of the cows all day with the help of her sister-in-law, a 17 year girl who goes to school at night. Her husband works as a carpenter out of their home, making doors, chairs, tables, etc. This loan will be used to purchase feed for her cattle, ensiled sorghum, cornhusks, and balanced feed. Improving the feed for the dairy cows will increase their milk production, and thus increase her income so that she can purchase more cows and improve her quality of life. In the future she dreams of taking out another loan to purchase more cows.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed for dairy cows (ensiled sorghum, cornhusks, and balanced feed).

loans.name: Carla Lorena

texts.es: La Sra Carla Lorena  reside en la localidad de Santa Cruz de la Sierra tiene 18 años de edad va a tener un bebe vive junto con su esposo el Sr.:Erick Ayala y su padre Saul Enrrique Ledesma , la Sra se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos y su esposo trabaja de control de microbuses hace mucho tiempo, la Sra junto con su esposo  solo sacan credito de nuestra institucion (Emprender) ella esta necesitando un financiamiento de 500 Sus para la compra de cosmeticos al contado y una pequeña vitrina para usarla como mostrador en un puesto de venta. y aumentar sus Ingresos.
texts.en:
Carla Lorena lives in the town of Santa Cruz de la Sierra with her husband Erick Ayala and her father Saul Enrrique Ledesma. She is 18 years old and is going to have a baby.
She sells cosmetics and her husband has worked as a minibus monitor for a long time. She and her husband only take out credit with our institution (Emprender).
She needs a $500 loan to have the cash to purchase cosmetics and a small glass cabinet to use as a display case at her stall, and to increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ana Carola

texts.es: La Sra Ana Carola Tiene 27 años de Edad reside en la ciudad de Santa Cruz de la sierra en la casa de sus suegros(los padres de su esposo ) , viven junto con su  esposo los dos trabajan para sacar adelante a sus tres hijas, la menor cuenta con 10 meses de edad la Sra Ana Carola vende afuera de su domicilio, ya cuenta con su propia  clientela. El Sr. Rodrigo, el esposo, trabaja como taxista y esta acabando de pagar la deuda que contrajo por  la compra de su taxi. La pareja requieren de  capital  para la elaboracion de pan ya que la Sra acaba de comprar un  horno y necesita las latas y los insumos.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana Carola is 27 years old and resides in the city of Santa Cruz. She and her husband live in the house of her in-laws. They both work to support their three daughters, the youngest one being 10 months old. Sra. Ana Carola sells her products outside her home since she already has her own clientele. Sr. Rodrigo, her husband, works as a taxi driver and is currently repaying the contractual debt used to acquire his vehicle. The couple is requesting capital for Sra. Ana Carola’s bread business. They just bought an oven and the necessary ingredients and baking pans.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour in bulk

loans.name: Ceraturo Irquis (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Ceraturo es un grupo nuevo de 17 socias y socios que son residentes del barrio Ceraturo Irquis en Victoria del Portete ubicado al sur de la  ciudad de Cuenca, este sector es de un clima demasiado frío y que por la tarde baja la neblina  lo que hace que la gente no transite por las calles ni salgan de sus casas.

La socia María Tránsito P. vive ya unos tres meses en casa de su cuñada que reside en el extranjero. María tiene 23 años de edad, es casada y tiene cinco hijos de 9, 7, 5, 3 años y la última de un mes de edad, los tres primeros hijos los cuales son varones están estudiando en la escuela de Ceraturo. Antes de ser socia de la Fundación trabajaba conjuntamente con su esposo en una hacienda la  Victoria del Portete  como peones, sacando leche de las vacas, en labores del campo, su horario era de 6 AM. A 6 PM. En esta hacienda los jefes eran algunos buenos y otros malos, pero lo que no le gustaba a María era que no los consideraban ya que debían ser cumplidos con su trabajo que no había ningún justificativo para faltar, no les importaba hijos ni enfermedades. Es socia más o menos desde el 16 de Junio de este año, un vecino del barrio les hizo conocer de la fundación y les invitó a que ingresen, pidió $110 de préstamo para comprar cuyes y hierba, para de esta manera salir de la hacienda en donde ella trabaja porque el tiempo no le alcanza para cuidar a sus hijos. Su meta es poder trabajar en la crianza de animales no solo de cuyes sino también de vacas, puercos y pollos para así progresar y poderles dar lo que ellos necesiten.

La socia Rosalía C. tiene 36 años, es casada, y tiene una hija de 16 años. Su esposo trabaja en latonería, reparando y pintando los carros, mientras ella trabaja como empleada doméstica y además vende productos cosméticas de Avon y de otras marcas también. Sus clientes son principalmente sus vecinas, amigas y conocidas. Hace 8 años que vende cosméticos, y desde niña está trabajando en los trabajos que le surgen, como empleada o en restaurantes. Ella también se encarga de los quehaceres domésticos de su propia casa. Suele trabajar desde las 7:30am hasta las 5pm. Está pidiendo este crédito de $220 para comprar productos de Avon, porque vende a crédito. Aveces la empresa hace promociones, entonces para ella le conviene cubrir los costos en estos momentos y recuperarlos después. Ella toma pedidos de sus clientes para cada quincena, y suele recibir $100-$120 en pedidos cada quincena, de los cuales un 25% es ganancia para ella (la ganancia se desminuye entre 5% y 10% después de tomar en cuenta sus costos). Este es la primera vez que ella ha sacado un préstamo. Para el futuro, le gustaría poner un negocio propio, por ejemplo un restaurante, porque le gusta mucho cocinar. 

Todos los socios y las socias están comprometidos a pagar el crédito puntualmente y de una manera responsable.
texts.en:
The Ceraturo Communal Bank is a group of 17 women and men who are residents of the Ceraturo Irquis neighborhood of Victoria del Portete, located to the south of the city of Cuenca. This region experiences extreme cold while fog develops in the afternoons, making it difficult for people to travel through the streets and preventing them from leaving their homes.

Member María Tránsito P., for the past 3 months, has been living in the house of her sister-in-law who currently resides abroad. María is 23 years old, married, and has 5 children (ages 9, 7, 5, 3 and 1 month). Three of the children attend school in Ceraturo. Before joining Fundación ESPOIR, she and her husband worked on the Victoria del Portete Estate as farm laborers. They milked the cows and worked in the fields. Their work schedule was from 6am to 6pm. At the estate, some of the supervisors were good and while others were bad. However, none of them liked it whenever María had to miss work or leave early to take care of her children whenever they became sick. She became a member around June 16th of this year when a neighbor told her about the Foundation and invited her to join. She is requesting a loan of $110 so that she can buy guinea pigs and grass, enabling her to quit her farm job so that she can spend more time caring for her children. Her goal is to start breeding more animals, not just guinea pigs, but also cows, pigs and chickens so that her family can get ahead and become self-sufficient.

Member Rosalía C. is 36 years old, married and has a 16 year old daughter. Her husband works in an auto body shop, repairing and painting cars. Meanwhile, she works as a domestic helper and also sells Avon cosmetic products and other brands as well. Her clients are primarily neighbors, friends and acquaintances. She has been selling cosmetics for 8 years. When she was younger she previously worked as a temporary employee, a salaried employee, and also in restaurants. She also takes charge of the domestic duties for her own home. Rosalía works from 7:30am to 5pm. She is requesting a loan of $220 to buy Avon products because she sells on credit. Sometimes the company has promotions, so she can pay for the products now and recoup the costs afterwards when customers make their payments. She takes orders from her customers every two weeks, which totals between $100-$120, of which 25% is profit. (That figure is reduced between 5-10% after taking into account the costs of the products.) This is the first time she has taken out a loan. In the future she would like to open her own business, such as restaurant, because she enjoys cooking.

All members have promised to pay their loans on time and in a responsible manner.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Elena es socia del Banco Comunal Lomas de la Cruz, que reúne en la oficina de la Fundación ESPOIR en la ciudad de Cuenca cada dos semanas. Sra. Rosa Elena tiene 40 años y es la madre soltera de 3 hijos, de los cuales 2 ya son mayores y 1 es adolescente. 

La señora abrió un taller de muebles hace un año, el cual trabaja actualmente con la ayuda de sus hijos. Toda su familia tiene este mismo oficio; su papá era carpintero, y ella trabajaba con su hermano antes de poner su propio taller. Ella dice que aunque sus hermanos podrían estar compitiendo entre ellos, se ayudan entre ellos bastante. Ella está en su taller de lunes a domingo, y trabaja largas horas, a veces desde las 7am hasta las 10pm. Trabajan por pedidos, y generalmente hacen muebles de sala, como recibidores. 

Rosa Elena necesita un préstamo de $660 para comprar madera, específicamente laurel y copal. Su meta para el futuro es seguir trabajando en su taller para poder mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa Elena is a member of the community bank Lomas de la Cruz, which meets in the offices of the foundation ESPOIR, in the city of Cuenca every two weeks. Señora Rosa is 40 years old, and she is the single mother of 3 children, of whom two are already adults and one of whom is an adolescent. Señora Rosa opened a furniture workshop a year ago, where she currently works with the help of her children. All the family have this same work; her father was a carpenter, and she worked with her brother before beginning her own factory. She says that although her siblings are competitors, they help each other a fair bit. She is in her workshop from Monday to Sunday, and she works long hours, sometimes from 7am until 10pm. She works to complete orders, and generally she makes furniture for the living room, like entrance hallways. Señora Rosa Elena needs a loan of $660 in order to buy wood, specifically laurel and copal. Her goal for the future is to continue working in her workshop in order to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood, specifically laurel and copal

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es: La señora Natalia se dedica a la venta de leche, tiene sus vacas que las ordeña todos los días, y la vende a la empresa PIL, y los fines de semana vende la leche en la ciudad, tiene su esposo que está en la Argentina trabajando en  costura. Tiene un hijito, que se queda con ella y le ayuda con las vacas. Invertirá el crédito en la compra de un toro, es una cliente  muy puntual.
texts.en:
Señora Natalia works selling milk. She has her cows, which she tends to every day. She sells at the store PIL, and on the weekends she sells the milk in the city. She has a spouse, who is in Argentina working as a tailor. She has one little son, who stayed with her and helps her with the cows. She would invest the loan in the purchase of a bull, and she is a very punctual client.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of a bull

loans.name: Marlene Maclovia

texts.es:
La señora Marlene es socia del Banco Comunal Loma de la Cruz, que se reúne en la oficina de la Fundación ESPOIR en la ciudad de Cuenca cada dos semanas. Ella tiene 48 años y es  madre soltera de 6 hijos, 3 de los cuales viven con ella todavía. La señora es muy alegre y chistosa y tiene la capacidad de hacer reír a todo su banco comunal con sus comentarios. 

Marlene tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa y productos Yanbal. Ella empezó hace más de 20 años cuando trabajaba en una fábrica de tapioca, y se puso a vender estos productos cosmeticos a sus compañeras de trabajo. Ya dejó este trabajo, pero sigue vendiendo a sus antiguas compañeras, y también a sus vecinas, conocidas y familiares. Mas o menos el 50% de sus ventas son de ropa, y la otra mitad es de productos Yanbal como perfumes y cremas. Recibe aproximadamente 4 pedidos por semana, y sus clientes le paguen de forma mensual o quincenal. 

Marlene está pidiendo un préstamo de $880 para poder comprar más ropa y productos Yanbal, ya que sus clientes le pagan después de la entrega de los productos y no de antemano. 

Su meta para el futuro es tener una casa propia. Ya se compró un terreno, y solamente le falta construir la casa.
texts.en:
Señora Marlene is a member of the community bank Loma de la Cruz, which meets in the offices of the foundation ESPOIR, in the city of Cuenca every two weeks. She is 48 years old and is the single mother of 6 children, 3 of whom still live with her. Señora Marlene is very cheerful and funny, and she has the ability to make everyone in the bank laugh with her comments. Marlene has a small business selling clothing and Yanbal products. She began this more than 20 years ago when she was working in a tapioca factory. She began selling these products to her co-workers. She stopped the factory work, but she continued selling to her old co-workers and also to her neighbours, friends, and acquaintances. More or less, 50% of her sales are clothing, and the other half is Yanbul products like perfumes and cremes. She takes about 4 orders a week, and her clients pay her either monthly or quarterly. Marlene is asking for a loan of $880 in order to buy more clothes and Yanbal products, as her clients pay after she delivers the items, and not before. Her goal for the future is to have her own home. She has already purchased some land, and she needs only to construct the house.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and beauty products for Marlene's business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La microempresaria Vilma E. R. tiene 46 años de edad es madre soltera y tiene 5 hijos, los cuales aun conviven con en la misma casa, tiene algunos años de estar dedicándose a la venta ambulante de productos lácteos (Queso, crema y cuajadas), productos que viaja a comprar al departamento de Chontales en donde los compra a mas bajo precio.

Con este negocio la señora E. ha podido ir dándoles los estudios  a sus hijos y manteniendo los gastos de su hogar, ya que por su nivel académico (No puede leer y escribir) le es difícil tener un trabajo que gane para sus gastos. Este es el segundo crédito que realiza con Kiva y el anterior lo cancelo en tiempo y forma. Ella manifiesta estar contenta con las personas que le han apoyado financiando su préstamo, el cual le ayudo en poder comprar mas productos y poder obtener mejores ganancias.

En esta ocasión esta solicitando le puedan financiar para comprar los siguientes productos lácteos: 300 libras de Queso a US 1 dólar cada libra, 300 libras de  crema a US 0.60 cada libra y 100 cuajadas a US 0.70 cada libra.
texts.en:
The micro-entrepreneur Vilma E. R. is 46, is a single mom and has five kids, whom she lives with in the same house, for a few years she has worked in selling dairy (cheese, cream and milk curd), products that she travels to purchase to Chontales, where she buys them at a lower price. With this business, Mrs. E. has been able to provide for her children's studies and cover her home expenses, because of her academic level (she can't read nor write) it is difficult for her to have a job that makes enough for her expenses. This is the second loan with Kiva and the previous one was paid back on time and in full. She indicates being content with the people that have helped her finance her loan, which allowed her to purchase more product and make more profit. This time she is requesting a loan to purchase the following dairy products: 300 pounds of cheese at $1 US/pound, 300 pounds of cream at $0.60 US each and 100 creamy milk curds at $0.70 US per pound.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cheese, cream and milk curd

loans.name: Juan Santiago

texts.es: El sr. Juan se dedica a venta de arena que el mismo saca del rio Jachacori, para venderlos a los camiones para construcción, también saca piedra bruta y piedra manzana, también para la construcción, vive solo con su esposa que se dedica a las labores de casa, siendo ella quien lleva su merienda a su esposo. es muy trabajador y no tiene créditos en otra institución. Es muy responsable y muy puntual.
texts.en:
Juan sells sand that he takes out from river Jachacori, he sells it for construction purposes, he also sells different stones and rocks that are used for construction as well, he lives with his wife who is a homemaker and who brings food for him at work. He is very hardworking and has no loans with any other institution. He is very responsible and punctual.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in buying a water pump and tools

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.es: El señor Benedicto tiene su salon de billar al frente de la plaza Ergueta, vive en la misma casa con su esposa y su bebé, viven ellos solos, ya que sus familias viven en el campo, ambos se apoyan mutuamente y son muy unidos. El crédito será invertido en la compra de tela paño, para cambiar las mesas de billar, es un cliente responsable.
texts.en:
Mr. Benedicto has a pool business across from the Ergueta plaza, he lives at home with his wife and baby, their families live in the country, both support each other and are very close. The loan will be invested in buying a special fabric to cover the pool tables, he is a responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pool table felt for his business

loans.name: Fuente De Bendicion Group 3

texts.en:
Damiana R. is the group leader of the solidarity group Fuente D. Bendicion (or Fountain of Blessing). This group is maD. up of friends and neighbors in the small coastal town of Sabana D. la Mar. 

With this loan, Damiana will buy fruit, vegetables and habichuelas (Dominican beans) which are used in a popular Dominican bean dish. Damiana has already repaid two loans and is excited to take out a bigger loan to grow her business even more.

Damiana is a 39-year-old mother of four (ages 16,14,12, and 9) and since starting her business, she has been able to make sure all of them go to school. Her dream is to grow her businesses enough to be able to send them to college. 

On behalf Damiana and the entire Fuente D. Bendicion group, thank you for providing an opportunity to those who need it most!

loans.use: To buy more fruit, vegetables, and habichuelas

loans.name: Genaro Carlos

texts.es: El sr. Genaro se dedica a la costura de chamarras, chalecos, deportivos para niños y su esposa los lleva a vender a Potosí y Oruro, donde tiene clientes fijos, tiene también su minibús que trabaja en las noches para tener algunos ingresos extras, tiene dos hijos que le ayudan en la costura y estudian, es un cliente muy puntual, invertirá el crédito en la compra de tela polar para costurar chamarras por los pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
Genaro works sewing jackets, vests, sport clothing for kids and his wife sells them in Potosi and Oruro, where they have set clients, he also has a minibus and works at night to have some extra income, they have two kids that help out with the sewing and study, he is a punctual person and will invest the loan in buying fabric to make jackets and cover the orders he has.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric

loans.name: Waldo

texts.es: El sr. Waldo tiene su empresa de servicio de seguridad privada para colegios y eventos  sociales, trabaja ya bastante tiempo con esta actividad, vive en la casa de sus suegros y tiene dos niños, su esposa vende víveres  para apoyarlo con los gastos de la casa,  es muy edicado a su familia no trabaja con otra institución, y es un cliente muy puntual. Invertirá el crédito para los gastos que tendrá ya que quiere formalizar su actividad como empresa, para poder adjudicarse otros contratos que le solicitan.
texts.en:
Waldo has a company that provides private security services for schools and social events, he has been doing this for a long time, lives at home with his in-laws and has two kids, his wife sells groceries to help him with the house expenses, he is dedicated to his family and doesn't work anywhere else, he is a punctual person. He will invest the loan in the expenses that he will have in making his company activity more formal and this way be able to accept more contracts.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To do all the legal paperwork for his security services company

loans.name: Alicia Janeth

texts.es:
La señora Alicia Janeth P. B.  tiene 32 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Víctor Larco, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad. Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º de secundaria, tiene 2 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Janeth se dedica a la venta de pescado y cuidado de niños en el wawawasi (Centro de cuidado para niños).
Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compro productos de belleza como labiales, colonias, talcos, cremas, etc los que vendió a sus amistades y familiares.
Este crédito de 800 lo invertirá para comprar jabas y pescado. 
Janeth sueña con tener un puesto en el mercado de Buenos Aires para vender con mayor tranquilidad sin esforzarse caminando por las calles de Buenos Aires.
texts.en:
Alicia Janeth P. B. is 32 and lives in the district of Victor Larco, Trujillo in the department of La Libertad, Peru. The entrepreneur studied up to 5th grade and has two children that financially depend on her. Janeth sells fish and takes care of kids in the wawawasi (a child care center). With her first loan of 300 nuevos soles she bought beauty products like lipstick, lotion, powders and perfumes that she sold to her friends and family. This loan of 800 will be invested in buying seafood. Janeth dreams of having a location in the Buenos Aires market to sell with less stress and without having to walk around in the streets of Buenos Aires.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seafood

loans.name: Zaida Kattia

texts.es:
La señora Zaida, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Azangarinas Valientes”  que esta ubicado en el del distrito de Azangaro, provincia de Azangaro, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 23 años de edad, ella es madre soltera con un niño y tiene estudios superiores (Derecho 6to ciclo),  vive en el Barrio Alianza Jr. Potoni 510.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra de carne. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de carne de ovino para la venta en la feria.

Su deseo es terminar su carrera y ejercerla.

A ella le gusta la facilidad en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Zaida belongs to the “Azangarinas Valientes” community bank, which is located in the district of Azangaro, in Azangaro, department of Puno, she is 23 years old and is the single mom of a boy and has post-secondary education (Law 6th cycle), she lives in the Alianza Jr. neighborhood. She has been with Manuela Ramos for a year, her first loan was of S/.300 nuevos soles, which she used to buy meat. At this moment she requests a loan of S/.500 nuevos soles to purchase lamb meat and sell it at the fair. Her wish is to finish her degree and have a career. She likes the convenience of the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy lamb meat

loans.name: Leonarda Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Leonarda., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santiago Apóstol”  que esta ubicado en el del distrito de Paucarcolla, Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 43 años de edad, estado civil casada, es madre de 04 hijos y  tiene estudios de secundaria completa,  vive Centro Poblado de Paucarcolla.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 6 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra de abarrotes. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, aceite, etc.

Su deseo es comprar su casita.

A ella le gustan los ahorros,  las reuniones y las charlas.
texts.en:
Leonarda belongs to the “Santiago Apostol” community bank, which is located in the district of Paucarcolla, province of San Roman, department of Puno, she is 43, married, has four children and finished high school, she lives in the Paucarcolla town. Whe has worked with Manuela Ramos for six years, her initial loan was S/.300 nuevos soles, which she used to buy groceries. Now she requests a loan of S/.500 nuevos soles, to purchase rice, sugar, milk, pasta, oil, etc. Her dream is to buy a house. She likes to save, get together and converse.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, oil, pasta, milk, sugar

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: Ángel tiene 37 años y es una persona muy tranquila y alegre, vive solo en su casa propia y lo que más desea es salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida. Desde que tenía 17 años decidió estudiar odontología en la universidad, sabía que pondría un consultorio para ayudar a todas las personas que lo necesitaran. Actualmente atiende a muchas personas, la cuales debido a la ubicación de su consultorio son en su mayoría comerciantes. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es atender a las personas que realmente necesitan de sus cuidados, ya que pone toda su atención en ellos. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y lo más difícil para él es tratar a los niños, ya que lloran mucho y muchas veces no lo dejan concentrarse como debe, pero aun así sabe que ese es el trabajo que eligió y está dispuesto a seguir trabajado duro. Este es el tercer préstamo de Ángel con MFP y al igual como hizo con sus primeros créditos, espera pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy tranquilo y siempre está al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan entre socios. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más material odontológico para atender mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Angel is 37 and is a very quiet and happy person, he lives alone in a house he owns and what he wishes the most is to get ahead and improve his quality of life. Since he was 17, he decided to study dentistry at the university, he knew that he would start his own clinic to help those that needed his services. Currently he assists a lot of people, whom because of the location of his clinic are mainly merchants. What he likes the most about his job is to assist people that really need his help, and he pays a lot of attention to them. He has done this for 10 years and the most difficult part of his job is to assist kids, because they cry a lot and sometimes he can't focus as he should, in spite of this, he knows this is the career he chose and is willing to keep working hard. This is the 3rd loan between Angel and MFP and just like his other loans, he hopes to pay back on time. In his community bank he is a quiet partner and is always aware of what's going on at the bank. With the S/.800 nuevos soles requested, he will buy dentist supplies to better assist his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy dentistry supplies

loans.name: Nelly Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Azangarinas Valientes”  que esta ubicado en el del distrito de Azangaro, provincia de Azangaro, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil Conviviente, es madre de 02 hijos y tiene estudios secundaria completa,  vive en el Barrio Revolución Jr. Alfonso Ugarte.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el cual uso para la compra de productos de la región (papa, oca, etc.) 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de papa, chuño, quinua, ocas, cebada, etc.

Su deseo es surtir mejor se su negocio y formar un buen capital.

A ella le gusta la facilidad de pago en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Ms. Mercedes belongs to the Community Bank “Azangarinas Valientes” (“Brave Women from Azangarinas”) that is located in the Azangaro district, Azangaro Province, Department of Puno. She is 27 years old, has a live-in partner, and has two children. She has finished high school and lives in the Revolución Jr. Alfonso Ugarte neighborhood.

Mercedes has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for one year. Her first loan was 500 soles, which she used to purchase regional products (potatoes, “oca” – a type of root vegetable.) Right now she needs a loan of 500 soles to purchase potatoes, “chuño” (a type of potato), quinoa, “oca”, barley, etc.

Her dream is to stock her business better and increase her working capital.

She likes the ease of payment on her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, root vegetables, quinoa, barley, etc.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca tiene 53 años, es una ama de casa muy responsable y amorosa, vive junto a su esposo Francisco de 52 años y su hija Maricruz de 18 años en su casa propia, y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Su puesto de venta de quesos está ubicado en el mercado Santa Bárbara (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), ella tiene muchos clientes, debido al carisma que posee como vendedora, puesto que siempre está bromeando y haciendo reír a las personas que concurren hasta su puesto. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y recomendarles los quesos más ricos, lleva 10 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los deliciosos quesos desde Taraco o Saman (Distritos de la Provincia de Puno) hasta la ciudad. Francisca espera que su negocio crezca en el futuro y le genere mejores ingresos económicos, con los cuales pueda cubrir los estudios superiores de su querida hija. Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, si es que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde ha sido muy bien recibida. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más quesos para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Francisca is 53 years old and is a very responsible and loving homemaker. She lives with her husband Francisco, who is 52, and her daughter Maricruz, who is 18, in their own house. What she wants most is to improve her quality of life.

Her cheese-selling booth is located in the Santa Barbara market (an important market in the city of Juliaca). She has many clients due to her charisma as a vendor; she is always joking and making the people who come to her booth laugh. What she likes most about her work is chatting with her customers and recommending them the tastiest cheeses.

She has been working in this business for 10 years and thinks that the most difficult part is transporting the delicious cheeses from Taraco or Saman (districts in the Puno province), to the city. Francisca hopes that her business will grow in the future and will generate more income, with which she will be able to pay for higher education for her beloved daughter.

This is the first loan she has with MFP. She knows that she must pay all of her installments on time if she does not want to cause problems for her fellow members of the community bank, where she has been very well received.
