Karina es casada, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, de profesión profesora y culminó la carrera de enfermería, Karina vende cosméticos por catalogo y también ropa a pedido, todas sus ventas son al crédito.
Karina necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lencería.
Los sueños de Karina son sacar el titulo de enfermería y velar por el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Karina is a member of the Amor Divino Microfinance Institute.

Karina is a 32-year-old married mother with 2 children. She is a teacher who completed the Nursing Program. She also sells cosmetics by catalog and apparel by special order on credit.

She needs a 600.00 PEN loan, which she will use to purchase lingerie.

Karina dreams of obtaining her Nursing license and of watching over her children’s future.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lingerie

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria C. C. D. C. tiene 62 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. Víctor Larco, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad. Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º D. primaria por motivos económicos dejo D. estudiar, tuvo que ponerse a trabajar y asi ayudar a sus hermanos menores, tiene 4 hijos y ninguno depenD. económicamente D. ella.
Maria se dedica a la crianza D. animales: cerdos, patos, pollos, pavos, chivos, etc.
Con su primer crédito D. 300 nuevos soles compro patos y pavos para criarlos y posteriormente venderlos en el mercado D. Buenos Aires.
El crédito D. 1500 lo invertirá para comprar huachos (loterías) y alimento concentrado para sus animales. 
Maria sueña con aumentar la crianza D. sus animales.
texts.en:
Maria C. C. D. C. is 62. She lives in the Víctor Larco district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. This entrepreneur has a fifth graD. education. She had to leave school for economic reasons. She had to work to help her younger siblings. She has four children; they are not economically dependent upon her. Maria raises animals; pigs, ducks, chickens, turkeys, and goats, etc. With her first credit for 300 PEN she bought ducks and turkeys to raise and later sell in the Buenos Aires market. She will use the loan for 1,500 PEN to buy “huachos” (a farm animal) and concentrated food for her animals. Maria’s dream is to increase the number of animals she raises.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy “huachos” (a farm animal) and concentrated food for her animals

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
La señora Adriana R. R. tiene 42 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Víctor Larco, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad. Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º de secundaria y tiene 2 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Adriana se dedica a la crianza de vacas y venta de leche en el mercado de Buenos Aires y sus vecinos.
Con el primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compro cantinas para transportar la leche.
El crédito de 2200 lo invertirá en la compra de becerros para criarlos y posteriormente venderlos.
Adriana sueña con aumentar la crianza de su ganado.
texts.en:
Ms. Adriana R. R. is a 42-year-old woman who lives in the Víctor Larco district, in the province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Perú.

This entrepreneur almost completed her high school studies. She has 2 children who depend on her economically.

Adriana raises cows and sells their milk at the Buenos Aires market and to her friends.

With her first 300.00 PEN loan, she purchased buckets to transport the milk.

She will invest this 2,200.00 PEN in purchasing calves that she will raise and then sell.

Adriana dreams of increasing her livestock business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Jessica Yeniz

texts.es:
Jessica es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
Jessica es soltera, tiene 30 años y vive con su mama, estudiante de ultimo ciclo de comunicación, Jessica vende cosméticos por catálogos y también ropa, zapatos por pedido, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Trujillo y Lima.
Jessica necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapatos y ropa.
Los sueños de Jessica son velar por su madre y hermanos, terminar de construir el segundo piso de su casa.
texts.en:
Jessica is a member of the Amor Divino Microfinance Institute.

Jessica is a 30-year-old single woman who lives with her mother. She is on her last year of her Communications degree. She sells cosmetics by catalog, as well as clothing and footwear by special order. She obtains these products in Trujillo and Lima.

Jessica needs a 2,000.00 PEN loan, which she will invest in purchasing shoes and apparel.

She dreams of taking care of her mother and siblings, and of finishing construction of the second floor of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase apparel and footwear

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
La señora S. D. J. Rosa Maria tiene 58 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. Víctor Larco, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad. Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta nivel superior, estudio Secretariado Ejecutivo, ejerció alrededor D. 8 años pero por dedicarse a su hogar dejo D. trabajar. Tiene 2 hijos ninguno depenD. económicamente D. ella.
Rosa se dedica a la venta D. productos alimenticios en la tienda D. su casa.
Con su primer crédito D. 300 nuevos soles compro productos alimenticios como arroz, fideos, aceite, leche, etc.
El crédito D. 800 lo invertirá en la compra D. productos alimenticios para abastecer su negocio.
Rosa sueña con tener un minimarket.
texts.en:
Ms. S. D. J. is a 58-year-old woman who lives in the Víctor Larco district, in the Trujillo province of the department of La Libertad, Perú.

This entrepreneur obtained an Executive Secretarial certificate and worked in that field for around 8 years, but she decided to quit and become a homemaker. She has 2 children, none of whom depend on her financially.

Rosa sells foodstuffs in her home general store. With her first 300.00 PEN loan, she purchased goods, such as rice, noodles, cooking oil, milk, etc.

She will invest this 800.00 PEN loan in purchasing goods to restock her store.

Rosa dreams of owning a mini market.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
Marcelina es casada, tiene 60 años y 5 hijos, Marcelina tiene un puesto en el mercado Grau en donD. venD. cereales variados, productos que compra en las ferias y también le traen a su puesto.
Marcelina necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. queso, garbanzo y cebada.
Los sueños D. Marcelina son que su hijo ultimo culmine sus estudios y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Marcelina is a member of the Amor Divino Microfinance Institute.

She is a 60-year-old married mother with 5 children. She runs a stand at the Grau Market in which she sells a variety of grains. She buys these products at other markets, and people sell them to her at her stand as well.

Macelina needs a 1,500.00 PEN loan, which she will invest in purchasing cheese, garbanzo beans, and barley.

Marcelina dreams of seeing her son obtain a degree and of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cheese, garbanzo beans, and barley

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
La señora Brigida., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santiago Apóstol”  que esta ubicado en el del distrito de Paucarcolla, Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 31 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, es madre de 02 hijos.  Tiene estudios de segundaria completa,  vive en el Jr. Collana.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 9 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para su negocio de compra - venta de abarrotes. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1,300.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de cereales como trigo, quinua, y cañihua, habas, maíz, etc. los cuales serán procesados en su  molinera, y moronera.

Su deseo es comprar un terreno para construir su casa propia, ya que por el momento vive en casa de sus padres..

A ella le gustan los ahorros  y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Ms. Brigida Q. is a member of the “Santiago Apóstol” Microfinance Institute, located in the district of Paucarcolla, San Román province, department of Puno. She is a 31-year-old woman with a live-in partner and 2 children. She completed her high school education, and lives on Collana Street.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 9 years. She used her first 300.00 PEN loan for her general store.

At this time, she needs a 1,300.00 PEN loan to purchase grains, such as wheat, quinoa, cañihua (a species of goosefoot closely related to quinoa), broad beans, corn, etc., which will be processed in her mill and threshing machine.

She wishes to purchase a plot of land on which she can build her own house because she is living in her parents’ house at this time. She likes the savings that she obtains at her microfinance institute and its meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wheat, quinoa, beans, corn, etc.

loans.name: Enid Doris

texts.es:
La señora Doris, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Molino-Juli”  que esta ubicado en el Centro Poblado de Molino, del distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 25 años de edad, estado civil casada, es madre de 02 hijos y tiene estudios de segundaria completa, vive en el centro poblado de Molino Central.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace casi 2 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra de lana para elaboración de artesanías. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de lana vegetal de diferentes colores para la elaboración de artesanías.

Su deseo es hacer crecer su negocio para poder ser mayorista.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y  la forma de trabajo en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Ms. P. is a member of the “Molino-Juli” Microfinance Institute, located in Molino, in the Juli district of the Chucuito province, department of Puno. She is a 25-year-old married mother with 2 children, and she completed high school. She lives in the Molino Central town.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for almost 2 years. Her first loan was for 300.00 PEN, which she used to purchase wool to make traditional handicrafts.

At this time, she needs a 500.00 PEN loan so that she can purchase silk cotton in a variety of colors to make handicrafts.

She wishes to expand her business so that she can become a wholesaler.

She likes her microfinance institute’s format and the savings that she obtains through it.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase silk cotton

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
Zenaida es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
Zenaida es casada, tiene 38 años y 1 hijo, Zenaida culmino sus estudios de educación, Zenaida tiene una tienda en el centro de la ciudad de Ayacucho en donde brinda el servicio de fotocopiado y también vende repuestos de fotocopiadoras. Además junto a su mama tienen un puesto de venta de especerías.
Zenaida necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ají colorado.
Los sueños de Zenaida son sacar su titulo profesional y ampliar su tienda.
texts.en:
Zenaida is a member of the Amor Divino Microfinance Institute.

Zenaida is a 38-year-old married mother with 1 son. She completed her education. She owns a store in downtown Ayacucho where she provides copy services and sells spare parts for copy machines. Additionally, she and her mother run a spice stand.

Zenaida needs a 600.00 PEN loan, which will be invested in purchasing red hot peppers.

Zenaida dreams of getting her degree and of expanding her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase red hot peppers

loans.name: Rosa Milagritos

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Milagritos P. B. tiene 43 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Víctor Larco, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad. Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta nivel superior, estudió Educación Inicial y por eso se dedica, dentro de sus actividades, al cuidado de niños de 6 meses y hasta 3 años 11 meses en el wawawasi (centro de cuidados de niños). No tiene hijos.
Rosa aparte de dedicarse al wawawasi, se dedica a la venta de balones de gas en su domicilio.
Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compro 10 balones de gas, para venderlos a los vecinos.
El crédito de 1300 lo invertirá para comprar mas balones de gas e invertir en el locutorio de su hermana. 
Rosa Milagritos sueña con aumentar la venta de gas para así obtener dinero para así modificar la estructura de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosa Milagrito P. B. is a 43-year-old woman who lives in the Víctor Larco district of the Trujillo province, departament of La Libertad, Perú. This entrepreneur obtained a higher education. She studied Early Childhood Education, which is why she now takes care of children ages 6 months to 3 years and 11 months at the wawawasi (day care center). She has no children of her own.

Aside from working at the wawawasi, Rosa sells propane tanks from home.

With her first 300.00 PEN loan, she purchased propane tanks to sell them to her neighbors.

She will use the 1,300.00 PEN loan to purchase more propane tanks, and to invest in her sister’s call shop.

Rosa Milagritos dreams of expanding her propane business so that she can increase her income to make home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase propane tanks and invest in her sister’s call shop

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
Carmen es casada, tiene 38 años y 1 hijo, Carmen vende cosméticos por catálogos de tres líneas diferentes, además vende ropa a pedido que ofrece a colegas de su esposo y amistades.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de perfumes.
Los sueños de Carmen son ampliar sus negocios, tener un negocio estable.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Amor Divino Microfinance Institute.

Carmen is a 38-year-old married mother with 1 son. She sells three different lines of cosmetics by catalog. She also sells clothing by special order to her friends and her husband’s co-workers.

Carmen needs a 900.00 PEN loan, which she will invest in purchasing perfume.

Carmen dreams of expanding her businesses and of having a stable business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase perfume

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es:
La señora Rafaela, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Molino-Juli”  que esta ubicado en el Centro Poblado de Molino, del distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 49 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, es madre de 05 hijos y tiene estudios de primaria incompleta, vive en la comunidad de Sihuiro Sector Tishua.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace casi 3 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra de chifleria (productos varios). 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de betunes, pasta dental, escobillas de zapato, ganchos de ropa, detergentes, etc. Solo vende en las ferias de Ilave.  Los demás días se dedica a las pesca, 

Su deseo es poder criar ganado para engorde.

A ella le gustan los ahorros en su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Ms. P. is a member of the “Molino-Juli” Microfinance Institute, located in Molino, in the Juli district of the Chucuito province, department of Puno. She is a 49-year-old woman with a live-in partner and 5 children. She completed elementary school, and lives in the Tishua sector of the community of Sihuiro.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for almost 3 years. She used her first loan—in the amount of 300.00 PEN—to purchase miscellaneous items.

At this time, she needs a 500.00 PEN loan in order to purchase shoe polish, shoe brushes, toothpaste, clothes hangers, detergent, etc. She only sells her products in the street markets of Ilave. She makes a living by fishing the rest of the week.

Her wish is to raise livestock.

She likes the savings that she obtains through her microfinance institute.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase items

loans.name: Rosa Teodora

texts.es:
La señora Rosa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Molino-Juli”  que esta ubicado en el Centro Poblado de Molino, del distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil casada, es madre de 06 hijos y tiene estudios de secundaria completa, vive en la Comunidad de Vilcanqui Sector Carancani.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace casi 10 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó  para la compra de lanas para artesanías. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de lana vegetal para elaboración de artesanías,  además comprará ovinos y chanchos para engorde.

Su deseo es  poner una tienda de venta de abarrotes.

A ella le gustan los ahorros, y las charlas de capacitación.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the Molino-Juli Community Bank, which is located in the Centro Poblado of Molino, Juli district, Chucuito province, Puno department. She is 42, married, and has six children. She has a high school education. She lives in the Vilcanqui community, Carancani sector. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for almost ten years. With her initial loan for 300 PEN, she bought wool for handicrafts. She now needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy wool to make handicrafts. She will also buy sheep and pigs to fatten. Her wish is to set up a grocery store. She likes the savings and the training talks she gets at her community bank.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep and wool

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora Gregoria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Cruz D. Chua Chua”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad D. Chua Chua,  distrito D. Zepita, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 46 años D. edad, estado civil casada, es madre D. 5 hijos y tiene estudios D. secundaria incompleta (4to grado), vive en la Comunidad D. Chua Chua Sector Pampa D. Chua chua.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 1 año,  su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó  para la compra D. ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra D. ganado menor, y compra D. verduras, como cebolla, zanahoria, apio, lechugas, zapallo, etc.

Su deseo es construir su casa en Puno, ya cuenta con el terreno.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las facilidades en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gregoria is a member of the communal bank “Santa Cruz D. Chua Chua” which is located in the Chua Chua neighborhood of Zepita, in the Chucuito province, in Puno. She is 46 years old, married, and the mother of five children. Mrs. Gregoria studied up through the fourth graD.. She lives in the Pampa area of Chua Chua. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for a year now. Her first loan was for 300 soles and she used it to buy small livestock. Right now, she needs a loan of 500 soles to buy small livestock and vegetables like onions, carrots, celery, lettuce, pumpkins, etc. She would also like to build a house in Puno and already has the land. Mrs. Gregoria loves to save and she loves the ease of these loans.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy onions, carrots, celery, lettuce, pumpkins, etc.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
La señora Laura, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Totoritas”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Chimu, el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 19 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, y es madre de 1 hijo y tiene estudios de secundaria completa, vive en la Comunidad de Chimu.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó  para la elaboración de artesanías en totora (planta de la zona). 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de material quesana, chillihua y soguillas, para elaboración de artesanías en totora.

Su deseo es se mayorista en la venta de quesanas ya que considera que le da muy buenas  ganancias.

A ella le gustan la puntualidad y la responsabilidad en el trabajo.
texts.en:
Sra. Laura belongs to the communal bank group "Las Totoritas", which is located in the Chimu community of Puno District, Puno Province, Department of Puno. She is 19 years old, in a common marriage, and the mother of one child. She completed her high school education and lives in the Chimu community.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 2 years. Her initial loan of 300 soles was invested in the production of handicrafts made of totora (a cattail reed that grows in the region).

At the moment, she is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to purchase materials for making quesanas (woven mats), such as chillihua (a native natural fiber) and soguillas (a type of animal hair).

She hopes to be a wholesale vendor of quesanas so that she can earn a good income.

She likes punctuality and the responsibility of her work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase craft materials

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 19 años, vive con su madre y su hermana en casa de sus padres. Desde hace 2 años se dedica al bordado, realiza todo tipo de prendas de vestir típicas de su zona. Ella dispone de tiempo por las mañanas para bordar, ya que por las tardes estudia. Luz disfruta mucho de realizar este trabajo y según la demanda, ha notado que le deja buenas ganancias. Esto la anima a planificar su futuro dedicándose a este oficio  integrado a su profesión como una pequeña empresa. Esta es la primera oportunidad en que tiene un préstamo con MFP y tiene la intención de poner todo su empeño para que su grupo salga adelante en los acuerdos que se propongan. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de fardos de tela e hilos de diversos colores, además de los dorados y plateados.
texts.en:
19-year old Luz and her brother live with their parents. For the last two years she has done embroidery, making all types of traditional clothing typical of the area. She makes time in the morning for the embroidery, as in the afternoons she studies. Luz enjoys her work very much and, depending on demand, she has found that it brings in good money. This has encouraged her to make plans for the future; she wants to combine this job with professional work as a small business owner. This is her first opportunity to get a loan with Kiva partner MFP, and Luz intends to put all her effort into ensuring that her group does well and keeps up with all its commitments. The money that she has just requested will be used to buy lengths of material and embroidery thread in a range of colours as well as gold and silver.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for embroidery

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza es una joven emprendedora que tiene 26 años, tiene una pequeña hija de 2 años y vive con su madre y su hermana en la casa de sus padres. Desde hace 3 años decidió independizarse económicamente generando su propia fuente de trabajo con el bordado de fustanes. Cada día realiza estas prendas con la ayuda de su madre para lograr cumplir los compromisos pactados con sus clientes, quienes quedan satisfechos por el trabajo que ha realizado. Para Maritza es muy ventajoso realizar esta actividad porque le permite estudiar y trabajar a la vez, además su trabajo es económicamente bien retribuido. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está muy contenta de formar parte de este nuevo grupo en su banco comunal, donde promete ser una socia puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de hilos y telas al por mayor para  seguir produciendo sus bordados.
texts.en:
Maritza is a young entrepreneur aged 26. She has a two-year old daughter and lives with her mother and sister in her parents’ house. Three years ago she decided to become financially independent and created her own work embroidering fustanes (traditional skirts). She works on the skirts every day with the help of her mother so that she can complete the orders requested by her customers, who are very happy with the work that she does. The job is a good one for Maritza as it allows her the chance to work and study at the same time; the work is also financially rewarding. This is her first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she is very happy to be part of this new group in the community bank. She promises to be punctual with her repayments. The money will used to buy thread and material at wholesale prices so that she can continue doing the embroidery.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy embroidery materials

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es: Olinda tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en la casa que le heredaron sus padres. Desde hace más de 10 años se dedica al comercio de diferentes objetos, tales como artesanías y artículos diversos para el hogar. Además, desde hace 5 años comenzó a vender comida en la puerta de su casa, la cual está ubicada en una avenida muy transitada de su localidad. La venta de comida la realiza con preferencia los fines de semana, los días de ferias comerciales, para eso prepara platos típicos que son los más consumidos por su clientela. Para esta actividad cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo y una de sus hijas que siempre está con ella. Los demás días de la semana elabora artesanías para distribuirlas a los comerciantes de estos artículos. Para el futuro, Olinda desea continuar con la venta de comida, pero en un local donde implemente un restaurante donde ofrezca de manera permanente platos típicos de su región. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una persona que persevera y apoya el trabajo en equipo para lograr buenos resultados. Es así que se compromete, una vez más, a trabajar de esa manera en el banco comunal que integra. El dinero que vienen solicitando será destinado a la compra de los ingredientes, al por mayor, para la preparación de sus comidas, también adquirirá bancas y mesas nuevas para la atención de su clientela.
texts.en:
Olinda is a 41-year-old woman who lives with her husband and children in the house that they inherited from her parents. For 10 years, she has been selling miscellaneous items, such as handicrafts and home essentials. Additionally, five years ago she started selling food in front of her house, which is located on a very busy street in her town. She sells food preferably on weekends and on street market days. In order to do so, she prepares the traditional foods that are most popular with her patrons. For this business, she has the help of her husband and one of her daughters who is always with her. The rest of the weekdays, she makes handicrafts to distribute them to vendors. In the future, Olinda would like to continue her food business, but in a business space where she can set up a restaurant to sell regional cuisine permanently. This is the third time that she requests a loan from MFP. She is a team-player who perseveres so that she can obtain good results. Thus, she commits to once again cooperate with her microfinance institute. The money that she is requesting will be used to purchase the ingredients (wholesale) that she needs to prepare her meals. She will also obtain new benches and chairs for her patrons.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food and furniture for her business

loans.name: Barrios Group

texts.es:
Foto De izquierda a derecha: Maribel del Socorro P., Ascensión B. López y Patricia Edith Gaitán López.

Este es el grupo solidario B., originario de la ciudad de Masaya, trabajadores y conocidos por sus actividades que realizan.

Doña Maribel del Socorro P. es la coordinadora del grupo,los integrantes la eligieron  para este ciclo, ella vende verduras en el mercado durante la mañana y por la tarde trabaja en costura elaborando ropa en su casa, este trabajo lo hace con su mamá y es una segunda actividad. Tiene dos hijos en edad adolescentes, ellos estudian en la escuela del lugar donde viven y le ayudan a vender en la comunidad y entregan encargos de algunos clientes. Ella es soltera y con su trabajo ha criado a sus hijos.
El crédito lo necesita para comprar verduras y así ofrecer variedad a sus clientes como apios, lechugas, tomates, plátanos, etc.

Don Ascensión B. es integrante de este grupo desde que iniciaron el grupo, vive cerca de las otras dos integrantes, se dedica a la venta de comida, gaseosas, dulces y otros. Es soltero, no tiene hijos pero les ayuda a los gasto de cuatro sobrinos jóvenes a quienes les ha dado estudio, están en edades de 12,15,16 y 17 años, ellos le ayudan en el negocio. El sueña con seguir ayudando a sus estudios y manutención y verlos coronar sus carreras universitarias.

 Patricia Edith Gaitán es la ultima integrante de este grupo, ella se dedica a la confección de ropa en su casa y a la vez tiene una pequeña venta de golosinas, frescos, etc. Tiene tres hijos de 12,10 y 7 años, en edad escolar, ella es soltera y no tiene ayuda de nadie.
El crédito lo necesita para comprar materiales como telas, hilos, adornos y frutas.

Estos señores abonan todos los Lunes, es el mejor día para abonar, después del fin de semana que las ventas son mejores. 

Trabajan con Adim porque una de las clientas le animó que se integrará en un grupo solidario, así ella conformó su grupo con dos amigas cercanas y obtuvo el préstamo. Están contentos porque sienten que la institución confía en ellas y expresan que se proponen a quedar bien en los pagos.
texts.en:
In photo, from left to right: Maribel del Socorro P., Ascensión B. López, and Patricia Edith Gaitán López. This is the solidarity group B., from the city of Masaya, who are known for their hard work. Doña Maribel del Socorro P. is the group coordinator. The members chose her for this term. She sells vegetables in the market during the morning and works as a seamstress in the afternoon, making clothing in her home. She does this work with her mother as a secondary source of income. She has two adolescent children who are in a local school. They also help with sales in the commmunity and make deliveries to some clients. She is unmarried and has worked in order to support her children. She will use the loan to buy vegetables and offer her clients a variety of celery, lettuces, tomatoes, bananas, etc. Don Ascensión B. has been a member of this group since it began. He lives near the other two members and sells food, soft drinks, candy, and other products. He is unmarried and has no children, but he helps support four young nephews, whom he's put through school. They are 12, 15, 16, and 17 years old, and they help him with his business. He dreams of continuing to support them and pay for their schooling so they can obtain university degrees. Patricia Edith Gaitán is the last member of this group. She makes clothing at home and also sells candy, soft drinks, etc. She has three children, 12, 10, and 7 years old. She is unmarried and doesn't receive financial support from anyone else. She needs the loan to buy materials like fabrics, thread, notions, and fruit. The members make payments on Mondays. It's the best day to make payments because sales are better on the weekends. They work with Adim because of her clients encouraged her to join a solidarity group, so she formed a group with two close friends and obtained a loan. They are happy because they feel that the institution trusts them, and they say they intend to be prompt with their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies such as thread, cloth, soft drinks, and grains

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 29 años, es una madre muy responsable y hogareña, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Alberto de 33 años y su hija Yanela de 6 años y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. La venta de gas a ayudado en mucho al progreso de la vida de Juana, quien ha visto como poco a poco su vida está mejorando, ella tiene su tienda en una céntrica calle de la ciudad de Juliaca, siendo una de la distribuidoras de gas más conocidas de los alrededores y es que su carisma y alegría han hecho de ella una muy buena vendedora. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que al mismo tiempo que vende puede realizar las labores de su hogar, lleva un año realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil para es cerciorarse de que los balones estén en perfectas condiciones y así evitarse de correr riesgos innecesarios. Para el futuro que su negocio crezca y pueda poner una distribuidora de gas más grande. Este es el cuarto préstamo de Juana con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los tres mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más balones de gas para incrementar la mercadería que vende actualmente.
texts.en:
Juana, 29 years of age, is a responsible mother and homemaker. She lives in a rented house with her 33-year old husband, Alberto, and 6-year old daughter, Yanela. What she wishes for most is to improve her standard of living. The sale of gas has helped Juana’s progress a great deal, and she has seen how her situation has improved over time. Her store is on a major street in the city of Juliaca, and she is one of the most well known fuel distributors in her area. Her charisma and good humor have turned her into an excellent saleswoman. What she most enjoys about her work is that it allows her to still have time to tend to her family and home. She has been in this business for a year, and finds the most difficult aspect to be making sure her gas cylinders are in perfect condition so she doesn’t run any unnecessary risks. She hopes that her business will continue to grow, and that she can turn it into a larger enterprise. This is Juana’s fourth loan with MFP; she knows she must pay her loan installments on time, and is committed to doing so. She is a well-respected member of her cooperative bank, given the responsible qualities she has demonstrated. She will use the loan of three thousand five hundred soles she is requesting to buy more gas cylinders so she has more product to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia tiene 55 años y aunque ha trabajado duro por mucho tiempo, todavía siente que tiene muchas metas por cumplir. Vive sola en su propia casa, ya que su esposo falleció y sus hijos tienen sus propias familias. Hace más D. 10 años que vive sola y trata D. sobresalir con su propio esfuerzo, ella es la administradora D. un taller mecánico, D. donD. los carros salen como nuevos, tiene 3 trabajadores que le ayudan y que son las personas que la acompañan diariamente, a quienes Lidia cariñosamente llama sus "guardianes". Aunque es mujer, el aprecio que le tiene a la mecánica es admirable, ya que se conoce todas las piezas D. un auto, disfruta mucho D. ver como un auto ingresa a su taller destrozado y sale como si no le hubiera sucedido nada. Lleva 20 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es conseguir los repuestos que necesitan los carros. Lidia desea que con el tiempo su taller crezca y se convierta en el más visitado, sabe que es un largo camino, pero dice que todavía tienes las fuerzas necesarias para afrontarlo. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y espera no fallar en los pagos D. sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es una socia muy comprometida y solidaria. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevos repuestos para los autos que está arreglando actualmente.
texts.en:
Lidia is 55 years old and, even though she has worked hard for much of the time, she still feels she has many goals she wants to accomplish. She lives alone in her own home, given her husband passed away and her children are grown with their own families. She has been living alone for more than 10 years, trying to excel through her own efforts. She manages a repair shop, where cars come out like new. She has 3 workers that work with her on a daily basis, and Lidia fondly calls them her “guardians”. Even though she is a woman, the appreciation she has for auto mechanics is admirable given she knows all the parts of a car. She enjoys observing how a car enters her garage destroyed, and leaves as if nothing had happened to it. She has been in this business for 20 years, and finds the hardest aspect is obtaining the repair parts that cars need. Lidia hopes that her repair shop grows over time, and turns into the most frequented one in the area. She knows she has a long road ahead of her, but says she still has the strength to meet the challenges. This is her third loan with MFP, and she hopes not to fail with her loan installment payments. She is a very committed and responsible member of her cooperative bank. She will use the three thousand soles she is requesting to buy repair parts for cars she is currently working on.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy car repair parts.

loans.name: Belking Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: José Agustín M. Bermúdez, Mauda Patricia M. Bermúdez e Iselita del Rosario Jalinas Bermúdez

Llegaron a tener crédito con Adim porque una cliente les habló del tipo de crédito que recibían, donde confiaban en la honorabilidad de los clientes.

Este grupo es originario de la comarca La Montañita, son personas conocidas por sus actividades económicas.:
Don José Agustín es un joven soltero que se dedica a la venta de frutas en el M. municipal, compra las frutas en la comarca y las vende muy temprano, esto para ayudar a su familia con los gastos del hogar, tiene a cargo a su mamá , ofrece frutas de la temporada que son las más baratas, él sueña con mejorar su vivienda.

Doña Mauda Patricia es  la coordinadora del grupo, es una joven mujer madre de dos niños de edad escolar,se dedica al destace de cerdo y elaboración de nacatamales, esta actividad la hace en su casa para dar atención a los niños y hacer los oficios del hogar. Sueña dar estudio a sus hijos y mejorar su vivienda, expresa que esta contenta de trabajar con Adim porque ella nunca había tenido oportunidad de un crédito por no tener garantías y ahora ella va a quedar bien a la institución que confía en ella.

Doña Iselita es una joven mujer, soltera y sin hijos, de ella dependen sus padres en todos sus gastos, se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas en el M. de Masaya.
Ella sueña con poder proporcionar siempre a sus padres lo que necesiten y mejorar su vivienda. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad.

Estos señores abonan todos los Lunes, es el mejor día para abonar, después del fin de semana que las ventas son mejores y así garantizan la cuota del préstamo.
texts.en:
In the photo from left to right: José Agustín M. Bermúdez, Mauda Patricia M. Bermúdez and Iselita del Rosario Jalinas Bermúdez.

These individuals have come to ask for a loan with ADIM because a customer told them about the type of credit they receive, where they trust the integrity of its borrowers.

This group is from the region of La Montañita and are known for their economic activities:

Don José Agustín is a single youth that sells fruits in the municipal market. He buys fruits in the region and sells them very early in order to help his family with household expenses and to take care of his mother. He sells seasonal fruits at the cheapest prices and his dream is to improve his housing.

Mauda Patricia is the coordinator of the group and is a young mother of two school-age children. She makes pork fillings for tamales, which she does at home in order to take care of her kids and do house chores. She dreams of sending her children to study and improving her housing. She is very happy to work with ADIM because she has never had the opportunity to receive loans and is going to make a good impression to this institution that has trusted her.

Iselita is a young single woman without children but with parents who depend on her for all of their expenses. She sells vegetables and fruits at the Masaya market. She dreams of always being able to provide for her parents what they need and to improve her home. She has had her business for many years.

These individuals will pay back every Monday, which is the best day to pay, because after the weekend the sales are the best and so in this fashion they will pay their loan installments.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase fruits products for their local stores

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora tiene 36 años, es una mujer muy alegre y carismática, vive en un cuarto alquilado junto a su menor hijo Cristian de 13 años, a quien desea dar una buena vida. Su negocio es la venta de películas, documentales, telenovelas, dibujos, etc, en formato DVD, las cuales son muy solicitados por sus clientes. Ella tiene su puesto en el mercado Tupac Amaru (mercado importante  de la ciudad de Juliaca) y es una de las primeras en conseguir los últimos estrenos de la cartelera. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre las películas que se están vendiendo mejor. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer al tanto de que sus películas no sean sustraídas por algunas personas que buscan un momento de distracción para robarle. Para su futuro, anhela tener una tienda especializada en la venta de DVDs, donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad. Este es el cuarto préstamo de Nora con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que siente que tiene una responsabilidad con las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy respetada por el orden que le pone a las reuniones. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más DVDs para incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que vende.
texts.en:
Nora is 36 years old, and she is a very happy and charismatic woman. She lives in a rented room along with her son Christian, who is 13, and for whom she wants to provide a good life. Nora's business is selling movies, documentaries, soap operas, cartoons, etc. on DVD, which are purchased by many customers. She has her business at the Tupac Amaru Market (a very important market in the city of Juliaca), and she is one of the first people to get in the newest releases. The thing that she likes best about her work is telling customers which of the movies that she sells are the best. She has been doing this business for 15 years, and the thing that she thinks is most difficult is watching to make sure her movies aren't stolen by people who are just waiting for a moment of distraction when they can rob her. For the future, Nora hopes to have a store that specializes in DVD sales, where she can sell in comfort. This is her fourth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she is prepared to pay all her loans on time. She already feels that she has a responsibility to the members of her communal bank, where she is well respected for the order she keeps in their meetings. With the 3,000 soles that she has requested, she will purchase more DVDs to build up the merchandise she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build up merchandise

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 59 años, es una mujer muy alegre y carismática, vive en la casa que heredó de sus padres, junto a sus dos hijos Ronal de 25 y Pedro de 22 años, a quienes desea dar una buena vida. El día de Rosa comienza muy temprano por la mañana, cuando abre su quiosco y empieza con su venta de carne de pollo, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado Cerro Colorado (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), ella es una vendedora muy persuasiva y siempre logra sacar una sonrisa de sus clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, quienes con sus bromas hacen más alegres las largas jornadas. Lleva 20 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto. Para un futuro cercano espera tener un emporio (carnicería) donde pueda vender con mayor tranquilidad la carne de pollo congelada. Este es el primer préstamo de Rosa con MFP y se siente feliz de la oportunidad de crédito, en su banco comunal es una socia muy querida ya que siempre ayuda en todo lo necesario. Invertirá la mitad de los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita en la compra de más carne de pollo para cubrir mejor la demanda de sus clientes, y la otra mitad la invertirá en su otro negocio que es la confección de gorras.
texts.en:
Rosa, 59 years old, is a very happy and charismatic woman. She lives in a house she inherited from her parents, with her two sons: Ronal, 25 years old, and Pedro, 22. She wants to give them both a good life. Rosa’s day starts very early in the morning, when she opens her kiosk and starts selling poultry. Her business is located at the Cerro Colorado market (a very important market in the city of Juliaca). She is a very persuasive saleswoman, and always manages to put a smile on her customers’ faces. What she enjoys most about her business is chatting with the other saleswomen around her, and her jokes make their long journeys happier ones. She has been in business for 20 years, and finds the hardest part is staying at her site in the market all day. She hopes, in the near future, to have a butcher shop where she could sell her product more comfortably. This is Rosa’s first loan with MFP, and she is happy to have an opportunity to obtain credit. She is a beloved member of her cooperative bank, given she always helps out when needed. She plans to invest half of the three thousand soles she’s requesting into the purchase of more poultry, so she can meet her customers’ demand. She would invest the second half of the funds into her other business, which is making caps/hats.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.es: Vicky tiene 41 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y cumplida, vive es una cuarto alquilado junto a su hermana, ya que es natural de la ciudad del Cuzco. Aunque todavía no tiene hijos, ha encontrado en su desarrollo personal el incentivo que necesita para esforzarse en el trabajo. Se dedica a la venta de películas, documentales, telenovelas, dibujos, etc, en formato DVD, las cuales son muy solicitados en la zona de la mina la Rinconada, que es donde vende su mercadería. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que en sus momentos de aburrimiento puede aprovechar para ver una de las películas que tiene, lleva 15 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar el intenso frió de la zona, ya que se encuentra a más de 5 000 m.s.n.m, pero aun así sabe que tiene que poner todo de su parte para que su negocio salga a delante. Para un futuro cercano espera que pueda tener una tienda donde pueda atender mejor a sus clientes. Este es el quinto préstamo de Vicky con MFP y se siente en la responsabilidad de pagarlo a tiempo y para ello ahorrará poco a poco. En su banco comunal es una socia muy activa y solidaria, motivo por el cual es muy respetada por las demás socias. Con los tres mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más DVDs y hará arreglar su pequeña carretilla donde vende su mercadería.
texts.en:
Vicky is 41 years old, and she is a very hardworking and accomplished woman. She lives in a rented room with her sister, which is normal for the city of Cuzco. Although she has no children, she has found, in her personal development, the motivation she needs to work hard. Vicky sells movies, documentaries, soap operas, cartoons, etc. on DVD, which are in high demand in the mine area of Rinconada, which is where she sells her merchandise. The thing she likes best about her work are those times of boredom when she can enjoy watching one of the movies she has. Vicky has been doing this business for 15 years, and the thing she thinks is most difficult is having to endure the intense cold in the area, which is more than 5,000 meters (16,404 feet) above sea level, but she knows that she has to put 100% of herself into the business in order to succeed. In the near future, Vicky hopes to have a store where she can better attend to her customers. This is the fifth loan she has received from Kiva partner MFP, and she understands the responsibility she has to repay it on time, so she will save money little by little. In her communal bank, she is a very active and dedicated member, which is why she is so respected by the other members. With this loan of 3,000 soles, she will purchase more DVDs and fix up her small stand out of which she sells her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her merchandise

loans.name: Zaida

texts.es: Zaida tiene 28 años, es una joven madre soltera que vive en la casa de sus familiares junto a sus 3 hijos Erick de 10, Britney de 8 y Lidia de un año, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. El restaurante de Zaida es muy concurrido por los clientes que buscan una comida deliciosa y un precio accesible, ella es una buena cocinera y sus sazón es muy admirada por todos sus clientes, sus menús son muy surtidos llegando a ofrecer hasta 5 platos de fondo para que el cliente escoja según su agrado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar y darle a la comida su toque secreto, lleva 6 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que atender sola a todos los clientes que entran a su restaurante. Para un futuro cercano espera que pueda contratar a personas que la ayuden a realizar un mejor trabajo y ha mejorar la atención en su restaurante. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, está muy feliz por la oportunidad de crédito, en su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevas ollas y hará arreglar la infraestructura de su restaurante.
texts.en:
Zaida, 28, is a young single mother. She lives in her relatives’ house with her three children; Erik, 10; Britney, 8; and Lidia, 1. Her children are the motivation for all of her efforts. Zaida’s restaurant is very busy with customers who look for a delicious meal at a reasonable price. She is a good cook, and her good seasoning amazes all of her customers. Her menu items are varied. Her customers can select, according to their preference, from up to five main dishes. What she likes best about her work is cooking and giving her food her secret touch. She has been doing this for six years. The most difficult thing is to have to wait on all of the customers in her restaurant by herself. In the near future she hopes to be able to hire people to help her do a better job and to improve the service in her restaurant. This is her first loan with MFP. She is very happy for the opportunity to receive a loan. She is very united with her colleagues in her community bank. She will use the 1,000 PEN to buy pots and make repairs to the restaurant’s infrastructure.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy utensils and make repairs to her restaurant

loans.name: Cayetano Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha:   Gloria del Carmen R. V., Carmen A. M. y Pabla María T..

El grupo solidario está compuesto de tres mujeres originarias de la zona norte del país, tienen nueve años de vivir en la ciudad de Masaya.
Doña Gloria del Carmen es la coordinadora del grupo, es una joven mujer, tiene dos hijos y vive con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en el M. de Masaya, ella trabaja desde muy joven , este oficio lo aprendió de su madre que vende a la par de ella.
Sueña con mejorar su casa y hacer un ahorro para cuando sea una adulta mayor  y así no depender de su hijo y además engrandecer su negocio.

 Doña Carmen A. ella vende verduras y frutas en el M. de Masaya, su horario de trabajo es desde temprana horas de la mañana hasta las tres de la tarde que regresa a su casa, ella ofrece principalmente plátanos que compra al mayor en el mismo M. y ella vende al detalle.En su casa vende refrescos y golosinas, sus hijos le ayudan a ver el negocio, tiene dos hijos en edad de 11y 8 años.Espera poder crecer en su negocio para alcanzar sus metas de mejorar su vivienda.


Doña Pabla María T. es una joven soltera que trabaja elaborando tortillas en su casa,tiene buena clientela, trabaja diariamente desde tempranas horas hasta el medio día que lo dedica a la compra de los insumos en el M.. El crédito lo necesita para comprar maíz , leña, comales, etc.

Expresan que en Adim le han enseñado a controlar mejor su negocio con las capacitaciones que reciben y también a mejorar de manera personal.Se proponen trabajar con Adim en varios ciclos y están claras que para esto es solamente si son disciplinadas en sus pagos.
texts.en:
From left to right in the photograph; Gloria del Carmen R. V., Carmen A. M. and Pabla María T.. This solidarity group is comprised of three woman who are from the north originally, but have lived in the city of Masaya for nine years. Doña Gloria del Carmen is the group’s coordinator. She is a young woman who has two children and lives with her husband. She sells fruit and vegetables for a living in Masaya’s market. Doña Gloria del Carmen has been working since she was a young girl. In fact, she learned this job from her mother who sells along side her. She would love to be able to fix up her house and save some money so that when she is older she won’t have to depend on her son. She would also like to grow her business. Doña Carmen A. sells fruits and vegetables in Masaya’s market. She works from early in the morning and goes home at three in the afternoon. She mainly sells plantains at retail prices that she buys wholesale in the same market. She also sells soft drinks and sweets from her home. Her kids, who are 11 and 8, help her take care of the business. She hopes to grow her business so she can achieve her goals and make improvements to her home. Mrs. Pabla María T. is a young woman who is single. She makes tortillas at home and has many customers. She works everyday from early in the morning until mid-day when she goes to the market to buy her supplies. She needs a loan to buy corn, firewood, and “comales” (a pan to fry tortillas in). They say that ADIM has taught them how to manage their business better and also grow on a personal level through the trainings they receive. They plan to continue working with ADIM for several cycles and understand that they can only do this if they are disciplined about making their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Sr. De Malta Group

texts.es: Es un grupo formado por señoras que viven en un mismo Barrio Avenida Suecia, donD. se conocen bien, el Banco D. Emprendimiento se llama  "SEÑOR D. MALTA" esta conformada como presidenta la señora Gloria S. R., quien es una D. las mas responsables  y serias del grupo, ella tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en plena avenida,con el credito D. Emprender esta surtiendo su venta. La tesorera del grupo es la señora Betty Q. E., quien es una socia antigua D. Emprender, D. buen caracter, conoce muy bien a las socias,  ella tiene un cochecito donD. venD. hamburguesas, salchipapas  en plena avenida juntamente con la sobrina que es como su hija por que se la recogio desD. pequeña y con ella son 5 los hijos que tiene, su venta es a partir D. las 7 D. la noche hasta muy tarD..
texts.en:
Señor D. Malta, an enterprising bank, is comprised of women who live in the same neighborhood of Avenica Suecia. They know each other well. Gloria S. R. is the president. She is one of the most responsible and serious members. She has a grocery story in the central zone. With the loan from Emprender she is stocking her store. Betty Q. E. is the treasurer of the group. She is an old member of Emprender. She is good natured, and she knows the members very well. She has a little food car where she sells hamburgers and “salchipapas” (fast food maD. from fried sausages and fried potatoes) in the central zone. She sells together with her niece, who is like a daughter to her. She took her in when she was small. Counting her niece, she has five children. She sells from seven in the evening until very late.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Davila Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Francisca Azucena Dávila López, Maritza Guadalupe Sánchez Dávila y Meyling Francisca Dávila R..

 Este grupo tiene su domicilio en  la ciudad de Masaya en comarca Llano Grande, estas tres mujeres tienen actividades comerciales diferentes, se conocen desde hace muchos años y tienen una gran confianza una en la otra. 

Doña Francisca Azucena Dávila ,vende perecederos en el mercado de Masaya, vende frutas, las compra al por mayor y ella vende al detalle durante el día, tiene dos hijos pequeños que van a la escuela, su esposo es comerciante en el mismo mercado donde acarrea productos, le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.
Se dedica desde muy joven a su actividad comercial y ella piensa hacer crecer su negocio y así un día mejorar su casa.

Doña Maritza Guadalupe es una joven señora, casada, sin hijos, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ropa variada para todas las edades, como por ejemplo faldas, blusas, uniformes de estudiantes, etc. Es conocida por su actividad, ella vende en el mercado de Masaya y Granada donde tiene clientes fijos.Sueña con terminar la casa que están construyendo en terreno propio y muy pronto trasladarse a vivir ahí.
No tiene dependientes , se propone hacer crecer el negocio para salir adelante.

Doña Meyling Francisca Dávila ella invierte el crédito en comprar verduras que vienen de la zona norte del país y las vende en el mercado oriental al detalle, su horario de trabajo es desde tempranas horas de la madrugada hasta las tres de la tarde. Es casada madre de un hijo que la acompaña al trabajo. Ella sueña con mejorar su vivienda y crecer en el inventario de su negocio. Su esposo le ayuda con los gastos ya que él es comerciante.

Expresan que en Adim le han enseñado a controlar mejor su negocio con las capacitaciones que reciben y también a mejorar de manera personal.
texts.en:
Pictured from left to right: Francisca Azucena Dávila López, Maritza Guadalupe Sánchez Dávila, and Meyling Francisca Dávila R.. This group is based in the city of Masaya, in the Llano Grande region. These three women have different types of businesses, and they have known each other for a long time, so they have a great deal of confidence in each other. Francisca Azucena Dávila sells food in the Masaya market. During the day, she sells fruit that she purchases wholesale. She has two small children who go to school. Her husband is a vendor at the same market where she sells her products, and this helps with household expenses. She has been doing business since she was very young, and she is thinking of growing her business so that someday she can make home improvements. Maritza Guadalupe is a young woman, married and without children. She makes and sells various clothes for people of all ages, for example, dresses, blouses, school uniforms, etc. She is known for this business; she sells her products in the Masaya and Granada markets, where she has regular customers. She dreams of finishing the house that she and her husband are building on their own land and moving in soon after. She has no dependents; she wants to grow the business so she can be successful. Meyling Francisca Dávila will use this loan to purchase vegetables that come from the northern part of the county and sell them in the Oriental market. She works from early morning until three in the afternoon. She is married and the mother of one son who accompanies her at work. Her dream is to make home improvements and build up her business's inventory. Her husband helps her with expenses since he is a vendor. The women say that Kiva partner Adim has taught them to better manage their businesses through training they have received as well as helped them to improve their personal lives.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: El Buen Pastor Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: María Felix M., Sabina de los Angeles P. Hernández y Ana María R. Méndez.

El grupo solidario El Buen Pastor son originarios de la ciudad de Masaya en la comarca La Reforma, tienen varios ciclos de trabajar con Adim porque sienten que es una institución que ha confiado en ellos, expresan que se sienten como parte de la familia de Adim. Todas las miembros del grupo venden ropa ambulante desde hace varios años.

Doña María Felix es la coordinadora de este grupo, ella tiene años de tener esta actividad ha sabido como es el giro de su negocio, expresa que ella ha visto como en cada préstamo le va quedando un mayor inventario en el negocio. Ella es una madre, que mantuvo a sus hijos sola enseñándoles a trabajar, se dedica desde hace muchos años a la venta de frutas y verduras, las compra en el mercado de Masaya y vende a mejor precio en el mercado Oriental.
Todo lo que ha logrado le anima a seguir trabajando y quedando bien en Adim, esto se lo hace saber a su grupo y por eso se encarga de ir a dejar el abono para garantizar la puntualidad.

Doña Sabina de los Angeles P.  se dedica a la venta de  tamales, elotes, etc. ella lo elabora en su casa y muy temprano al siguiente día los ofrece en el mercado oriental. Tiene más de diez años de dedicarse a esta actividad, es madre de un solo hijo que es joven y ya trabaja, le ayuda con los gastos de la casa y también su esposo. Sueña con mejorar una parte de su vivienda que es necesaria. 

Doña Ana María R. es una señora muy trabajadora que vende ropa, es madre de un hijo que vive con ella, lo ha criado con su trabajo sin ayuda de nadie, expresa que hasta ahora logra obtener un crédito que es en base a la confianza y está clara que debe de ser puntual con su pago. 
Ella vende productos de ropa y cosméticos que es la actividad que le ayuda a percibir más ingresos.
texts.en:
Photo from left to right: María Felix M., Sabina de los Angeles P. Hernández y Ana María R. Méndez. The members of the united group, El Buen Pastor, are from the city of Masaya in the La Reforma region. They have worked with Admin for several loan cycles because they feel that is an institution that has believed in them. They feel like part of the Admin family. All of the members of the group have sold clothes as street vendors for many years. Doña María Felix has been the group’s coordinator for years. She has known the turns her business takes. She has seen how each loan has led to having a bigger inventory. She is a mother who raised her children by herself. She taught them how to work. For many years she has been selling fruits and vegetables. She buys them in the Masaya market, and she sells them for a better price in the Oriental market. Everything that she has achieved motivates her to keep working and doing well with Admin. She lets her group know this. She is in charge of going and leaving the installment to be sure of its punctuality. Sabina de los Angeles P. sells tamales and corn, etc. She makes them in her house. Very early the following day she sells them in the Oriental market. She has done this for over ten years. She has one young son who works. Her son and her husband help her with the household expenses. She dreams of improving a part of her house that needs it. Ana María R. is a very hard working woman who sells clothes. She has one son who lives with her. With the income from her work, she raised him without help from anyone. It is clear to her that a loan is based on trust, and she must be punctual with her payment. She sells clothes and cosmetics; this helps her receive more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perishables

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen C. is from the village of Mitacas, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Helen is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from "Habal-Habal" business, transporting folks from town center to their residence. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. Helen is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used maintenance for their motorcycle and repair. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Helen from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: maintenance and repair of their motor cycle

loans.name: El Futuro Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha:  Marisol del Socorro E. Téllez, Lydia Isabel Gómez S. y Elsa del Carmen Jarquín Martínez.
El grupo solidario El Futuro es originario de la ciudad de Masaya, ellas por igual tienen sus actividades económicas y dependen solo de ellas, son bien conocidas por esta actividad en sus barrios.
Doña Marisol tiene un pequeño taller de elaboración de sandalias de mujer, este funciona con tres trabajadores y entre ellos su papá y sus hijos, es madre de cuatro hijos de 7,9,10 y 13 años, todos ellos estudian y ayudan en el taller, su esposo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, trabaja en una empresa de radio, ella expresa que su negocio es de ella y compra lo que ella quiere para ella y sus hijos. Sueña con mejorar su negocio y así mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.

Doña Lydia Isabel es una mujer mayor con una familia 3 hijos adolescentes, ellos estudian en la escuela del barrio, le ayudan en el negocio de la venta de pollo ,pero su actividad mas fuerte es la venta de ropa al crédito. Ella vende pantalones, camisas, zapatos etc., su esposo trabaja en un desarme y le ayuda con los gastos de la casa, del negocio ella asume gastos extras del hogar como ropa de los hijos, cuadernos, etc. Su negocio le garantiza la alimentación del hogar y es por esto que ella es muy importante en las decisiones del hogar.
Doña Lydia es la coordinadora del grupo, la eligieron por ser muy responsable.

Doña Elsa del Carmen Jarquín al igual que la otra integrante tiene un pequeño taller de elaboración de sandalias de mujer, tiene un trabajador fijo, el resto lo hace ella junto con sus hijos y su esposo. Además también hace repostería para vender  en su casa .
Sueña con mejorar el taller y tener mejores condiciones de trabajo.
texts.en:
Pictured left to right: Marisol del Socorro E. Téllez, Lydia Isabel Gómez S. and Elsa del Carmen Jarquín Martínez. El Futuro Group (The Future), is originally from the city of Masaya. The women have their own businesses and depend only on themselves. They are well known for their work in their neighborhoods. Marisol has a small women's sandal-making shop, which she runs with three workers, her father and her children. She is the mother of four children who are seven, nine, 10, and 13 years old, all of whom study and help her at the shop. Her husband helps her with household expenses; he works for the radio. She said that the business is her own, and she buys what she wants for herself and her children. She dreams of improving her business, thus improving her family's quality of life. Lydia Isabel is an older woman with a family of three teens who attend the neighborhood school. They help her with her chicken-selling business, but her strongest business is selling clothes on credit. She sells pants, shirts, shoes, etc. Her husband works in a parts shop and helps her with household expenses. Through her business, Lydia Isabel takes on extra household expenses such as clothes for the kids, school notebooks, etc. Her business guarantees income for the home, and because of this, she plays an important role in making household decisions. Lydia is the leader of this group; she was elected because she is very responsible. Elsa del Carmen Jarquín, aside from being the final group member, owns a small women's sandal-making shop. She has one permanent employee, and the rest of the business is run with the help of her children and husband. She also makes and sells baked goods out of her home. She dreams of improving the shop and her working conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Diega

texts.en:
Maria Diega is from the village of Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. To make a living, Maria operates a flower garden where she grows flowers for sale in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business, comes from selling flowers to local community members. Maria has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maria joined PMPC to gain access to financial to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Maria is requesting a new loan of 30,000 which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Maria from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: expansion of flower garden

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma B. is from the village of Yahong, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Wilma is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Wilma owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Wilma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Wilma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Wilma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: El Narciso Group

texts.es: Foto de Izquierda a derecha:  Modesta Argentina Gaitán, María Betsabeth
texts.en: Pictured left to right: Modesta Argentina Gaitán, María Betsabeth

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie P. is a resident of Sebucao, Dumalinao, Zambaoanga del Sur. She is 28 years old and is a married women with two infant children. Elsie is starting a business running a small carenderia (restaurant), primarily providing food like viands (tasty dishes) to local community members. She is just starting this business. Her husband also has a monthly income from his work. In 2008. Elsie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used as business capital for her carenderia. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To use as business capital for her small carenderia

loans.name: Flor De Sacuanjoche Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha:  Maira Lorena R. García, María Danelia Téllez y Maritza del Socorro Sánchez Castellón.

Doña Maira Lorena R. tiene un pequeño taller de elaboración de sandalias. Ella es mujer casada con tres hijos, estos le ayudan en el negocio y así ella puede salir a comprar al mercado, trabaja con su esposo que es zapatero. Sueña con mejorar el taller para trabajar mejor aun en invierno. Tiene 12 años de tener este negocio.

Doña María Danelia Téllez es la coordinadora del grupo, es madre con dos hijos jóvenes, vende ropa usada de primera, la ofrece en su casa, tiene muchos clientes fijos que le hacen encargos de ropa y le pagan al crédito. Inició teniendo experiencia de venta de ropa hace tres años y descubrió un mercado de clientes para este producto, con el crédito compra ropa y zapatos. Sueña con mejorar su vivienda que necesita de varios cambios.

Doña Maritza del Socorro tiene es propietaria de una pulpería ,es conocida en su comunidad por su establecimiento, es madre de tres hijos jovenes que le ayuda en la pulpería, su esposo trabaja en un supermercado como repartidor. Decidió instalar su negocio hace varios años para tener ingresos propios y comprarse lo que le gusta, sus sueños es mejorar su negocio hasta que sea una mediana empresa y poder brindar estudios universitarios a sus hijos.
.
texts.en:
Pictured left to right: Maira Lorena R. García, María Danelia Téllez, and Maritza del Socorro Sánchez Castellón. Maira Lorena R. has a small sandal-making shop. She is married with three children, who help her with the business so she can leave to go shopping. she works with her husband, who is a shoemaker. She dreams of improving the shop so she can work better even in the winter. She has been doing this business for 12 years. María Danelia Téllez is the group leader. She is the mother of two young children. She sells warm-weather clothes out of her home. She has many regular customers who order clothes and pay on credit. She started this business three years ago, already having clothing sales experience, and has since discovered a clientele market for this product. With this loan she will purchase clothes and shoes. She dreams of improving her home, which needs various updates. Maritza del Socorro owns a general store. She is known in the community for her establishment. She is the mother of three young children who help her at the store. Her husband works at the supermarket as a delivery man. She decided to start her business several years ago in order to have her own income and be able to buy things she liked. Her dreams are to improve the business until it's medium-sized so she can pay for her children's college.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria P. lives in Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 59 years old, married, and has 4 adult-aged children. Victoria has made a living from farming for over 39 years. The main source of income comes from the harvest of her rice fields. Victoria sells to local community members and earns approximately 7,000.

In 2007, Victoria joined PMPC to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Victoria successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000.00 which she used to purchase fertilizer for her rice fields. 

Victoria is requesting a new loan of 12,000 which she will use to purchase five sacks of fertilizer and to pay the labor for planting rice. This loan will be her 4th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Maritess

texts.en:
Maritess E. is from the village of Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Maritess owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of products to the local community. Maritess has owned the store for several years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. Maritess recently joined PMPC to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase more products to sell. This is Maritess's first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell.

loans.name: Gilbert Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha:  Teodora del Socorro Jarquín A., Lesbia Johana C. Téllez, María Teresa Sánchez y Lorena  del Carmen López Hernández.

El grupo solidario Gilbert está conformado por cuatro señoras, todas ellas son mujeres trabajadoras, originarias del departamento de Masaya, sus condiciones de vida son humildes, trabajan con Adim porque les gusta que confíen en ellas, expresaron..
Son vecinas, de confianza, se conocen hace muchos años y son muy unidas. 
.
