Doña  Teodora del Socorro Jarquín es la coordinadora del grupo, fue elegida por ser una persona muy responsable, es viuda, tiene una pulpería pequeña pero bien surtida de productos, tiene una hija de 15 años que estudia y le ayuda a ver el negocio, ella tiene varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad , sueña con mejorar el negocio y algún día tener una miscelánea para que su hija estudie y tenga una profesión.

Doña Lesbia Johana  joven mujer vende  chicha en bolsas y en botellas, ella distribuye a vendedores que ofrecen sus refrescos en los barrios y el mercado, actualmente tiene dos vendedores, en su casa también vende por unidades; con mas de cuatro años de dedicarse a esta actividad ha sacado su familia adelante, su esposo le ayuda con los gastos para sus tres hijos, él es educador social. Además vende ropa al crédito como segunda actividad. Sueña con darle estudios universitarios a sus hijos que están en edades de 16, 15 y 14 años.



Doña  María Teresa Sánchez es una joven mujer, madre de una niña de ocho años que estudia en una escuela cerca de su casa, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de cobertores, sábanas y fundas, compra sus materiales en el mercado como telas. hilos, adornos, etc., tiene muchos clientes que le piden encargos, sueña con tener su propia vivienda, ella es muy responsable.

Doña Lorena del Carmen López es una mujer propietaria de un pequeño salón de belleza
Ubicado en su casa de habitación, es madre de un solo hijo ya adulto, su esposo trabaja como guarda de seguridad en una empresa en Managua. Ella inició su negocio hace cinco años, primero fue trabajadora de un salón en el mercado. El crédito lo necesita para comprar materiales como líquidos de permanente, shampoo, pinturas cosméticas, etc.
Sueña con tener un salón más completo y mejorar su casa separando el salón del resto de la casa.

Este grupo está comprometido a pagar puntual y así seguir obteniendo créditos con Adim, están seguras que con el crédito saldrán adelante porque incrementan sus ventas y así sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Teodora del Socorro Jarquín A., Lesbia Johana C. Téllez, María Teresa Sánchez and Lorena del Carmen López Hernández (from left to right). The Gilbert solidary group is made up of 4 women, all of whom are hard-working and are from the department of Masaya. They live humble lives and work with Adim because they like that they trust them. They are neighbors that trust each other since they have known each other for many years and are very united. Mrs. Teodora del Socorro Jarquín is the coordinator of the group. She was elected because she is a very responsible person. She is a widow, and she has a small grocery store that is well-stocked with products. She has a 15-year-old daughter, who is in school. She dreams of improving her business and someday of having a general store so that her daughter can study and have a job. Mrs. Lesbia Johana is a young woman, who sells chicha (a type of beverage) in bags and in bottles. She distributes this to vendors, who offer her drinks in the neighborhoods and in the market. At present, she has two vendors. In her house, she also sells them individually. She has pursued this activity for more than 4 years, and she has taken her family forward. Her husband helps her with the expenses for their three children. He is a teacher. She also sells clothes on credit as a second job. She dreams of providing for her children to attend university. Her children as 16, 15, and 14 years old. Mrs. María Teresa Sánchez is a young woman. She has an eight-year-old daughter, who attends a school near her house. She makes and sells bedspreads, sheets, and pillowcases. She buys materials in the market, including fabric, threads, decoration, etc. She has many clients that give her orders for her products. She dreams of having her own home. She is very responsible. Mrs. Lorena del Carmen López is a woman who owns a small beauty salon, which is located in her house. She has one son, who is an adult. Her husband works as a security guard in a business in Managua. She began her business 5 years ago. At first, she was working in a salon in the market. The loan is needed to buy materials like liquids for perms, shampoo, cosmetics, etc. She dreams of having a more complete salon, to improve her house, and to separate her salon from her house. This group has promised to make their payments punctually, and this is how they continue to get loan from Adim. She are certain that with this loan they will go forward because they will be able to increase their sales and, therefore, their incomes.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various products, including beauty products

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es: Basilia tiene 32 años, es una madre muy trabajadora y responsable, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Miguel de 35 años y su hija Elena de 8 años, a quienes desea darles una vida mejor. La jornada de Basilia comienza a las 6 de la mañana, cuando abre su tienda de abarrotes y se alista para empezar a vender sus productos, su tienda está ubicada en el barrio la Rinconada (barrio importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), donde atiende todo el día hasta a las 9 de la noche, cuando cierra su puesto sabiendo que al día siguiente le espera otra larga jornada de trabajo. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es conversar con sus clientes, así hace más amenas sus largas jornadas de trabajo, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y lo que menos le gusta es tener que permanecer todo el día en su tienda, aun así sabe que su sacrificio no es en vano. Para un futuro cercano espera tener una tienda más grande donde pueda vender productos más variados. Este es el primer préstamo de Basilia con MFP y sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas a tiempo. En su banco comunal es muy alegre y siempre está al tanto de todos los acuerdos que tienen entre socias. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos para su tienda y así podrá ofrecer a sus clientes un mejor stock.
texts.en:
Basilia is 32 years old and is a hard-working and responsible woman. She lives in her own house with her husband Miguel, who is 35 years old, and their daughter Elena, who is 8 years old. Basilia wants to give them a better life. The hard-working Basilia wakes up at 6 in the morning, when she opens her grocery store and prepares to begin selling her products. Her store is located in the neighborhood of La Rinconada, which is an important neighborhood in the city of Juliaca. She works at her grocery store all day, until 9 at night, when she closes the store, knowing that the next day will bring another long work-day. What she likes most about her business is talking with her clients; this makes the long days more pleasant. She has spent 4 years working in her business. What she likes least is having to spend all day in her store, even though she knows that her sacrifice is not in vain. In the near future, she hopes to have a larger store, where she can sell more varied products. This is her first loan with MFP, and she knows that she has to pay her installments on time. In her community bank, she is very happy and is always up to date with the agreements that exist among the members. With the 1000 soles that she is requesting, she will buy more products for her store and will be able to offer more items to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es: Faustina tiene 35 años, es una mujer que siempre ha luchado por salir adelante en la vida, vive en su casa propia junto a sus hijos Mario de 13 y Steve de 11, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Gracias a la venta de gas Faustina ha podido salir adelante, ella tiene una planta distribuidora muy grande, la cual está ubicada en su casa. Sus principales clientes son los restaurantes de la ciudad de Juliaca, donde diariamente deja cerca de 50 balones de gas. Faustina trabaja para la empresa “Limagas”, pero es ella quien maneja las distribuciones y la cantidad que se vende. Lleva 10 años en esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es distribuir los balones de gas, ya que muchas veces viaja en moto para dejar los pedidos, pero siente que esta es una tarea muy peligrosa, así que tiene mucho cuidado en la seguridad de su personal. Para un futuro cercano espera tener sucursales en lugares más céntricos y así poder abarcar un mercado más grande. Este es su octavo préstamo con MFP y está decidida a pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, así como hizo con sus anteriores préstamos. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida y respetada por sus compañeras. Con los tres mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más balones de gas para incrementar la cantidad que vende actualmente.
texts.en:
Faustina is 35 years old and has always fought to go forward in her life. She lives in her own house with her children; Mario is 13 years old and Steve is 11 years old. They are the motivations for all of her efforts. By selling gas, Faustina has been able to go forward. She has a very large distribution plant, which is located in her house. Her main clients are the restaurants in the city of Juliaca, where daily she sells 50 canisters of gas. Faustina works for the company “Limagas,” but she manages the distributions and the quantities that she sells. She has spent 10 years in this activity, and what she likes most is to distribute the gas, since many times she travels on motorcycle to drop off her orders. However, she feels that this is a very dangerous job, so she is very careful about her safety. In the near future, she hopes to have branches in central locations so that she will be able to serve a larger market. This is her eighth loan with MFP, and she will make her payments on time, as she has with her previous loans. She is a well-liked and respected member of her community bank. With the 3500 soles she has requested, she will buy many canisters of gas to increase the quantity that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Las Pastoras Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Coidalia del Carmen Martínez, Martha Lorena M. Martínez y Mercedes Concepción Sánchez Martínez.

El grupo solidario Las Pastoras, está conformado por tres señores originarias de la ciudad de Masaya , grupo con excelente record crediticio, sus actividades son diversas.

Doña Coidalia del Carmen Martínez vende ropa en el mercado municipal, la ropa que ofrece es ropa menor como calcetines, pañuelos, etc. y además ofrece gaseosas, reposterías y otros productos. Ella trabaja todo el día y de Lunes a Domingo, este trabajo lo aprendió de su madre que a la vez vende cerca de ella. Es casada , madre de tres hijos en edades de 10, 8 y 3 años, están con ella en el mercado.Su esposo vende ambulante en el mismo mercado.

Doña Martha Lorena M. vende granos básicos, los compra al por mayor y ella vende al detalle durante el día, tiene tres hijo de 9,5 y 4 años que van a la escuela, su esposo es comerciante en el mismo mercado donde acarrea productos, le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.
Se dedica desde muy joven a su actividad comercial y ella piensa hacer crecer su negocio y así un día mejorar su casa.
Doña Mercedes Concepción es la coordinadora del grupo, ella es persona responsable con el cargo que le toco ella se dedica a la venta de comida , refrescos, enchiladas etc., esta actividad la realiza desde hace varios años, tiene clientes fijos. En el negocio le ayudan sus hijos a la elaboración de los platos, tiene tres hijos de 9,11 y 14 años, su esposo le ayuda con la alimentación de la familia.
texts.en:
Pictured left to right: Coidalia del Carmen Martínez, Martha Lorena M. Martínez, and Mercedes Concepción Sánchez Martínez. Las Pastoras Group (The Shepherds) is comprised of three women from the city of Masaya. The group has an excellent credit history, and their businesses are diverse. Coidalia del Carmen Martínez sells clothing at the city market. The type of clothing she sells is small things such as socks, scarves, etc. She also sells fizzy drinks, baked goods, and other products. She works every day, Monday through Sunday. She learned this business from her mother, who, at the time, also was a vendor near her. She is married and the mother of three children, 10, eight, and three years old, and they go with her to the market. Her husband is also a traveling vendor in the same market. Martha Lorena M. sells basic grains that she purchases wholesale. She has three children who are nine, five, and four years old and who go to school. Her husband is a vendor in the same market where she sells her products, and he helps her with household expenses. She has been in this business since she was very young, and she is thinking of growing her business so that one day she can make home improvements. Mercedes Concepción is the leader of the group. She is the person who is responsible for the loan the group has taken out. She sells food, drinks, enchiladas, etc., which is something she has been doing for several years, and she has regular customers. Her children help her with the business by making the meals. She has three children who are nine, 11, and 14 years old. Her husband helps her provide for the family.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients and merchandise

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es: Mariluz tiene 38 años, es una madre amorosa, vive en su propia casa junto a sus 2 hijas Teresa de 18 y Roció de 15 años, a quienes desea darles buenos estudios superiores. Ella es dueña de una combi (camioneta), la cual trabaja en una empresa de transportes que brinda servicio urbano y Mariluz es la encargada de cobrar los pasajes en dicho transporte, de paso que aprovecha para estar siempre vigilando que no le pase nada a su carro, ya que puso todos los ahorros que tenía para su compra. Lleva 4 años realizando este trabajo y lo que más le gusta es bromear con los pasajeros, para que los largos recorridos sean más amenos, pero lo que menos le gusta es tener que levantarse temprano para salir a ganar pasajeros, aun así no decae en su afán de continuar con sus sueños y alcanzar sus metas. Para un futuro cercano espera comprar otra combi para que también trabaje en transporte. Este es el tercer préstamo de Mariluz con MFP, está muy feliz de la oportunidad de crédito y sabe que tiene que invertir el dinero en su negocio, para que sea más productivo. Los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados los invertirá en comprar nuevas llantas para su combi, ya que con el paso del tiempo se han ido desgastando.
texts.en:
Mariluz is a 38-year-old loving mother who lives in her own house with her two daughters, 18-year-old Teresa and 15-year-old Roció, for whom she wants to give the best educational opportunities. Mariluz is the owner of a van she uses for her work with an urban transportation company. She is responsible for charging passengers for this transportation and always makes sure she is vigilant that nothing happens to her car, since she’s put all of her savings into its purchase. She has been doing this work for the past four years and what she likes most is joking with the passengers so that the longer routes are more pleasant. What she likes the least is that she has to wake up early to leave and pick up passengers, but despite this, her efforts to continue reaching for her dreams and achieving her goals have not declined. In the near future she hopes to purchase another van to also use for transportation. This is the third loan that Mariluz requests with MFP and is very happy to receive the opportunity to get credit and knows that she needs to invest the money in her business in order to be more productive. The 3000 soles she requests will go to the purchase of new tires for her van since time has caused them to wear out.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase tires for her van

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es: Segundina tiene 31 años, es una persona muy trabajadora, vive en un cuarto alquilado junto a su esposo Mateo de 36 años y juntos desean salir adelante. Cocinando su rico” salchimote” (plato hecho a base de mote frito y pedazos de pollo) Segundina pasa sus días. Ella tiene un año realizando esta actividad, ya que anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de cereales como el trigo y la avena. Ahora, disfruta mucho de cocinar y lo hace con mucha habilidad, su comida es consumida por muchos clientes, los cuales acaban con los deliciosos platillos en unos segundos. Pero lo que menos le gusta de su negocio es atender hasta altas horas de la madrugada, ya que siente que es muy peligroso. Para el futuro de su negocio espera tener una restaurante, donde pueda vender todo el día y con mayor tranquilidad la comida que prepara, porque actualmente sólo lo hace por la noches. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP y está ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy contenta. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ingredientes para incrementar la cantidad de porciones de “salchimote” que vende diariamente.
texts.en:
Segundina is 31 years old, and she is a very hardworking person. She lives in a rented room with her husband Mateo, who is 36. Both of them want to succeed. Cooking her delicious "salchimote" (a dish made with a base of fried corn and pieces of chicken), Segundina passes her days. She has been doing this business for a year. Before that, she sold cereal grains like wheat and oats. Now, she greatly enjoys cooking, and she does it very well. Many customers eat her food, and they finish the delicious meals in a matter of seconds. The thing Segundina likes least, though, is working until the wee hours of the morning, which she feels is dangerous. In the future, she hopes to have a restaurant where she can peacefully sell the food she prepares every day, because right now she only works at night. This is her fifth loan from Kiva partner MFP, and she is saving up in order to make her payments on time because she does not want to cause any problems for the members of her communal bank, where she is very happy. With the 1,000 soles that she has requested, she will buy more ingredients in order to increase the numbers of "salchimotes" that she sells daily.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for preparing "salchimotes"

loans.name: Los Lirios Ii Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Susana del Socorro P., Amaparo de los Angeles R. Sequeiro y Gertrudis S..

 Este grupo solidario es originario  del municipio de Tisma, las tres se dedican a actividades diversas y dentro de su comunidad, tienen muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad, llevan varios ciclos de trabajar con Adim y han demostrado ser personas responsables y puntuales, están comprometidas para quedar bien en la institución.
 
Doña Susana del Socorro P. es la coordinadora del grupo por ser muy responsable. es una joven mujer , vende frutas, las compra al por mayor y ella vende al detalle durante el día, tiene un hijo pequeño que va a la escuela, su esposo es comerciante en el mismo mercado donde acarrea productos  y es agricultor, le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.
Se dedica desde muy joven a su actividad comercial y ella piensa hacer crecer su negocio y así un día mejorar su casa.


 Doña Amparo de los Angeles R. , ella tiene su negocio de venta de frutas y verduras, Ella es madre de tres hijos pequeños, su esposo es albañil y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Sueña con mejorar su vivienda para tener más seguridad y proteger más a su familia. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad, pues la aprendió de su madre y trabajando espera poder dar a sus hijos un mejor nivel de vida.


Doña Mercedes Gertrudis S., es otra de las integrantes, ella también vende verduras ambulante, vende frutas peladas y entrega a clientes fijos, ella es conocida por vendedora en la comunidad, compra en Masaya al por mayor y  al detalle. Tiene  
 tres hijos, dos pequeños que estudian en la escuela más cercana a su casa, ella se encarga de cuidarlos y desea que terminen estudios para que conozcan cosas que ella no conoce
texts.en:
In the photo from left to right are: Susana, Amparo, and Gertrudis. This jointly responsible group is from the municipality of Tisma. The three women have many years of experience engaging in different activities in their community They have worked with ADIM several times and have shown themselves to be responsable and punctual. They are commited to being on good terms with the lender. Susana is the coordinator of the group because she is very responsible. She is a young woman who sells fruit, buying at wholesale and selling at retail during the day. She has a young son who goes to school. Her husband is a merchant in the same market to which her products are transported and is a farmer. She helps him with the household expenses. From a young age, Susana has been involved in commercial activity, and she wants to make her business grow and improve her home some day. Amparo has a business selling fruits and vegetables. She is the mother of three small children. Her husband is a bricklayer, and she helps him with the household expenses. Her dream is to imrpove her way of life in order to have more security and protect her family. She has many years of experience in her business since she learned it from her mother. By working she hopes to give her children a better standard of living. Mercedes is the other member of the group. She also sells vegetables and peeled fruit and delivers solid service to her customers. She is known in the community for her work as a saleswoman, buying in Masaya at wholesale and retail. She has three children, the two youngest study in the school closest to her house. She takes charge of caring for them and wishes that they finish their studies so that they are aware of things that she doesn't know.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of perishables

loans.name: El Malinche Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha:  Sandra María Dávila R., María Inés López Pavón y Alba Luz Sánchez.

El grupo solidario El Malinche está conformado por  mujeres trabajadoras, originarias de la comarca Las Flores, ubicada en el departamento de Masaya, sus condiciones de vida son humildes, trabajan con Adim porque les gusta que confían en ellas, expresaron..

Doña Sandra María Dávila, soltera, madre de cuatro hijos de las edades 9, 5, 3 y 2 años. se dedica a la compra y venta de cosechas de frutas, las cuales las va ha vender en el mercado de Masaya. Ella sueña con comprar un terreno para construir su casita, puesto que actualmente vive con su suegra, hacer que crezca su negocio, y darle una buena educación a sus hijos.
Con los créditos obtenidos ella expresa que ha podido capitalizarse y ha incrementado sus ventas.

Doña María Inés López , se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ropa variada para todas las edades, como por ejemplo faldas, blusas, uniformes de estudiantes, etc. Es conocida por su actividad, ella vende en el mercado de Masaya y Granada donde tiene clientes fijos. Sueña con terminar la casa que están construyendo en terreno propio y muy pronto trasladarse a vivir ahí.
Tiene cuatro dependientes , se propone hacer crecer el negocio para salir adelante.

Doña Alba Luz Sánchez es la coordinadora del grupo, ella es persona reponsable y muy conocida en su comunidad por tener su negocio ubicado en el colegio de la comunidad por muchos años. Es casada, madre de tres hijos, su esposo trabaja en una radio local y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.
Este grupo está comprometido a pagar puntual y así seguir obteniendo créditos con Adim, están seguras que con el crédito saldrán adelante porque incrementan sus ventas y así sus ingresos.

Este grupo abona los días Lunes porque, se considera que es el mejor día para abonar, esto porque las ventas del fin de semana son las mejores.
texts.en:
Pictured left to right: Sandra María Dávila R., María Inés López Pavón, and Alba Luz Sánchez. El Malinche Group is comprised of hardworking women from Las Flores in Masaya. Their living conditions are humble, and they work with Kiva partner ADIM because they like that the organization trust them, they said. Sandra María Dávila is the single mother of four children who are nine, five, three, and two years old. She buys and sells fruit in the Masaya market. She dreams of buying some land for building her own house. Currently, she lives with her mother-in-law so that she can grow her business and give her children a good education. With the loans that she has gotten in the past, she says that she has been able to invest in her business and increase sales. María Inés López makes and sells various types of clothes for all ages, for example, skirts, blouses, student uniforms, etc. She is known for her business, and she sells in the Masaya and Granada markets where she has regular customers. She dreams of finishing the home that she is building on her own land and moving in soon after. She has for dependents, and she wants to grow her business to succeed. Alba Luz Sánchez is the group leader. She is very responsible and very well known in her community because her business has been located near the community school for many years. She is married and the mother of three. Her husband works for the local radio and helps her with household expenses. This group has promised to make their payments on time so that they can continue receiving loans from Kiva partner ADIM. They are sure that with this loan they will succeed because they will increase their sales, thereby increasing their income. This group will make payments on Mondays because they think Monday is the best day for making payments since weekend sales are best.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Manito Poderosa Group

texts.es: Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Ana del Carmen B. P., Valentin Valerio Martínez González  y Leyla Francisca
texts.en: Photo from left to right: Ana del Carmen B. P., Valentin Valerio Martínez González, and Leyla Francisca

loans.use: Buying produce

loans.name: Maria De Fatima Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: María Lorena Q. Martínez ,  Yelba María López N.  y  Gabriela Auxiliadora Martínez B..

 El grupo solidario María de Fátima, es formado  según la cercanía de sus negocios y por su confianza entre ellas, tienen pequeños negocios en la comunidad de Villa Betania, perteneciente a la ciudad de Masaya.Las tres miembros tienen mucha confianza entre ellas.

Doña María Lorena Q. Martínez , es madre de dos niños pequeños de 5 y 2 años, vende repostería de maíz durante el día, ella la compra en un taller de repostería donde le dan buen precio, además vende refrescos, su esposo trabaja como guarda en Managua y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Tiene 2 años de dedicarse a esta actividad y consigue ayudar en el presupuesto familiar.

Doña Yelba María López N. es la coordinadora del grupo, ella fue elegida por ser líder del grupo, muy responsable en sus pagos. Ella vende ropa ambulante en Tipitapa donde ya tiene muchos clientes, es mujer sola con una hija adulta que le ayuda en el negocio. Ella sueña con mejorar su casa y tener mas grande su negocio.


Doña Graciela Auxiliadora al igual que su otra compañera de grupo vende repostería de maíz, que se conoce como “cosa de horno”, además ofrece refrescos, café, leche, etc., tiene dos años de dedicarse a esta actividad. Es madre de un niño pequeño de 2 años Su esposo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.
Ella sueña con mejorar la casa porque en los inviernos se le inunda un poco, con los créditos ella ha comprado por mayor la repostería consiguiendo mejores precios.
texts.en:
Photo, from left to right: María Lorena Q. Martínez, Yelba María López N. y Gabriela Auxiliadora Martínez B.. The solidarity group María de Fátima is formed from the closeness of their businesses and for their confidence in each other. They have small businesses in the community of Villa Betania, in the city of Masaya. The three members have a lot of confidence in each other.

Doña María Lorena Q. Martínez is the mother of 2 small children, who are 5 and 2 years old. She sells corn pastries during the day. She buys it in a pastrymaking shop, where they give her good prices. She also sells soft drinks. Her husband works as a guard in Managua, and he helps her with the expenses of the home. For two years she has been in this activity, and manages to help with the family budget.

Doña Yelba María López N. is the coordinator of the group. She was elected to be the leader of the group. She is very responsible in the payments. She sells clothes on the street in Tipitapa, where she already has many customers. She is a single woman with an adult daughter who helps her with the business. She dreams to improve her house and have a bigger business. Doña Graciela Auxiliadora, like her other colleague in the group, sells corn pastries, that are known as “cosa de horno”. Also, she offers soft drinks, coffee, milk, etc. She has been doing this activity for 2 years. She is the mother of a small boy who is 2 years old. Her husband helps her with the expenses of the home. She dreams to improve her home, because in the winter it floods a little. With the loans, she has bought the pastries wholesale to maintain the best prices.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Melocoton Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Odaly Isabel Sánchez, Darling Lizeth O. H. y Damaris de los Angeles A. Mejía.

Este grupo es originario de la a ciudad de Masaya, de forma general se dedican a las actividades de ventas.
Son bien conocidas entre ellas y de confianza, son mujeres jóvenes que tienen mucho empeño y trabajar y salir adelante, les gusta trabajar con Adim porque reciben capacitaciones de cómo mejorar su negocio.
Doña Odaly Isabel Sánchez ,vende ropa y cosméticos a personas de la comunidad, es madre de dos niños de 5 y 10 años, desea poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, este estudia en la escuela cercana a la vivienda, es casada, su esposo es panadero y le apoya con los gastos del hogar. El crédito lo ocupa para comprar ropa que le encargan sus clientes, además ella hace buñuelos para vender por las tardes.

Doña Darling Lizeth O. es la coordinadora del grupo, ella anima al grupo a quedar bien y seguir obteniendo los beneficios del crédito con Adim. Es una mujer joven sin hijos, su negocio para tener más ingresos para ayudar con los gastos, su esposo trabaja como chofer de taxi. Ella vende atoles, tamales, tortillas, los vende en punto fijo donde pasa mucha gente que ya la conoce.


Doña Damaris de los Angeles A. ,  es una  mujer, madre de varios hijos que ahora ya no viven con ella, ella se dedica a la elaboración de pantalones, camisas y faldas, tiene su pequeño taller en su casa, cuenta con dos trabajadoras, ella sale a vender a los departamentos como Matagalpa, Estela y Rivas. El credito lo necesita para la compra de materiales en el mercado como telas. hilos, adornos, etc., tiene muchos clientes que le piden encargos, sueña con tener su propia vivienda, ella es muy responsable.

 Expresa que en cada crédito ella se propone metas para salir adelante.
texts.en:
In the photo from left to right: Odaly, Darling, and Damaris.

This group is from the city of Masaya and they all sell products.

They know each other well and trust each other,and each is a young woman with determination and a good work ethic. They like to work with ADIM because they receive training on how to improve their businesses.

Odaly sells clothing and cosmetics to people in the community. She is the mother of two children, one five and the other ten, and hopes that they can continue moving forward with their studies at the school near her house. She is married and her husband, who is a baker, helps her with household expenses. The loan she requests will go towards the purchase of clothing that her customers have ordered. She also makes doughnuts to sell in the afternoons.

Darling is the captain of the group and encourages the group to keep making a good impression so that they can keep receiving loans with ADIM. She is a young woman without children and has a business in order to bring in income and help with expenses. Her husband works as a taxi driver. She sells maize drinks, tamales, and tortillas in a regular spot where many people that know her pass.

Damaris is a mother of several children that no longer live with her. She makes pants, shirts, and skirts and has a small workshop in her house for her and two workers. She leaves to sell her products in Matagalpa, Estela and Rivas. The loan that she requests is to purchase materials in the market like fabrics, thread, decorations, etc. She has many customers that have special orders. Her dream is to have her own house and she is very responsible.

She says that with each loan she proposes goals to keep moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase materials for food and clothing sales

loans.name: Villa Paraiso Group

texts.es: Es un grupo  muy antiguo, formado por señoras que viven en un mismo Barrio "La Chimba", donD. se conocen bien, el Banco D. Emprendimiento esta en su 8º Ciclo y se llama  "VILLA PARAISO" esta organizado D. la siguiente manera: como presidenta la señora Celia M. A., quien dirige al grupo, tiene dos hijos y trabaja juntamente con su esposo, tienen una flota que realiza viajes interdepartamentales, ella se ocupa D. vender los pasajes y la administracion. El socio  Deiby A. A.  es un socio tambien antiguo y que maneja muy bien el efectivo D. dinero, esta como tesorero dentro del  grupo, el es taxista, tiene un hijo y colabora a su mama en lo que pueD.. Y como Secretaria del grupo esta la socia Scarley A., socia nomuy antigua, ella se dedica a la venta D. cosmeticos D. Yambal y  Essika, es una socia cumplida.
texts.en:
This is a very old group, which was formed by women who live in the same neighborhood, La Chimba. They know each other very well. This enterprising bank is in its eighth loan cyle. The group is called Villa Paraiso. It is organized in the following manner. Celia M. A. is the president. She directs the group. She has two children, and she works together with her husband. They have a bus, which makes interdepartmental trips. She sells the tickets and administers the business. Deiby A. A. is also an old member. He manages cash very well. He is the treasurer of the group. He drives a taxi, has one child, and works with his mother in whatever he can. Scarley A. is the secretary of the group. She is not a very old member. She sells Yanbal and Essika cosmetics. She is an accomplished member.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Las Manzanas Group

texts.es:
Foto De izquierda a derecha: Rosario de la Asunción R. Velásquez , Anielka Patricia Pérez Sánchez y Catalina Pérez.

Doña Rosario de la Asunción R. se dedica a la venta de verduras, ella compra las frutas en la zona donde vive y algunas en el mercado, trbaja todos los días desde tempranas horas hasta la tarde que regresa a su hogar, es una mujer trabajadora. Sueña  con mejorar su vivienda para ella y su familia. Ella es la coordinadora del grupo por ser persona responsable .Tiene un hijo y es madre soltera.


Doña Anielka Patricia Pérez ,vende café, pan, leche, etc., los ofrece en el mercado de Tipitapa, se mueve a vender sus productos ambulante. Es madre de un niño, que mantiene  ella sola Trabaja desde tempranas horas hasta las 3 pm , expresa que sueña con mejorar su casa y mantener a su hijo.
Trabaja con Adim porque una de las clientas le animó que se integrará en un grupo solidario, así ella conformó su grupo con dos amigas cercanas y obtuvo el préstamo. 

Doña Catalina Pérez  ,se dedica al destace de cerdo y elaboración de nacatamales, esta actividad la hace en su casa para dar atención a los niños y hacer los oficios del hogar. Sueña dar estudio a sus hijos y mejorar su vivienda, expresa que esta contenta de trabajar con Adim porque ella nunca había tenido oportunidad de un crédito por no tener garantías y ahora ella va a quedar bien a la institución que confía en ella.
texts.en:
Photo (from left to right): Rosario de la Asunción R. Velásquez, Anielka Patricia Pérez Sánchez, and Catalina Pérez. Doña Rosario de la Asunción R. sells vegetables. She buys some of the produce locally and some from the market. A hardworking woman, Rosario starts every day early in the morning and then returns to her house late in the afternoon. Her dream is to improve her house for herself and her family. She is the coordinator of her group as she is a responsible person. She has a son and is a single mother. Doña Anielka Patricia Pérez sells coffee, bread, milk etc in the Tipitapa market. She walks around doing this as she sells her products on the street. Anielka has a son; she is his sole support. She works from early in the morning to around 3pm. Her dream is to improve her house and bring up her son well. She became involved with Kiva partner ADIM because one of her customers encouraged her to join a support group. So she formed a group with two close friends and obtained a loan. Doña Catalina Pérez is a pork butcher, and she also makes nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales). She does this from home so that she can keep an eye on her children and do the household chores at the same time. Her dream is to provide an education for her children and to improve her house. Catalina reports that she is happy to work with Kiva partner ADIM because she had never had the opportunity to get a loan before, as she had no collateral. Now she is planning to stay with the institution that had confidence in her.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy perishables

loans.name: Shirley Group

texts.es:
Foto De izquierda a derecha: Marlen Damaris C. Durán, Flor de Lis Gutiérrez R. y María Ignacia C..

Doña Marlen Damaris es una mujer soltera , madre de dos hijos a los que mantiene sola, se dedica vende frutas, las compra al por mayor y ella vende al detalle durante el día, tiene dos hijos pequeños que va a la escuela.
Se dedica desde muy joven a su actividad comercial y ella piensa hacer crecer su negocio y así un día mejorar su casa.

Doña Flor de Lis Gutiérrez  es la coordinadora del grupo, es persona muy responsable se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos, ella es madre de cinco hijos, su esposo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, trabaja en Managua en reparación de electrodomésticos .
Ella es conocida por la actividad que realiza, desea poder dar un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos.

Doña María Ignacia C. se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y frutas en un puesto ubicado en una empresa donde hay muchos empleados, como lo es las zonas francas. Ella compra las frutas en el mercado a buen precio y las vende peladas en platos, ya preparadas. Ella es soltera, sin hijos, vive con su mamá a quien le ayuda con los gastos de la casa.



.
texts.en:
Photo (from left to right): Marlen Damaris C. Durán, Flor de Lis Gutiérrez R., and María Ignacia C.. Doña Marlen Damaris is a single mother of two children; she is their sole support. She sells fruit, buying it at wholesale prices and then selling it throughout the day for a profit. She has two small children who attend school. Ever since she was a young woman she has had her business and is planning to expand it so that one day she can improve her house. A responsible person, Doña Flor de Lis Gutiérrez is the coordinator of the group. She earns her living by selling clothing and cosmetics. She has five children and shares the household expenses with her husband who works in Managua repairing household appliances. Flor is well-known in her field. She wants to be able to provide a better standard of living for her children. Doña María Ignacia C. sells soft drinks and fruit from a stall located in a business where there are many employees such as the duty-free zones. She buys fruit from the market at low prices and sells it peeled and on plates so that it is ready to eat. María is single and has no children. She lives with her mother with whom she shares the costs of running the household. .

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing and perishables

loans.name: Beatriz Orieta

texts.es: La Cliente se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos y perfumes desde hace dos años, trabaja con las lineas Yambal, Ebbel y Essika, tambien trabaja como instructora de aerobicos en un Gimnasio, es soltera, muy responsable en sus pagos, es su tercer credito en Emprender; vive en casa de su madre, ayuda a su madre con los gastos de la casa. Por ultimo, esta estudiando en la Universidad Estatal la carrera de Psicologia.
texts.en:
Beatriz has been selling cosmetics and perfumes (Yambal, Ebbe, and Essika brands) for two years. She is also an aerobics instructor in a gymnasium. She is single and very responsible with her repayments. This is her third loan with Kiva partner, Emprender. She lives with her mother and helps her with the costs of running the household. Beatriz is studying psychology at the State University.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy more products

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana N. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 55 years old, married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Feliciana owns and operates a general store, where she sells a variety of products to the local community. Feliciana has owned the store for over three years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2006, Feliciana joined PMPC to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Feliciana successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC which she used to expand her business. Feliciana is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more products to sell. This will be her sixth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her family's general living conditions. About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita L. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 33 years old. Lolita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Lolita owns and operates a motor cab for hire to local community members. Lolita has run her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Lolita joined PMPC to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC which she used to purchase materials for her business. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase construction materials for house repair. This loan will be her 3rd loan from PMPC. She hopes that she can provide comfortable shelter for her children. About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for house repair.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa R.'s dream is to be successful in her "sari-sari" store business. She started it nine years ago. Her ambition was to have a stable income for the family so that she would be able to carry out her responsibilty as a mother to her six children.

When she learned about Community Economic Ventures, She never hesitated to access its credit services. Now, she would like to ask again a loan worth Php 18,000 to make her business flourish by buying additional groceries.

Never losing hope, Ninfa is doing her best in her business because the income from her store has been helpful for her children's educational needs. Now, she still connected with CEVI's credit program and receives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase assorted groceries

loans.name: Antonietta

texts.en:
Antonietta L. is enaged in a "sari-sari" store business for 10 years already. She started small using her very own savings of Php 5,000. Now, she has a daily profit of Php 500- Php 800 that helps her pay for her whole family's needs.

Until now, she has been doing great in her business. She needs additional capital of Php 18,000 to purchase assorted groceries. In this way she believes she will be able to augment their income.

She chose CEVI for its sincere services to people. CEVI provides her loans, training, and insurance coverage services.

loans.use: To purchase assorted groceries

loans.name: Fritzie

texts.en:
Fritzie E. raises and sells pigs. She is married and has two children. Before, she handled a tutorial class. She stopped teaching and decided to venture into this kind of business so many years ago now. She shared her dreams: she said that she wants to have her own butcher shop in the town. Now, she uses her house as her own stall where she sells meat to her neighbors.

She would like to apply for a loan of Php 18,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) and will use the loan to buy pig feed. Part of the loan will also be used to buy meat for sale.

Up to now, she has been connected to CEVI’s credit program. She receives loans, training and insurance coverage from CEVI.

loans.use: To buy feed for her pigs and more meat to sell

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie R. manages a small sari-sari store business. She is 56 years old and has six children. She started her business in 2004. The income that she earns from selling different kinds of goods is a big help, especially in paying for books and school fees. 

Now, she wants her business to grow even more. By buying additional merchandise for her store, she thinks that she will be able to attract more customers and to increase her income as well.

Community Economic Ventures is helping her to get a loan to support her business. They also provide her with training and an insurance coverage package.

loans.use: To purchase assorted groceries for retail.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida M. knows how to run her business despite low sales and the presence of competitors. She has been selling different kinds of goods since 2004. Until now, she never stopped doing business because she knew she could provide a future for her children. She also owns a business raising ducks. She has 800 ducks which she also sells to her neighbors. She has two children and her business helps a lot in providing for their needs.

She would like to ask for a loan of PHP 14,000. She will use the loan to buy assorted groceries. The loan will also help expand her duck business.

CEVI helps small business grow. CEVI provides Aida with the loan that she needs as well as training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase assorted groceries.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina P. owns a small sari-sari store. She is 58 years old and has five children. She always wanted to make her business grow because her family depends on what she earns from her business. She started a small store in 2003 with PHP 5,000 capital. She started her business by buying goods and selling them in their village.

Now, she needs additional capital to sustain her store. She is asking for a loan of PHP 16,000 from Community Economic Ventures. The loan will surely help her increase her family's income.

 Her dream is to be able to expand in her business so that she will be able to support the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase assorted groceries.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Eight years ago, Lolita L. started a business. She has a small store situated near their house. She thinks that venturing into the sari-sari store business will provide a good life for her and her family because they will have a resource to meet all of the family’s needs.

Now, she needs additional capital. She wants a loan of PHP 16,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. This loan will help her to achieve a better income for her family. She will buy additional groceries to display and sell in her store.

CEVI helps Lolita sustain her business. Now, she is still part of CEVI’s credit program. She receives loans, training and an insurance coverage package.

loans.use: To purchase assorted groceries.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria M. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 60 years old. Maria is widowed and has 3 adult children. Maria owns & operates a business selling baked goods in the local community. Maria has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Maria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Maria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make the products that she sells. Maria is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP to be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products that she prepares. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Maria from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Lhane

texts.en:
Lhane D. R. owns and manages a welding shop. She earns a good income from this business. Her husband, Melchor D. R., is the welder. Her role is to make sure that they have served their customers well so that they will keep coming back every time they have something to weld.

Now, she is requesting additional capital of PHP 16,000. She wants a loan from Community Economic Ventures because of its very interesting credit services. 

CEVI is reaching more people to sustain their livelihood. Lhane receives the loan, training and insurance coverage with CEVI.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the welding shop.

loans.name: Sarrah Mae

texts.en:
Sarrah Mae R. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 23 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Sarrah Mae owns and operates a specialized retail store where she sells native wine made of coconut juice commonly known as "tuba" in the local community. Everyday Sarrah Mae and her husband patiently go around the community to sell "tuba" which she has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2006, Sarrah Mae joined PMPC to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sarrah Mae successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Sarrah Mae is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which she will use to pay for a short-term lease on coconut land in order to have additional trees to cultivate. From there, she hopes to produce more "tuba" to sell. This loan will be her 6th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her family's general living conditions.

Sarrah Mae is shown in the picture with her plastic jugs of "tuba" she personally delivers -- by riding on the back of a motorcycle -- to her customers.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for a term lease for a coconut land to expand her business

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Umbrellas and shoes, these are what keeps Adelina C., a 50-year-old mother, busy everyday. She has ten children and some of them are married. They repair shoes and broken umbrellas. They earn a living out of this service and they want it to grow to augment their family income. 

Now, Adelina needs materials to continue their business. She is asking for a loan of Php 16,000 from Community Economic Ventures (CEVI). She thinks also of venturing into other businesses to help her family more.

She is satisfied with CEVI’s credit services. Now, she is happy obtaining loans, training and insurance coverage from CEVI.

loans.use: To purchase materials for repairing shoes and umbrellas

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita P. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 46 years old, married, and has five adult children. Carmelita owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling wild-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seventeen years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Carmelita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Her sari-sari (variety) store, this is what keeps Angela B. busy all the time to just have a little earnings for her family. She is 40 years old and has five children. She thought of venturing into this kind of business to be able to provide food as well to pay the school fees and other book needs of her children.

Now, she needs additional capital of Php 14,000. She is asking for a loan from Community Economic Ventures (CEVI) to purchase assorted groceries. This, in turn, will help achieve better sales in her store.

She chose CEVI because of its credit services. CEVI also provides its clients with training and insurance coverage services to help their small businesses grow.

loans.use: To purchase assorted groceries for her store

loans.name: Milagrosa

texts.en:
Milagrosa E. is rice farmer. She is 40 years old and has three children. She started in 1990 with only a one-hectare (2.5-acre) farm. With her diligence, she and her husband are able to reap 70 sacks every harvest.

In addition to rice, the couple also owns a small piggery business. Currently, they have eight piglets which they sell for 1,600 pesos per head. 

Now, Milagrosa needs more capital to run her business. She is asking a loan of Php 12,000 to purchase fertilizers and chemicals for her farm. Some of the loan will also be used in buying pig feed.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals and pig feed

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth L. is from the city of Dapitqan. She is 41 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Elizabeth owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Elizabeth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Irma

texts.en: Irma T. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 32 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Irma owns and operates a fish business, selling wild-caught fish in the local community. Irma has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Irma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell. Irma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Jennebby

texts.en:
In 1973, Jennebby P. started acquiring land that is 1 hectare in size. She is married to Generoso P. and has 10 children. From her farm, she is able to earn an income to support the education of her children. 

She would like to ask for a loan worth Php 12,000. She will use the loan to purchase farming products, such as fertilizers, and other farm necessities.

She is happy that she took part in the CEVI micro-credit program. Now, she doesn't have to worry about the capital. CEVI provides her not just credit, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase farming products such as fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Jopeth Jay

texts.en:
Jopeth Jay L. raises pigs. He started his business with only one piglet, followed by two, and now he has many pigs in his backyard. He is 20 years old and still single. While thinking of having his own family someday, he prefers to save first before he gets married.

He is asking for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy pig feed. The loan will really help in growing his business and income as well. 

CEVI supports Jopeth in his business. Now, he enjoys having CEVI credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija M. is a member of the Majengo 12 borrower group in Kiboriloni, Kilimanjaro. She is a 30-year-old single mother of two children. Her children are ages 10 and 7 years. 

Hadija started her own business selling bedsheets and mapazia (curtains) four years ago. She works all day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 50,000 Tanzania Schillings.

This is Hadija’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 Tsh in order to add more bedsheets and curtains to her inventory. With the additional profit she will gain from the use of this loan, Hadija hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: To buy bedsheets and mapazia (curtains)

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel K. is 33 years old and married to Milka Muthoni. Together they have two school-aged children. Daniel has been in the motorcycle taxi business now for two years. He was introduced to KADET by a friend of his and has so far taken three loans from the institution. He bought his first motorcycle with the first loan, used the second loan to repair and service the motorcycle, and now he wants to use the third loan to buy another motorcycle. The new motorcycle will allow him to grow his business and create employment for someone else; that person will rent the new motorcycle from him and operate it. Daniel's ambition is to move from just owning motorcycle taxis to owning an automobile taxi service in future. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle for his business

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe B. is already 34 years old and is married to Francis B. Sr. The couple manages a rice farming business which is the major source of income for their family. Fe also manages a general store so that her family has an extra source of income to support their daily needs.

She wants to expand her store and to increase her daily income so she is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 5000 for additional working capital.

Major proceeds of her daily income go toward the education of her children who are Xyril Aian Jay (10 years), Francis B. Jr. (7 years), Justine (6 years), and the youngest, Jasper (4 years).

She hopes that she can continue to support the schooling of her children until they finish their studies in college. Fe is thankful that in spite of the hardships of life, her family still lives happily in the simple village of Wigan Cordon, Isabela.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Vending of native delicacies or glutinous rice cake is the business of Mary Rose C.. She is 28 years old and already married. They live peacefully in the village of Wigan Cordon, Isabela.

She has been involved in her business for 5 years now, and that business is their only source of income to support their family needs. Her desire to develop her business into a more progressive one gave her the idea of asking for financial support amounting to PHP 5000 for additional working capital.

Mary Rose is happy that she learned about Kiva. She believes that with the help of Kiva lenders and with her patience in vending, she will be able to achieve her dreams in life.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Narda

texts.en:
Narda B. is a simple woman living in the rural village of Wigan Cordon, Isabela. Narda is already 39 years old and still single. She is a woman of strong determination, hard working and patient. She always strives for the best.

She has sacrificed her personal happiness to make her general store successful and to help her parents' daily living. Her store business has been a big help in providing their family's daily needs. She hopes to uplift their standard of living.

Narda wants to improve her business but she lacks capital. So she is asking for a loan from Kiva to purchase added merchandise, especially those basic commodities that her neighbors usually buy in her store. She hopes for a loan of PHP 5000 for additional business capital.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Vegetable and fruit vending is Virginia B.'s source of income. But most of the time she sells beans and bananas in their village. She retails her products by walking around from house to house in their village and also in the nearby villages.

She hopes to establish a typical village store somehow but she lacks capital, so she would like to borrow PHP 5000 from Kiva for additional business capital.

She does her best in vending in order to support the education of three of her children who are studying presently. Virginia is now 39 years old and she is standing both as father and a mother to her five children.

"It is hard," says Virginia, but she does her best providing her family with a better living situation. They live simply and peacefully in the rural village of Wigan Cordon, Isabela.

She hopes that with the support of Kiva, she will somehow uplift their poor living condition. "Just be patient and always trust God," adds Virginia.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 53 years old and a resident of Barangay Wigan Cordon, Isabela. Her husband Leon P. works as a farmer in their village. He used to plant upland rice in their village since their place is also considered mountainous one. The couple is grateful for having a family that works together for the progress of their lives.

Virginia has a small piggery in their backyard that adds to the family's income. She is asking for a loan of PHP 5000 to maintain her hog raising business. Considering the profit it may bring to her family is why Virginia wants her business to become more progressive.

Virginia plans to send her younger children to school. She really hopes that she can obtain the loan because it will be of big help to her family.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a 35-year-old woman of strength and determination. She is a resident of the village near the Ilagan municipal hall, situated in Barangay S. Barbara Centro Ilagan, Isabela. She is married to Eduardo M. who is employed as a janitor. They are blessed with two kids who are both studying. France is their eldest child and Keane is their youngest. Rosemarie knows how difficult life is. She is glad that her husband is a very patient worker, even if he is just a janitor. Rosemarie maintains a simple general store business in their village. 

Rosemarie has been engaged in the retail business since she got married. She believes that it is a blessing given to her by God. Her business has become the main source of income of their family. As a business woman, she always wants to improve her business, to increase her income and be able to save for the education of their children. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 9,000 from the Kiva lenders for business capital.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Anna Marie

texts.en:
Anna Marie is 48 years old and happily married to Roelito. They were blessed with two children. She is a college graduate but due to lack of job opportunities, she ended up with her own business as a vendor of street foods in their village as her way of helping her husband earn a living.  

Her husband plants vegetables, rice and fruit trees, which is how they get some of their major family needs met. They help each other for the welfare of their family. Anna Marie also hopes to establish a typical village store somehow in order to increase her daily income. Thus, she is requesting a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP 5,000 as additional business capital.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Annie Grace

texts.en:
Annie Grace lives in Barangay Malasin, Dupax del Norte in the province of Nueva Vizcaya. She is a two-year midwife graduate. She is married to Levy and blessed with a child named Keneth Warrant, who is 9 years old and in elementary school.  

At present, they are striving hard to earn income for their daily living. Her husband works as a bus driver in Sampalok Manila while Annie operates a tricycle. Her relative drives their tricycle and at the end of the day remits income to her. She is requesting a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP 15,000 for the maintenance of the motorcycle for the safety of their passengers. She hopes that whatever circumstances will happen, her family will be able to cope with them.

loans.use: Business capital

location.town: Malasin Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya`

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor and her husband are persevering to meet the needs of their family. The couple, together with their children, live peacefully in the village of Barangay Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. They have two children, Jeremy and Mariska, who are now in elementary school. She hopes to give their children the best education to give them a better life someday. 

Despite the hardship of life, they still have the strong determination to support the education of their children and to save for their future. Her husband manages their watch-repair shop in the Public Market while Flor sells different products like vegetables and some cooked snacks. Due to lack of business capital, she came to propose a loan of PHP 10,000 for the maintenance of their watch business in their place. Flor is hoping that somehow, they will be able to overcome the hardships of life that her family is experiencing.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a resident of Barangay Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Larry and gifted with two children. Their eldest is a nurse and presently working as a volunteer in Nueva Vizcaya Provincial Hospital while their youngest is still studying in college.
 
Jocelyn’s husband works as a laborer while Jocelyn engages in the buying and selling business of cull chickens (male chickens for which breeders have no use) in their village where she earns a weekly income of PHP 1,000. She wanted her business to grow and have an increase in income. Thus, she is requesting a loan from Kiva of PHP 15,000. She believes that this will really help her business and her family to have a progressive living standard.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a strong woman living in Barangay Bonfal West, Bayombong, Neuva Vizcaya. She is now a widow and is the mother of five children, all of whom are married.

Luisa needs to work hard for her daily needs and to support her children. She sells bottled drinks as her source of income. She wants to develop a general store business and to engage in vegetable vending. For this, she is requesting to borrow PHP 5,000 from Kiva as additional working capital.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta G. is engaged in a food-vending business. She is a resident of Barangay Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Jose Allan and they have two children: Lloyd Stephen and Yvette Stephanie and they are both in the tertiary level of education. Marietta is hoping that she will be able to continue to send them to school to finish their studies.

Marietta is now asking for financial assistance from Kiva lenders in the amount of PHP 15,000 that she will use for the improvement of her business. Aside from selling different food, she is also engaged in selling second hand clothes in their village. She believes that through her business and the salary of her husband, they can provide for the needs of their family.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a vegetable vendor. She lives in Bonfal West, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Villamore and they work hand in hand to uplift their poor living conditions. They have four children: two are in college and two are in high school. Mercy is doing her best to maintain her business and their farm.

Mercy is requesting to borrow PHP 5,000 from Kiva for her vegetable-vending business. She will use the loan to improve her vending business. She wants the best for her family and that is why she works very hard and patiently to give the best for her family.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Pheta

texts.en:
Pheta is now 45 years old and living in Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. Her husband is Herald and they are gifted with two children: Rodelyn and Narlyn. The eldest is now in third year college while the youngest is now in fourth year high school. Pheta and her husband are doing their best to overcome the difficulties of life and send their children to school.

Pheta and her husband manage a welding and repair shop. Aside from this, they are also engaged in farming. She is now requesting PHP 10,000 from Kiva for the maintenance of their business. She also dreams of developing their welding and repair shop into a success so that they will further sustain their family’s daily living.

loans.use: To use as business capital

location.town: Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya`

loans.name: Stinely

texts.en:
Stinely is happily married to Jimbo. They live in a rural place in Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. They have great ambitions for their three children and that is why they strive hard to earn and support their children’s studies.

Stinely manages a general store business while her husband cultivates their farm lot twice a year. She is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan from Kiva to use as additional business capital to buy more stock that will definitely increase her daily income. She also plans to purchase ten sacks of rice to retail in her store. She hopes that through their livelihood, they will be able to finance the education of their children.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
“The only key to achieve success is through hard work,” says Susan F. of Bonfal West, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Edgar and blessed with four children who are studying in college, high school and elementary. Susan and her husband are doing all their best to earn money to support the education of their children for they want them to have a bright future.

Susan’s husband works as a farmer and plants rice and vegetables. She then sells their own vegetables in the market. Sometimes, he uses their tricycle as an alternative source of income for their daily needs and especially for the daily allowances of their children in school.

Susan is requesting PHP 5,000 from Kiva to have additional vending capital for her business. She knows that having enough capital will surely provide her with higher income and better business opportunities.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: San José Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San José inicia su Tercer ciclo con 21 socias. Las socias son D. L. comunidad D. YanamilL. que se ubica a L. periferia D. L. ciudad D. ayacucho.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. leña, cereales, abarrotes en general, comida, bebidas, artesanía, tubérculos y brindan servicios D. transporte.

Como es el caso D. Juliana que es conviviente, tiene 42 años y 4 hijos, Juliana venD. verduras en L. selva ayacuchana, a donD. viaja semanalmente, y D. L. selva compra frutas que venD. en el mercado D. abastos D. L. ciudad. 

Mientras que Vilma es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Vilma tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes, verduras, carne, pollo, actividad que realiza con L. ayuda D. su esposo.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, 1000 soles, haciendo un total D. 12,600 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. queso, verduras, arroz, azúcar, papa, gaseosas.

Los sueños D. las socias son techar su casa, tener casa propia, sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar sus negocios y ser mayoristas.
texts.en:
The San José Community Bank is beginning in its third loan cycle with 21 members. The members are from the YanamilL. community, located in the outskirts of Ayacucho.

The members have different business such as selling wood, cereals, general groceries, food, drinks, handicrafts, tubers, and offering transportation services.

Such is the case with Juliana, who is 42 years old, has a live-in partner and 4 children. Juliana sells vegetables in Ayacucho’s jungle, where she travels weekly, and in the jungle she purchases fruits that she sells in the wholesale food market in the city.

Vilma is 32 years old, has a live-in partner and 2 children. Vilma has a shop in her house where she sells groceries, vegetables, meat, and chicken. She does this with the help of her husband.

The group members need different amounts of loans such as 300 PEN, 600 PEN, 900 PEN, 1000 PEN, making a total of 12.600 PEN in loans at the Community Bank.

Their loans will be invested in the purchase of cheese, vegetables, rice, sugar, potatoes, and sodas.

The dreams of the group members are to roof their house, have their own house, have their children become professionals, to improve their business, and to be wholesalers.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of cheese, vegetables, rice, sugar, potatoes, and sodas.

loans.name: Ñustas Group

texts.es:
La asociación  “Ñustas” pertenece al centro focal Santiago II, ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto,  a la fecha cuenta con catorce integrantes, que trabajan junto a la familia de Pro-Mujer hace mas de dos años.
En su mayoría el grupo se dedica al reciclaje de chatarras, compran materiales en desuso para luego venderlos a fábricas a mayor precio, otras de ellas se dedican a la costura, venta de  dulces y otros.
Actualmente su presidenta es T. Laura, cuenta que trabaja con movilidad, ofreciendo transporte publico junto a su esposo, ellos necesitan comprar repuestos, al igual que sus compañeras necesitan créditos para reforzar sus negocios, adquiriendo mayor cantidad de productos, repuestos e insumos.
texts.en:
The Ñustas association belongs to the Santiago II Community Center, which is located in the city of El Alto. The currently have 14 members who have worked together with the Pro Mujer family for over two years. Most of the group recycles scrap metal. They buy discarded materials to later sell to factories at a better price. Other group members sew or sell sweets and other things. T. Laura is the current president.
