She works with her husband in public transportation. They need to buy replacement parts. Her colleagues also need loans to reinforce their businesses by buying larger quantities of products, replacement parts, and supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products

loans.name: Marcelinas Group

texts.es:
La asociación “Marcelinas”, trabaja junto a Pro-Mujer hace mas de cuatro años, se reúnen cada dos semanas en el centro focal Collpani, ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto. Una de las socias mas antiguas es Benedicta  C., lamentablemente perdió a su hija teniendo que hacerse cargo de sus dos nietos que aun son menores de edad, actualmente ella se dedica al tejido artesanal de mantas en la lana de vicuña, afirma que este negocio le permite cubrir los gastos que tienen sus nietos.
Algunas de sus compañeras también se dedican al tejido, otras de ellas venden frutas, abarrotes, pantalones, mochilas, artefactos electrónicos y otros. Todas afirman que necesitan créditos para la compra de materia prima o mercadería.
texts.en:
The Marcelinas Group has been working with Pro Mujer for more than four years. Its members meet every fortnight in Collpani Center located in El Alto.

One of the oldest members of the group is Benedicta C. who unfortunately lost her daughter and must take care of her two grandchildren who are still minors. She weaves fabrics from the wool of vicuñas (a wild relative of the llama) and says that this business enables her to meet the expenses for her grandchildren.

Some of her fellow group members are also weavers, while others sell fruit, groceries, pants, backpacks, electronic devices and other items. They all indicate that they need a loan to buy raw materials or merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials or merchandise

loans.name: Avispas Group

texts.es:
En la zona Santiago II, se encuentra el centro focal que lleva el mismo nombre, a este pertenece la asociación “Avispas”, esta formado por quince mujeres que trabajan junto a Pro-Mujer hace dos años, demostrando ser un grupo alegre y unido. La mayoría de ellas están casadas y tienen niños pequeños, afirman que necesitan obtener mejores recursos para el bienestar de sus familias. 
Las actividades más comunes dentro este grupo es la elaboración y venta de comida, luego de preparar sus ricos platillos, los ofrecen en pensiones y puestos de mercados, otras socias tienen tiendas de barrio.
La asociación Avispas necesita comprar insumos y productos al por mayor, con esto obtendran mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
The focal centre 'Santiago II' can be found in the neighbourhood of the same name. The 'Avispas' association belongs to 'Santiago II' and is made up of 15 women who have worked together with Pro-Mujer for two years, demonstrating that it is a happy and united group. The majority of them are married with young kids, and they confirm that they need to earn more for the wellbeing of their families.

The most common activities in this group are making and selling food. After preparing their delicious dishes, they sell them in hostels, homes and from market stalls, and other members have stores in their neighbourhood.

The Avispas association needs to buy ingredients and products in bulk, and with this they will obtain higher earnings.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and products/COMPRA DE INSUMOS Y PRODUCTOS

loans.name: Copo De Nieve Group

texts.es:
La asociación “Copo De Nieve” pertenece al centro focal Santiago II, a la fecha el grupo esta formado por catorce integrantes, que trabajan de forma responsable hace nueve años aproximadamente.
La mayoría de los miembros de este  grupo  se dedica a la confección y venta de ropa, por ejemplo realizan tejido artesanales de chompas y mantas, confección de polleras, confección de ropa deportiva algunas de ellas tienen tiendas de barrio. Ahora ellas necesitan comprar materia prima para ampliar su producción, de este modo mejorar sus ingresos para el bien se sus familias.
texts.en:
The association “Copo De Nieve” belongs to the focal centre 'Santiago II', and at the moment this group has four members who have been working together for around nine years.

The majority of the members of this group dedicate themselves to making and selling clothes. For example, they weave handcrafted sweaters and ponchos, make skirts and sportswear, and some of them have their own stores in their neighbourhood. Now they need to buy basic materials to increase their production and in this way improve their income for their families' wellbeing.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic materials/COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA

loans.name: Ofilio José

texts.es: El señor Ofilio José C. C. , tiene la edad de 35 años , habita en el barrio Juan Dávila , ubicado en la concepción , junto a su esposa , la cual trabaja y le poya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene a su cargo un hijo de nueve años actualmente estudiante de primaria , los planes hacia su familia es poder apoyarle siempre a su hijo en sus estudios , desde hace cinco años don Ofilio se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son las plagas , el inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de un amigo , los planes futuros hacia su cultivo es poder diversificarlo . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para poder obtener una buena producción y poder salir adelante con sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Ofilio José C. C., aged 35, lives in the neighborhood of Juan Dávila located in La Concepción. He lives with his wife, who works and helps him with the household expenses, and their son, aged 9, who goes to elementary school. His goal with his family is to always be able to support his son in his studies.

Ofilio has worked for five years in agriculture. The greatest challenge he meets are the plagues. He started this activity with the help of a friend. His plans for the future are to diversify his crops. Ofilio will use his loan to buy fertilizers and inputs to get a good production and move forward with his goals.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and inputs to improve his crops

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Doña Maria Teresa L., reside en el barrio Monseñor Lezcano en la capital de Managua, tiene 62 años de edad, sus hijos son mayores de edad y viven independientes, su negocio es un preescolar,  el cual inicio desde hace cinco años. Este es su noveno ciclo en Afodenic y da las gracias por la oportunidad que le ha dado para cubrir sus necesidades en su negocio. Con este préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción como: madera, clavos, pintura entre otros para remodelar el preescolar y poder estar en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Maria Teresa L. lives in the Monseñor Lezcano neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. She is 62 years old. Her children are adults and live independently. She runs a preschool, which she started five years ago. This is her ninth loan cycle with Afodenic and she is thankful for the opportunity given her to cover the needs of her business. With this loan she wants to purchase construction materials such as wood, nails, and paint, among others to remodel the preschool so that it is in good condition.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to remodel the preschool.

loans.name: Bebe Baz Group

texts.en:
Bebe Baz is the leader of the four-member Bebe Baz group. Each group member wants a loan for improve and expand her business.

Bebe Baz wants to take a loan for her husband who has a fruit and vegetable shop.

Hbada wants to take a loan for her husband who has a metal-working shop.

Seema wants to take a loan for her husband who has a fruit shop.

Fazila wants to take a loan for her husband who has a general store.

They have requested a group loan of 40000 AFN, and they are very thankful to all Kiva lenders who support the poor.

loans.use: To improve and expand the business

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora C. is from the village of Manga, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. Nora is 38 years old and single. To make a living, Nora owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from cultivating coconut trees & harvesting the coconuts for sale. Nora has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Nora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Nora is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Nora from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites C. is from the village of Manga, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Marites owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Marites joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Marites is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and for daily expenses. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Roslita

texts.en: Roslita U. is from the village of San Simon, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 55 years old, married, and has five adult children. Roslita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. As an extra venture, she also engages in farming cassava, bananas and coconut. She has been engaged in her businesses for over thirty years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Roslita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Roslita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Dos

texts.en:
Mr. Dos S. is a married man and the father of six children: five are of school age and the other one is married and works driving a truck for a company.

Dos S. and his wife currently earn a living by cultivating crops. Besides his farming job, Dos S. akso uses his location on the river to fish for a profit. He has been fishing for years but he still needs more equipment to support his business. Therefore, he would like a loan from Kiva to be used as capital to buy a fishing boat for fishing activities.

Dos S. was not available for the photo so his wife is shown instead.

loans.use: To buy a fishing boat for fishing activities

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Merlinda A. is from the village of San Simon, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 40 years old and has five school-aged children. Merlinda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Merlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Merlinda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and to supplement the income of her family.. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en:
Cheng V. was born in 1973 and is currently a village woman living in Phnom Penh, the capital. She earns her daily living by growing various vegetables on her own land of her village. Her husband is a domestic construction worker. This couple has three school-aged children.

Since 2005, Cheng V. has sold her mature crop to her buyers every two or three months after she plants. Cheng Vank will be using her loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and insecticide to support her growing crops.

Note: Cheng V.’s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers, and insecticide

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma J. owns a small rice farm in Sto. Nino, South Cotabato, Mindanao. She started her farm business in 1976. Now, she still supports her husband, Benito J., by tilling their rice field for an abundant harvest.

She is asking a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. The loan will bring forth better income for her family to enjoy. She will use the loan to purchase farm supplies, fertilizers, and chemicals. Because she has three children, the income of her business was put to good use especially in paying for school and books.

Now that she is connected with the CEVI credit program, she has the loans, training, and insurance that come with joining CEVI.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs, fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Jernalyn

texts.en:
Jernalyn F. is from the village of San Simon in Cagayan De Oro City. She is 21 years old. Jernalyn is married and has two young children. To make a living, Jernalyn is a fish peddler. She peddles fishes every day in the local community. Jernalyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. Jernalyn also buys and sells hogs.

In 2007, Jernalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jernalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Jernalyn is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future as well as for additional capital for her fish peddling business. This will be Jernalyn's fourth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fish for her business

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en:
Rochelle C. has long been engaged in the hog-raising business. Since she likes pigs, this become a livelihood that supports her family's needs. She is 40 years old and she ventured into this business to support her two children, especially to give them the right education.

Now, she would like a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase pig feed. The loan funds will also be used to buy fertilizer because she also owns a rice field a short distant from their home.

She chose CEVI for its services. In addition to the loans, she has received training and insurance coverage from CEVI.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok S. is 58 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh City where she sells vegetables that her husband grows. She also buys vegetables from other farmers to sell to customers who need vegetables. She is married and has two children, both of whom are employed. Her married child is a fisherman and her single child is a blacksmith.

Sok S. manages her investments very well. She can generate an average of $5 of income each day to meet her family’s daily requirements. Sok S. is taking a loan to buy a used motorbike for her children to ride to work. With the remainder of loan, she will increase her business capital .

Note: The man shown in the picture is Mrs. Sok S.'s husband.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike for her children to ride to work

loans.name: Rezyl

texts.en:
Twenty-three-year-old Rezyl C. is soaring high in her rice farming business. She started by renting a small farm from a relative. Since then, she has started helping her husband, Jess C., especially in tilling and preparing the soil. Now she owns the farm and, because she has three children, she works double-time to have an abundant harvest to support her family.

Knowing about the services of Community Economic Ventures Inc., she is applying for a loan of Php 12,000 to help buy the needed fertilizers and chemicals for her farm. The loan will really go far in having an abundant harvest for her family.

She is still taking part in the CEVI microcredit program. She has received loans, training and insurance coverage from CEVI.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and chemicals

loans.name: Ammabelle

texts.en:
Ammabelle F. is from the village of San Simon in Cagayan De Oro. She is 34 years old. Ammabelle is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Ammabelle owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop where she sells many different products to the people in the local community. Ammabelle has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Ammabelle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ammabelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. Ammabelle is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Ammabelle's 5th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for the education of her children.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Parveen Irshad Group

texts.en:
Parveen baji has lived in Borewala, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Borewala is famous for its shrines. Her husband, I., deals in CDs and DVDs. He buys packs of CDs from different shops and sells them to the community and also to his customers. He has been operating this business for over 6 years. Parveen baji is applying for a loan to buy more CDs to expand her husband’s business.

This loan group consists of three additional people. Latifan baji wants a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to sell. Ghulam Sakina baji wants a loan to buy garments to sell. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy a welding machine.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Parveen baji is the first woman on the left in this photo.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy CDs and DVDs to sell

loans.name: Bashiran Muhammad Iqbal Group

texts.en:
Bashiran baji, the wife of M. I., has lived in Borewala, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Borewala is famous for its shrines. She is an uneducated lady because her parents could not afford to pay for her education. She doesn’t give up and spends her life with determination. Her mother taught her the skill of embroidering dresses. She started this work after her marriage. Now she is handling her business and managing her household activities very efficiently. She saves her money and uses it for needs. Her husband drives an auto-rickshaw (a three-wheeled motor vehicle). He has been in this profession for the over 3 years. She is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw because her husband drives a rented one and pays half of his income to the owner.

This loan group consists of five additional people. Parveen baji and Shakooran baji each want a loan to buy seasonal fruit to sell. Another woman, also named Parveen baji, wants a loan to buy scissors, mirror and chairs for her barber shop. Razia baji wants a loan to buy a welding machine. Shahida baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Bashiran baji is wearing a blue shawl in the photograph.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Genevie

texts.en:
A 29-year-old single woman, Genevie L. has long been engaged in the rice farming business. She has been a farmer since she was a little girl. Her parents taught her everything she knows about farming from preparing the soil until harvest.

Because she wants to expand her business, she is appling for a loan of Php 7,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and herbicides. Thus, will provide her farm an abundant harvest.

CEVI helps small business grow. She receives loans, training and insurance coverage while joining in the CEVI credit program.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline M. is from the village of Baikingon in Cagayan De Oro. She is 41 years old. Evangeline is separated from her spouse and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Evangeline owns and operates a specialized retail store where she sells fruit and vegetable products, including some widely needed items, in the local community. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Evangeline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to as additional business capital. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Evangeline's 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Baikingon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita B. owns a small, 2-hectare (~5-acre) rice field in her village. For her, rice is gold because it has sustained her family through the years. She is 45 years old and the income that she gets from the farm has gone a long way towards educating and meeting the needs of her three children.

She would like to ask a loan from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use her loan to buy foliar fertilizer (liquid fertilizer that is applied directly to plant leaves) and insecticides. Knowing about its importance in growing crops, Teresita believes this will give her farm an abundant harvest.

CEVI is reaching out farmers to sustain their livelihood. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage services as well.

loans.use: To purchase foliar fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en: Mr. Chhem U. is a  52-year-old, a married father who cares for his three school-aged children. His wife, Mok Vy, who appears in the photograph, is 44 years old. She works by selling a few grocery items for a daily profit. Chhem U. owns a small brick oven in his home where he makes bread for sale. He also takes his bread to sell to his regular customers who are retailers in and around the market. Although he has more clients, his supply is not enough to meet his customers' requirements. Therefore, he would like a loan from Kiva’s partner, HKL. He will use this loan to build a new brick oven where he can make even more bread. He proposes to use the remainder of loan to decorate his house.

loans.use: To build a new brick oven

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda T. is a 44-year-old entrepreneur from Northern Samar who migrated to Manila during her teens. She now lives with her husband, Noel, age 44, a master baker, and their four school-aged children in a social housing facility provided by Habitat for Humanity for poor families like them in Baseco Compound, Port Area, Manila.

Imelda owns and manages a grocery store that also sells rice and an adjacent bakery, because her husband is an experienced baker. She has been in this business since 1995. She also now sells liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) cylinders for household use.

She has just received a new loan of Php 50,000.00 from CCT Credit Cooperative. She used the proceeds from this loan to purchase additional goods for her grocery store and additional raw materials for bread production. Because it is very costly to transport her goods from the market to the her store, she dreams of buying her own delivery vehicle some day.

CCT is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered on the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To buy additional stock for her grocery store, raw materials for bread making, and stocks of rice

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma A. spent her life on the farm. Since she was just a little girl, she has been work hard to help support her parents and grow crops for their livelihood. Now she has two children. Her husband manages a one-hectare (~2.5-acre) rice field. At first, their harvest was intended for family consumption until they decided to sell the excess for additional income for their family.

Now, she needs additional capital to support her business. She is applying for a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loanto buy a unitsprayer and foliar fertlizer (fertilizer that is applied directly to plant leaves).

CEVI helps farmers sustain their livelihood. Through the credit services, training, and insurance coverage services that it offers, more and more were able to grow their business.

loans.use: To buy a unit sprayer and foliar fertlizers

loans.name: Genna

texts.en:
Genna P. is from the village of Baikingon in Cagayan De Oro. Genna is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Genna sells vegetable products and green bananas in the local market. Genna has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Genna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional capital. Genna is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Genna's fifth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Zone 5, Baikingon Cagayan De Oro City

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: The smiling face in the accompanying photograph is Mrs. Chhun Y., who is 51 years old. She currently owns a farm that she bought four years ago where she plants different kinds of crops. She is a single mother blessed with five children. Most of her children work in various occupations and they also provide their income to be responsible for their familing. Because Chhun Y.’s farm is far from a watering system, she has decided to seek a loan to buy a pumping machine for irrigation.

loans.use: To buy a pumping machine for irrigation

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana B. is from the village of Kinuman Norte in Ozamiz, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 70 years old. Juliana is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Juliana sells soft drinks in the local community. Juliana has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Juliana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliana has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Juliana is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to expand her business. This will be Juliana's second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane C. is from the village of Zone 5 in Baikingon, Cagayan De Oro in the Philippines. Mary Jane is married and has one young child. To make a living, Mary Jane sells products from MSE, a company that offers a variety of products like shoes, dresses, bags, perfumes, makeup etc., in the local community. Mary Jane has been a dealer for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Mary Jane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional business capital. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional MSE products to sell. This will be Mary Jane's 5th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Zone 5, Baikingon Cagayan De Oro City

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: The photograph shows Mr. Touch S. at work growing fruit on his farm. Touch S. and his wife make their daily revenue by working as local farmers in the village. This couple has given birth to six children: two are married and live separately and the others are single. Two of their are employed as staff and work by sewing clothes in the garment industry. The family owns a medium-sized farm where they plan jackfruit, bananas, and mango trees, but their farm is far from a watering system. Hence, Touch S. is looking for a loan to purchase an irrigating machine to pump water for his fruit crops.

loans.use: To purchase an irrigating machine to pump water for his fruit crops.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen P. is from the village of Baikingon in Cagayan De Oro. She is 49 years old. Ellen is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Ellen sells vegetables, barbecue sticks, and coconut in the local community. Ellen has been engaged in her business for over 19 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Ellen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ellen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Ellen is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Ellen's fifth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Zone 5, Baikingon Cagayan De Oro City

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora D. C. is a married 39-year-old woman who lives in a rented house in Dismariñas, Cavite. She has an eight-year-old son.	

For four years, Nora has run a business distributing mobile phone credit to small credit resellers. Last year, she expanded her business into selling mobile phone accessories, detergent, and other commodities. Her mobile phone credit business realizes profits of approximately 15,000 PHP per month, while her new commodities business is bringing in profits of approximately 10,000 PHP per month.

Nora is seeking a 50,000 PHP loan from CCT to further expand her business. Nora joined CCT in 2004 and successfully repaid a previous 50,000 PHP loan. Nora hopes to ultimately buy a house with the profits from her businesses.

loans.use: Additional capital for mobile phone credit and commodities businesses

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Nerissa O., 44, has been an entrepreneur since she married Ulysses, 50, her lifetime partner and business partner  (he appears with Nerissa in the photograph). Their marriage gave them 5 children. The eldest has just finished college, another child is currently enrolled in a nearby university, two children are in high school and the youngest is in grade school.

Nerissa and Ulysses own and manage a grocery store located just in front of their house in San Isidro Labrador, Area-G, Dasmarinas, Cavite. Recently, they opened a branch at the Kadiwa Public Market. Ulysses supervises their new branch. These two grocery stores give Nerissa and Ulysses an assured monthly income of at least P50,000.00 which they use to sustain the business operations, to supply for their daily needs, and for the education of their children.

Nerissa needs a loan of P50,000.00 to build up inventories for their branch in Kadiwa Public Market. Nerissa looks forward to owning a truck that they could use to transport their items from the suppliers.

CCT is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered on the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To buy additional goods for their branch in the Kadiwa Market

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel V., 36, is a tireless young entrepreneur who lives with her husband, Sofronio, 53, and their two children. One child attends grade school and the youngest is four years old.

Annabel owns a variety store, three market stalls (which she rents out to other entrepreneurs) a junk shop, and four units of motorized tricycles.  She believes and takes to heart the saying that "there's treasure hidden in garbage", so she concentrates a lot on her recycling business.  She buys used bottles, scrap metal, old newspapers and plastics from her neighbors and sells them in bulk to recyclers.

She's currently on her ninth loan cycle with CCT. She needs a loan of P10,000.00, which she will use to refurbish an old motorized tricycle to use to transport her junk items.  She's also dreaming of acquiring a bigger truck someday.

loans.use: To refurbish a motorized tricycle

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy R. is a 37-year-old woman living in the heart of a slum community. She is married and has three children.

Nancy owns and operates a variety store just in front of her house.  She has been engaged in business for 10 years now.  Business grew tremendously so she decided to put up a separate warehouse for soft drinks three years ago so she could stock up her inventory and supply the small stores within the community.  Due to brisk business demands, she recently hired two assistants to attend to deliveries.  

In the same year that she opened her soft drink warehouse, Nancy joined CCT Credit Cooperative to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of Php100,000.00 from CCT.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Just two weeks ago, Nancy received her newest loan of Php50,000.00, which she used to invest in expanding her business.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.  She also plans to renovate her soft drink warehouse.  She also plans to add rice to her already growing business.  She is also planning to purchase a delivery truck soon.

CCT is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered on the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia N., 38 years old, lives with her husband Tito, 42, an electronics repairman, and their four school-aged children.  Their family is just one of the many poor families who benefited from the socialized housing facility of Habitat for Humanity.

She buys used electronic appliances and her husband repairs them and sells them back to willing buyers.  But the main source of their family's income is her buy and sell of used clothing (ukay-ukay).  She has been in this business for four years now and it's doing good.

Her business has been helping her send the children to school.  She has just received a loan of Php 12,000.00 from CCT Credit Cooperative, which she used to buy more used clothes.  She wishes to own a tricycle that she can use in hauling used clothes from her suppliers.  

CCT is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered on the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory of used clothing

loans.name: Abdul Akbar

texts.en:
Abdul Akbar lives in Jalalabad, in Nangrahar province. He is married and has four children. He has been in the agriculture business for more than 6 years and he wants to make his business expand. He needs more money for his business capital to get a good monthly income and to better help his family. 

He has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani. He wants to expand and move his business forward, buying some necessary materials and completing his stock for his land so he can start working even harder. So Abdul Akbar is very happy with this process of small loans in Jalalabad, Afghanistan and wants to thank those involved, especially Kiva and all lenders around the world and AFS (Ariana Financial Services Joint Stock Company) in Jalalabad, Afghanistan.

loans.use: Buying some necessary things for his farming

loans.name: Bahodurhon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
      Баходурхону 33 лет. Женат и отец 3-х детей. Имеет высшее образование. Баходурхон водит маршрутное такси по городу Худжанду, номер маршрутного такси № 13 по направлению рынок Панчшанбе - 34-й микрорайон. У Баходурхона много пассажиров, потому, что каждый день много людей ездят на рынок. Баходурхон работает 5 дней в неделю. В выходные дни он ухаживает за машиной. Баходурхон ездит на бензине, и так как в связи с инфляцией бензин подорожал, ему сейчас невыгодно на бензине, и он хочет установить газовое оборудование.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Bahodurhon is 33 years old. He is married and is a father of three children. He has high education. Bahodurhon drives a shuttle taxi around the town of Khujand, the number of taxi is 13 with a route to Panschabe market in the 34th micro region. Bahodurhon has many passengers because every day a lot of people travel to the market. Bahodurhon works five days a week. During the weekends he takes care of the vehicle. Bahodurhon uses gasoline and because of inflation gasoline is now expensive and it's not profitable for him anymore he wants to install hydrogen equipment.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hydrogen equipment

loans.name: Elba

texts.en:
Elba A. is from the village of Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 45 years old. Elba is married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Elba does traditional gold mining. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling gold per gram. Elba has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Elba joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elba has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Elba is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for "pamiling". This loan will be the third loan taken out by Elba from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and farm financing. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To have additional capital for "pamiling" business

location.town: Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Shoirachon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
      Шоирачон 24 года, она замужем и мать 1-го ребенка. У нее есть Дилерский центр в районе старого автовокзала. Шоирачон обслуживает абонентов нескольких сотовых операторов Таджикистана, таких как: Индиго-Сомонком, Вавилон, МЛТ, М-теко, ТК-мобайл и др. Она пополняет счета, продает сим-карты и карты экспресс-оплаты. В районе Автовокзала очень много людей, как местных, так и приезжих. У Шоирачон много клиентов, так как её помещение находится на остановке, на очень видном месте. Шоирачон планирует расширить свое дело и закупать побольше сим-карт и карт экспресс оплаты. Для этого она просит очередной займ.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Shoirachon is 24 years old, she is married and a mother of one child. She has a dealer center in the region of the old automall. Shoirachon services telephone customers of several mobile providers of Tajikistan such as Indigo-Somonkom, Vavilon, MLT, M-techo, TK-mobile and others. She tops up their accounts, sells SIM-cards and cards for express payments. In the region of the automall there are a lot of people locals as well as visitors. Shoirachon has many customers because her center is in a very good location near the bus stop. Shoirachon plans to expand her business and buy more SIM-cards and express payment cards. For this she is requesting another loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy SIM cards and express payment cards

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila B. is from the village of Tagpangi, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 27 years old. Sheila is single and has one infant child. To make a living, Sheila owns & operates a specialized retail business selling firewood in the local community. Sheila has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Sheila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sheila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Sheila is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Sheila from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites D. R. is from the village of Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old. Marites is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Marites owns & operates a business selling fish to local community members. Marites has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marites joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC. Marites is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to buy a fishing net. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marites from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga D. Sur, Lanao D. Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy a fishing net

loans.name: Wevina

texts.en:
"Before, I was about to give up when we failed in our business. But opportunity knocked again when CEVI came and gave us capital to support our business. I am a farmer and I am managing a 5-hectare farm with my husband. In as much as we like to grow our business, all we can do is to work harder to achieve an abundant harvest on our farm," says Wevina C., a 50 year old mother of five children. 

Now she would like to ask for a loan worth Php 10,000. She will use the loan to purchase herbicides and insecticides. The loan will truly help, especially in achieving an abundant harvest for the family.

CEVI helps small business grow. She received not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase herbicides and insecticides

loans.name: Geraline

texts.en:
Geraline H. is from the village of Katipa, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Geraline is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Geraline owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling bananacue to the local community. Geraline has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Geraline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Geraline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. Geraline is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Geraline from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina L. is from the village of Tumapagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 33 years old. Gina is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling viands, binignit (a local delicacy) and barbecue (grilled meat) in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Gina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business and some funds were used for their daily needs. Gina is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering and engage in the buying and selling of gold dust in their local community. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Gina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San R., 48, is a village woman living in Pursat Province. She is a local crop farmer, growing rice, vegetables, and some fruit on her own farmland. To help meet the family's daily expense needs, her husband works as a military policeman in the village. San R. now has four children, three of whom are of school-aged and the other one is married and lives independently.

In the past five years, San R. has faced difficulty with plowing, because she has no water buffalo. Now, she is applying for a loan to purchase a water buffalo in order to facilitate plowing the farmland during this rice-growing season.

loans.use: To purchase a water buffalo in order to plow her farmland

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly J. is from the village of Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. Nelly owns and operates a fishing business, selling fish to the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Nelly joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Nelly is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to repair the fishing boat. This loan will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair the fishing boat

loans.name: Lenielyn

texts.en: Lenielyn B. is from the village of Zone 1, Baikingon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 28 years old, married, and has an infant child. Lenielyn owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling processed food products like longganisa (Filipino-style sausages) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Lenielyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make longganisa for sale. Lenielyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Noreen Faqeer Hussain Group

texts.en:
Noreen baji has been a citizen of Borewala, Pakistan, for the past fifteen years. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. Her husband’s name is F. H. and he runs a business selling fruit-salad. Noreen baji helps him by making the fruit salad and sauces. His business is going well. He treks to different communities and sells his products from a cart.

Noreen baji is applying for a loan to buy seasonal fruits to advance her husband’s fruit-salad business. In the photo, Noreen baji is seated in a middle of the baji’s.
 
This loan group consists of four additional people: 

Saima baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

Kosar parveen baji wants a loan to buy a welding machine.

Rani baji wants a loan to buy paint boxes to sell.

Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: To buy fruit for their fruit-salad business

loans.name: Nasreen Arshad Group

texts.en:
Nasreen baji has resided in a city named Borewala, Pakistan, for the past ten years. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. Her husband’s name is A. and he is a loader by profession. He loads different items on his tractor such as sugarcane and wheat and delivers to the required address. He has been doing this work for over five years.

Nasreen baji is applying for a loan to repair his tractor because its engine needs urgent maintenance. Nasreen baji is seated in an orange shawl in this photo.

This loan group consists of three additional people: 

Farzana baji and Gulzar baji each want a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to sell.

Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business.

Elizabeth owns and operates a weaving business, weaving and selling "amakan" or woven bamboo wall products to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Elizabeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to expand her product offering. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. loans.name: Ernalyn

texts.en: Ernalyn D. is from the village of Zone 1, Baikingon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 36 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Ernalyn owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Ernalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ernalyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a sewing machine to engage in a new business. This loan will be the 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family and to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. loans.name: Tahira Muhammad Ramzan Group

texts.en:
Tahira baji, wife of M. R., has lived the city of Borewala, Pakistan, for the past fifteen years. Borewala City is famous for its shrines. Her husband runs a bread-making business. He makes bread on order and sells to the required customers. He sells each loaf for five Pakistan rupees because the flour rate is very high in Pakistan.

Tahira baji is a very caring and supportive lady. She runs her clothes-sewing business to share the financial burden of her husband. She is requesting a loan to buy sacks of flour to advance his bread-making business. Tahira baji is seated second from the left in the photo, sewing clothes on the sewing machine.

This loan group consists of four additional people: 

Jamila baji and Saeeda baji each want a loan to repair their tractors.

Razia baji and Mukhtayaran baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops.

loans.use: To buy sacks of flour for her husband's bread-making business

loans.name: Eung

texts.en: Eung M., a 34-year-old married father of four school-aged children, lives with his family in Siem Reap Province.  He currently owns a medium-sized place in the local busy market where, assisted by his wife, he can earn about $3 each day selling fresh fish and various fruits.  Eung has always spent a great deal hiring taxis to take his produce to the market; in order to reduce those transportation expenses, he is requesting a loan to buy a second-hand motorbike to be used for that purpose.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike.

loans.name: Martha Arif Masih Group

texts.en:
Martha baji, wife of A. M., has lived in the city of Borewala, Pakistan for the past fifteen years. Borewala City is famous for its shrines. Her husband runs a grocery shop in the community.

Martha baji is a very active and supportive lady. She encourages her husband to run his grocery shop in the community because people used to have to go far away from the community to buy groceries. Now Martha baji is applying for a loan to buy groceries to expand her husband’s grocery shop. Martha baji is seated in the center of the baji’s in the photo.

The loan group consists of two additional people:

Farida baji wants a loan to buy milk to sell.

Sharifan baji wants a loan to buy wood to sell.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her husband's grocery shop

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en: Merlina T. is from the town of Lingating, Baungon, Bukidnon. Merlina and is married with five school-aged children. Merlina owns and operates a specialized retail business, primarily selling gasoline and cell-phone loading in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Merlina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Merlina is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell and also to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family and to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell and to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Fenie

texts.en:
Fenie M. is from the village of Unidos. She is 29 years old. Fenie is married and has 1 school aged child. To make a living, Fenie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Fenie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Fenie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fenie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Fenie is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 13th loan taken out by Fenie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Parveen Amanat Group

texts.en:
For the past 15 years Parveen baji, the wife of A., has resided in Borewala, Pakistan, a city famous for its shrines. For over three years her husband has delivered a variety of items including fruits and vegetables on his cart, his charges set according to destination. Parveen baji is a very caring lady, arising very early each day with her husband to prepare a breakfast for him. She is applying for a loan to buy a new donkey cart for her husband because the old cart has become rough and rotted.

This loan consists of two additional people: Jamila baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Riffat baji wants a loan to buy wheat to sell.

The funds for this group loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members guarantee one another's loans, so if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Parveen baji is seated in the middle in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart

loans.name: Sharifan Rafiq Group

texts.en:
Sharifan baji, wife of R., has been a citizen of Borewala, Pakistan, for the past fifteen years. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. Her husband runs a scrap business in the community. He trades in different used items such as cupboards, iron doors and windows. He has been doing this work for over five years.

Sharifan baji is a very caring and supportive lady and performs her duties efficiently. Her family is very happy with her because of her calm nature. She is applying for a loan to buy scrap to advance her husband’s scrap business. Sharifan baji is seated on the left in the photo.

This loan group consists of two additional people:

Zareena baji and Shahnaz baji each want a loan to buy timber to sell.

loans.use: To buy scrap for her husband's scrap business

loans.name: Metzi

The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Metzi has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 1,000 Philippine pesos (about $21) a month for these activities.

In 2008, Metzi joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Metzi has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Metzi is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Metzi from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
