loans.name: Parveen Muhammad Munir Group

texts.en:
Parveen baji is the wife of M. M.. She has resided in Borewala, Pakistan, for the past 15 years. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. Her husband runs a timber-selling business. He chose this business because there’s no gas available and people use timber for cooking. He has been involved in this business for more than five years. Parveen baji is applying for a loan to buy timber to grow her husband’s business.

This loan consists of two additional people: Elizabeth baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) and Irshad baji wants a loan to buy goats for her butcher shop. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. 

Note: Parveen baji is seated in the middle of the bajis. Baji means "older sister" and is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy timber to sell

loans.name: Seth

texts.en:
Seth Y. is 28 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province. She is married and blessed with two school-aged children. She is currently on the cleaning staff of a private English school. Her husband works driving a taxi as well as in construction for income. 

Seth Y. will be use the loan money to decorate her house to build a small store, where she will begin selling a few groceries to neighbors. This will provide her with additional profit through selling grocery items.

loans.use: To decorate her house and build a small store to begin selling a few groceries

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina B. is from the town of Lingating, Baungon, Bukidnon. She is a 55-year-old married mother of 4 adult-aged children. Angela operates a food stall. She sells fish, vegetables, and other goods in the local market. Angelina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (or about $210 US) a month for these activities.

In 2007, Angelina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Angelina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 pesos (or about $300) from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. Angelina is requesting a new loan of 17,000 pesos (or about $375) which will be used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. This loan will be the 6th loan Angelina has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to help support her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Muharram

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
     Мухаррам - женщина средних лет, ей 40 лет. Она замужем и мать троих детей. Мухаррам вместе с мужем занимаются производством и продажей национальных лепешек. Её муж печет дома лепешки а Мухаррам продает их на базаре и принимает заказы от потенциальных клиентов. Мухаррам и мужу помогают дети. Из дома до рынка лепешки отвозит их старший сын. У сына сейчас летние каникулы. Мухаррам и её муж хотят закупить парию муки примерно 15-20 мешков. Для этого Мухаррам просит займ в размере 1200 сомони.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Muharram is a middle age woman, she is 40 years old. She is married and is a mother of three children. Muharram together with her husband make and sell traditional flat breads. Her husband bakes the flat breads at home and Muharram sells them on the market and takes orders from potential customers. Muharram and her husband's children help them. Their oldest son delivers the flat breads from home to the market. Their son is on summer recess right now. Muharram and her husband want to purchase a stock of flour of approximately 15-20 bags. Muharram is requesting a loan for amount of 1200 somoni for this reason.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour for baking of flat breads

loans.name: Nasreen Sarwar Group

texts.en:
Nasreen baji lives in Borewala, Pakistan, a city which is famous for its shrines. She owns a two-room brick house which she has lived in with her family for 18 years. Her husband, S., runs a grocery store that is popular because of the owner's fariness and stock of quality items. Nasreen baji wants a loan to turn her husband’s grocery shop into full-fledged store.

This loan will also go to four other people: 
Parveen baji and Kubra baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their shops. 
Rani baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 
Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. 

This is a group loan. The funds will be distributed among the members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. 

Note: Nasreen baji is seated in the middle of the baji’s.

loans.use: To buy groceries for shop

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina L. lives in the village of Mangidkid. She is 26 years old, married and has two school-aged children. Cristina makes a living by raising livestock, mostly pigs. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2008, Cristina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. Cristina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. She used this loan to buy livestock feed and other supplies. She has applied for a new loan of 10,000 PHP to buy additional livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Mala Jan

texts.en:
Mala J., son of A. J., has much experience in agriculture having started his business 10 years ago, and it is still going very well. He is not alone; one of his sons works with him. Sometimes other members of his family help as well. He is 45 years old, married and has four children. He lives in Jalalabad, Nangarhar province.

Mala J. has repaid his first loan, and it was very useful to him. Now he wants to take out a second loan of 50,000 AFN to buy seeds and other necessary things for his business. He wants to make his business bigger and to stand on his own feet in the future.

Mala J. is happy with the process of loans in Afghanistan. He hopes to help better his family's situation and make a better future for them. He wishes to grow his business in Jalalabad and open many shops in the next few years. He would like to thank both Kiva and Ariana Financial Services Joint Stock Company (AFS) in Jalalabad, Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Majengo Group

texts.en:
Grace is a member of the Majengo borrower group in Kiboriloni, Kilimanjaro. She is a 29-year-old woman, who is married and the mother of 3 children. Her children are aged 9, 6 and 2 years.

Grace has her own grocery business selling drinks like soda and beer. She has had this business for 4 years. She works for 8 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 90,000 Tanzania Schillings.

This is Grace’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more beer for her shop. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Grace hopes to expand her business.

Matha S., another member of the Majengo borrower group, has also requested 200,000 Tsh in order to support her own business.

Martha Elieke, also a member of the Majengo borrower group, has requested a loan of 200,000 Schillings for her business of selling vitenge and kanga (fabric).

loans.use: To buy more beer

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
The women who have applied for this loan from Kiva’s partner HKL are poor, but also determined to use their portion of the funds to help improve their lives. 

The group leader, C., was born in 1984, is married and has two children who are enrolled in primary school. Her husband is a security guard for a small firm located in Siem Reap Province. Since early 2008, C. has made a living selling groceries out of her home and is currently earning around $3 a day to meet family expenses. Her customers are villagers who live nearby as well as people passing through the village. Recently, C. has virtually sold out her stock of groceries, and lacks the money to buy additional supplies. She will use this loan to restock her small store. 

Among the other members of this loan group:

K. will use her portion of the loan to buy wood to finish building her house.
S., a grocery seller, is looking for a loan to expand her business.
C. will use her loan to buy a motor vehicle to ride to work.
C. will use the loan to buy a machine for her husband’s blacksmithing shop.
S. will use the loan to buy a boat for fishing.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Neza

texts.en:
Neza P. lives in the village of Bato. She is 55 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Neza has just started a small manufacturing business.

In 2008, Neza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve life and ability to engage in business. Neza has successfully repaid two previous loans of 5,000 PHP from PMPC, and is requesting a new loan of 10,000 to buy inventory. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to improve her family's living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand her inventory and working capital

Julita has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from her work.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en: Perla D. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 43 years old, is married, and has seven school-aged children. Perla owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Perla joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Perla is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Mordina

texts.en: Mordina I. sells ice-cream by hawking it (going door-to-door) within her community in Benin City, Edo State. She is 38 years old and married with five children. She hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more ice-cream to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ice-cream to sell

loans.name: Martha Kemuma

texts.en:
Martha N. is a 36-year-old farmer in Nyamusi, Nyanza Province. She is married to Charles who is a primary school teacher and they have five children. Martha has been running a general store for the last twelve years and it has proved to be a profitable business. 

This is her second loan from KADET, which was approved after she successfully completed repaying her first one. She hopes to expand her business with the money from this loan by increasing her stock, expanding it to a wholesale shop, and in future diversifying to hardware sales. 


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To add more stock and diversify into selling hardware

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Mrs. Margaret B. is a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She has two children: one is working and the other one is already married.

Margaret obtained her third loan of Php 5,000 in the special program of Paglaum called Paglaum Development Program for Landless People. Her proposed project is hog-raising.

Margaret is happy to have this project because it provides more help to her family, especially for their basic needs. She gives her warmest thanks to Paglaum because she enjoys the services and other benefits of Paglaum like insurance and savings deposit.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for hog-raising

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience O. is 45 years old and married with seven children. She sells soup ingredients to make a living.

Patience is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more soup ingredients to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more soup ingredients to sell

loans.name: Esau Masinde

texts.en: Esau S. is a thirty-three-year-old single man who runs a makeshift shop in Bukembe Market, Western Kenya. He sells mainly household items like cooking utensils, cooking pots, and brooms. Esau has been managing his business very well and has attracted many regular clients who come from Bukembe Village and its environs. He is taking his third loan from KADET and intends to use it to relocate the business to a permanent building and open a shop. Esau’s desire is to diversify his business by opening a posho mill (a grain-grinding mill) to meet the demands of local residents and also to create job opportunities for others in his community. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To relocate his business to a permanent building

loans.name: Everlyne Nafula

texts.en: Everlyne S. is a modest businesswoman in Kakamega Town, Western Kenya. She is married to Harrison and they have two school-going children aged eight and four years. Everlyne presently sells various types of fish in Bukembe Market to earn a living. Fish is a popular dish in Western Kenya, and she has seen a remarkable growth in her business since she started it three years ago. Everlyne is taking her second loan from KADET and she intends to use it to purchase more fish stock. She wants to see further growth in her business to enable her to diversify into farming activities. For now she is happy that she can afford to educate her two children. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy more fish stock

loans.name: James Omondi

texts.en: James S. is a forty-seven-year-old man living in Bukembe Village of Kakamega District, Western Kenya. He is married to Emily and they have five children. James currently sells various fish such as tilapia and omena. Omena is a small two-inch long fish found in Lake Victoria in Western Kenya. He buys his fish from Kisumu City which is situated next to Lake Victoria. James has been managing his business on his own for the last twelve years. This will be James' third loan from KADET. He plans to use this loan to increase his stock of fish and also plans to buy cattle as a way of diversifying his business. His dream is to one day own a boat and start fishing. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To increase his stock of fish, and buy cattle in order to diversify his business

loans.name: Kav's Group

texts.en:
The four persons shown in the photograph above are low-income people who are jointly requesting a loan. They are all living in Siem Reap Province, in Cambodia. One of these people, Mr. Kav C., age 40, has been selected to be a leader by the other group members.

Kav C. and his wife currently have a fishing business in and around the Tunle Sap River. This couple has been fishing in the river for more than nine years and earn an average of $5 per day to contribute to their three school-aged children, including school fees.

Due to the coming rising water and fishing season, the river is full of fish. Kav C., however, is lacking equipment to fish and that is why he requested a loan to purchase nets, traps, and other tools for his fishing operations.

There are three other borrowers who have requested a loan as follows:

Mrs. S. will be using her loan to better support her fishing business.

Mrs. S. makes a living by fishing and is asking for a loan to buy a boat engine to improve her business.

Mrs. S. will be using the Kiva loan to buy more nets and traps to fish better.

loans.use: To purchase nets, traps, and other tools for his fishing operations

loans.name: Daniel Nyantika

texts.en:
Daniel O. is 51 years old and married to Christine. Together, they have six children. Daniel runs a butcher shop in the Nyamusi Market Center in Nyanza Province.

This will be Daniel's second loan from KADET.  He used his first loan to construct his own butcher shop, and the profits from the shop have enabled him to meet his family's needs. He has been able to employ one more person, who assists him in the daily operations of the business.

Daniel hopes that this loan will enable him to expand his business and even to open another butcher shop at a nearby market.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To increase butchery stock by purchasing more bulls and goats

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
N. Margaret is the leader of Umoja group in Seeta. She is a hardworking lady who has had a retail shop business in Kiwanga Trading center for three years. This is her first loan with the group and she hopes that the loans will help her rebuild her shop with more stock hence be able to make more profits.

Margaret is the single mother of two children and she cares for two grandchildren. Three of the children are in school. She is happy that she is not renting her shop premises hence the transformation won’t be so bad.

loans.use: To restock her retail shop with more products

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience I. sells sarongs of various colors within her community in Benin City, Edo State. She is 40 years old and married with two children. She is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Nelsie

texts.en: Nelsie H. is from the city of Oroquieta. She is 47 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. Nelsie owns and operates a restaurant, serving local foods to customers in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Nelsie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Nelsie is requesting a new loan of 14,950 PHP which will be used as additional capital for restaurant expansion. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for restaurant expansion

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace E. sells peppers in retail to her customers. She is 38 years old and married with 7 children. She is requesting a loan of 80,000 Nigerian naira (or about $550 US) to purchase more peppers to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more peppers to sell

loans.name: Jessica's Group

texts.en: Jessica K., 43, is the leader of Konoweka group in Lugazi. Jessica is married with 5 children from ages 20 to 26. She also cares for 5 dependents who all attend school. Jessica sells produce and has also been a farmer for 3 years. Her business is being affected by escalating produce costs, poor quality seeds, the seasonal market and so on and she is happy that she has managed to get through all of this with the help of loans. Her business is located in Ngogwe in Buikwe and she is able to make weekly profits of 60,000 Ugandan shillings (or about $30 US) due to her experience, good management skills, quality produce and trusted customers. She hopes to one day open up a produce shop and have an educated family. She is a hardworking and determined lady and has a drive to succeed.

loans.use: Buying more produce for resale.

loans.name: Jay

texts.en:
Jay B. is from the city of Oroquieta. He is 29 years old and single. To make a living, Jay owns and operates a barber shop. The primary--but not only--source of this business's income comes from providing hairdressing and beauty services to local community members. Jay has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8000 Philippine pesos (or about $85 US) a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jay joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Jay is requesting a new loan of 14950 pesos (or about $325) which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be his second loan from PMPC. Jay plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business to improve the general living conditions his family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service.

loans.name: Son's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Son P., 27, is the leader of this group loan that is composed of four low-profit people. Son P. is requesting a loan to hire a carpenter to paint her old house that often leaks during heavy rains. Son P. earns a living working as porter in a busy fish market, while her husband is a fish delivery driver. The couple has two teenage children who attend the local school.

There are three other borrowers in this group.

T. is applying for a loan to buy wood in order to build a new house.
R. is a security guard. She will use her loan to buy a motor vehicle to drive to work.
S. will be using a loan to repair her old house that has broken.

loans.use: To hire a carpenter to paint her old house.

loans.name: Ipogolo D Group

texts.en:
Fabiola is a member of the Ipogolo D borrower group in Ruaha, Kilimanjaro. She is a 43-year-old married mother of 2. Her children are ages 18 and 20, respectively.   

Fabiola has owned a salon for 5 years. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 190,000 Tanzanian shillings (or about $140 US).

This is Fabiola’s 1st loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 shillings (or about $155) in order to buy more supplies. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Fabiola hopes to expand her business. 
Maria, another member of the Ipogolo D borrower group, has requested 250,000 shillings (or about $195) in order to support her business of selling snacks and charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her salon.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita O. is 47 years old and married with 6 children. She sells palm kernels. She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more palm kernels to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm kernels to sell

loans.name: Galka

texts.ru: Бобоева Галка проживает в районе Явана. Возраст 50 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Галка имеет торговую точку, где торгует разными мелочами. Например: Жвачаки, семечки, конфеты и т.д. Муж подрабатывает на стройке. Кредит, просит для закупа семечек и внести в ассортимент арбуз и кукурузу.
texts.en:
Galka B. lives in the Yavan district. She is 50 years old, married and has 5 children. Galka has a retail stand where she sells various small items, such as chewing gum, seeds, candy, etc. Her husband works part-time at a construction site. She is requesting a loan to purchase seeds and to add watermelons and corn to her product assortment.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing assortment

loans.name: Elizabeth Nabwitikha

texts.en:
Elizabeth Nabwitikha O. is a 55-year-old lady living in Bukembe village of Kakamega District, Western Kenya. She is married to Linus Odera and they have six children.

Elizabeth is a fish monger and has been in the business for the last 24 years. She manages this business on her own, and she intends to diversify her business to include dairy farming. This will be Elizabeth's third loan from KADET. She plans to use this loan to increase her stock of fish and to purchase dairy cattle.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: buy more fish to sell and dairy cattle

loans.name: Evans Wangila

texts.en:
Evans W. is 40 years old, married, and has four children. He repairs motorcycles in Chekulo, a small town in the Western Province, and has been in this business for the last ten years.

Evans is taking out his first loan from KADET Ltd and was introduced to KADET by an existing client. He is going to use this money to buy more parts and inventory for his motorcycle repair shop, which will enable him to improve his business by repairing all the motorcycles that are brought to him. Evans also hopes to employ one person to help him manage the business.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy more parts and inventory for a motorcycle repair shop

loans.name: Cissy's Group

texts.en:
K. Cissy is the determined leader of Gamba group in Nkambwe village. She is a widow with 6 children aged 24 – 14 as she also cares for 3 dependents. Cissy is a fishmonger and although her business is doing well, she has always been affected by the escalating cost of fish, over-fishing by fellow business-people, high taxes from the authorities and poor methods of preserving fish hence allowing fish to go bad.

However, amidst all this, Cissy is able to make a weekly profit of 58,500/= and she hopes to be able to load a whole pick-up with fish for her alone. Cissy also hopes to build a better family house so that her family can feel comfortable. She needs a loan to be able to purchase more fish for recapitalization.

loans.use: Purchasing more fish to sell

loans.name: Ubaid

texts.ru: Убайд Рачабов проживает в районе Явана. Возраст 46 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Убайд более 5 лет работал по своей специальности "шофером". В данный момент он занимается ремонтом автомашины. Этой услугой занимается более 7 лет. Кредит, просит для закупа автозапчастей.
texts.en:
Ubaid R. lives in the Yavan district. He is 46 years old, married and has 3 children. Ubaid had worked as a driver for over 5 years. Now, he is involved in auto repairs. He has been providing this service for over 7 years. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of auto parts.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of auto parts

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Beauty I. is a fashion designer and she also sells sarongs. She is 35 years old and married with 4 children. She is requesting the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Phim's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of four low-income members. Its leader, Phim S., is aged 38 and the mother of five children: four are single and one is married and lives away from home. She is married to Nhem Kok, 39, and they both earn a living by working as carrying workers in the busy fish market. This couple makes as their daily income approximately US$ 4 per day to manage their family’s daily living needs.

The family’s living conditions are not so comfortable due to the fact that their house is cracking. To solve this problem, Phim S. is taking out a loan to repair her old broken house.

The other borrowers are:

S. is a grocery seller, requesting a loan to grow her business.

T. is taking out a loan to decorate her house.

C. will be using a loan to paint her old house that is in poor condition.

loans.use: To repair her old broken house

loans.name: Lumenada

texts.en:
Lumenada S. is from the village of Salawagan, Quezon Bukidnon. She is 44 years old. Lumenada is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Lumenada owns and operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as corn, soft brooms and coffee in the local community. Lumenada has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 20009, Lumenada joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lumenada is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Lumenada from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and supplement her income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Production and sale of soap

loans.name: Xuan's Group

texts.en:
Xuân T. Đàm was born in 1970. She lives in Ngoc Loi, Duc Tu, Dong Anh, Ha Noi with her husband and two children. Her husband is a worker. Their first son is a carpenter near the house. Xuan has a cosmetic shop in the village. She sells cosmetics, souvenirs and hair fastener.

Xuân is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Xuan is now requesting a new loan of 4.142.000 VND (or 230 USD) which will be used to invest in her cosmetic shop.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

Mắn Thị Nguyễn was born in 1954. She has two children. Every day, she buys chickens from farmers and resells them in the market. She needs 4.578.000 VND (or 250 USD) to buy more chickens.

Miên Thị Hoàng was born in 1970.She has two children. She sells fresh beer at home. She needs 4.578.000 VND (or 250 USD) to buy chairs and tables.

Thu Thị T. Phạm was born in 1970. She has two children. She breeds pigs and poultry. She needs 4.578.000 VND (or 250 USD) to buy food for them.

Vân Thị Nguyễn was born in 1971. She has two children. She sells fish in the market. She needs 4.578.000 VND (or 250 USD) to buy more fish for sale.

Hà Thị Nguyễn was born in 1977. She has two children. Her family has a carpentry workshop at home. She needs 4.578.000 VND (or 250 USD) to buy wood.

loans.use: To invest in her cosmetic shop

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: Ngozi A. sells children's clothes. She is 30 years old and married with 2 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more children's clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more children's clothes to sell

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en: N. Florence is the leader of Kirabo group in Seeta. She is 45 years old and a mother of 5 children; she also cares for 2 dependents. Florence has had a business selling fresh food at the Seeta central market for over 15 years. She sells all kinds of foods and fresh vegetables and as a result, she has been able to create a strong customer base hence making more money. This is her first time to seek a loan from Pearl Microfinance and she hopes to recapitalize her business by buying more produce with her loan.

loans.use: Buying more produce for resale

loans.name: Akbar

texts.ru: Акбар Чабборов проживает в районе Явана. Возраст 20 лет. Холост. Акбар более 3 лет занимается торговлей и предосталением услуги по ремонту телефонов. Он в основном торгует телефонами и сим-картами. По специальности "юрист". Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота. За счет накопления прибыли, хочет сыграть свою свадьбу.
texts.en:
Akbar C. lives in the region of Yavan. He is 20 years old, a bachelor. Akbar has been in the business of retail for three years and provides services for mobile phone repairs. He mainly sells phone cards and SIM cards. His profession is a lawyer. He is asking for a loan to increase commodity circulation. He wants to use the accumulated profit to have a wedding.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Kosar Parveen Ghulam Nabi Group

texts.en:
My name is Kosar Parveen and I have been a citizen of a city named Arifwala, Pakistan for the past 18 years. I belong to a very poor and big family. My father was the only breadwinner in my family, so we always compromised on our needs. I married G. N.; he is a driver and drives a local 32-seat bus and takes fares from the passengers according to their destinations. He has been driving this vehicle for over 8 years. I am applying for a loan to use to repair my husband’s bus because its engine is creating a problem.

This loan group consists of three additional people:

Sheema baji wants a loan to buy cigarettes to sell.

Hajra baji wants a loan to buy fertilizer to sell.

Sobia Iram baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. Note: Kosar baji is seated first on the right side of this photo.

loans.use: To repair a vehicle (32-seat bus)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make and sell porridge

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna U. is from the village of San Roque, Quezon Bukidnon. She is 30 years old. Edna is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Edna owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Edna has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Edna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Edna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Khursheed Muhammad Islam Group

texts.en:
My name is Khursheed and I have lived in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan for the past 19 years. My husband's name is M. I. and he deals in firewood; since gas is not available in the community, people used firewood to cook food. He has been selling it for over 9 years. He buys timber wholesale. I am applying for a loan to advance my husband’s business.

This group loan consists of three additional people:

Munaza baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Rehana Manzoor baji wants a loan to buy embroidering material (colored thread, cloth, and beads) for preparing embroidered dresses.

Suraiya begum baji wants a loan to buy goats for her family's butcher shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. Note: Khursheed baji is seated first on the right side in this photo.

loans.use: To buy timber to sell firewood

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort O. sells provisions and foodstuffs. She is 60 years old and she is a widow with 4 children. She is requesting the loan mount of N120,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell dried fish

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en:
Kim Thị Trương was born in 1962. She lives in Ngoc Loi, Dong Anh, Ha Noi with her husband and three children. Her sons are carpenters, and her small children are going to school. Her husband is a semiofficial policeman in the commune.

Ms. Kim is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by SEDA. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  Ms. Kim has participated in SEDA for three years. Her family has a carpentry workshop. Her family has a monthly income of about 5.500.000 VND. This time, she wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND (or 280 USD) to buy wood.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

Xâm Thị Trương was born in 1966. She has two children. She wants to borrow 4.578.000 VND (or 250 USD) to open a carpentry workshop.

Chinh Thị Đỗ was born in 1971. She has three children. She wants to borrow 4.578.000 VND (or 250 USD) to invest in her carpentry workshop.

Nghĩa Thị Lê was born in 1973. She has three children too. She wants to borrow 4.578.000 VND (or 250 USD) to buy wood.

Thông Thị Đỗ was born in 1960. She has a son. She wants to borrow 4.578.000 VND (or 250 USD) to buy wood.

Nghiên Thị Vương was born in 1959. She sells chickens in the market. She wants to borrow 4.578.000 VND (or 250 USD) to buy chickens.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Sadia Muhammad Rafiq Group

texts.en:
My name is Sadia and I have lived in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan for the past 18 years. My husband's name is M. R. and he deals in seasonal vegetables. He buys vegetables wholesale and sells them to his customers and also treks to different communities to sell his produce, calling out in loud voice. He uses his donkey cart when he goes to different communities.

I handle my own plastic bottle cap-making business, taking orders from the factories. I save my income in a committee and plan to renovate my house with the committee amount. I am applying for a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to grow my husband’s business.

This loan consists of three additional people:

Sheena Firdous baji wants a loan to buy cold drinks for her drinks corner.

Khalida Parveen baji wants a loan to buy CDs to sell.

Kosar Ayaz baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. Note: Sadia R. baji is seated first on the left side in this photo.

loans.use: To buy seasonal vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy O. sells provisions and drinks. She is 45 years old and she is a widow with 4 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Sajida Parveen Muhammad Ramzan Group

texts.en:
Sajida Parveen baji owns a two-room brick house in a city called Arifwala, Pakistan and has been living in it for the past 18 years. Her husband's name is M. R. and he has a rented motorbikes business. He lets motorbikes out for a fee and charges according to the hours used. He has been in this business for over 8 years. Presently, he has 2 motorbikes.

Sajida baji is a very hard-working lady. She also has a clothes sewing business. She does this work to pay their utilities bills. Her work gives her courage to lead an independent life. She is applying for a loan to buy another motorbike to grow her husband’s rented motorbikes business.

This loan is consists of two additional people:

Safia begum baji wants a loan to buy vehicle spare parts to sell.

Parveen baji wants a loan to buy timber to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. Note: Sajida parveen baji is seated in the middle of the baji's in this photo.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike for their rented bikes business

loans.name: Tujikomboe Group

texts.en:
Zuhura is a member of the Tujikomboe borrower group in Msamvu, Morogoro. She is a 48-year-old woman, married, and the mother of 4 children. Her children are aged 36, 34, 30, and 21.

Zuhura started her own salon business 6 years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 150,000 Tanzania Schillings.

This is Zuhura’s second loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 350,000 Tsh in order to expand her business. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Zuhura hopes to save money, to do repairs, improve her home, get more food for her family, and expand her business.

Anitha, the other member of the Tujikomboe borrower group, has also requested 350,000 Tsh in order to support her own business selling maize and rice.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru: Куватов Шерали проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 53 года. Женат, имеет 8 детей. Шерали имеет торговую точку на рынке, где торгует национальными материалами. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 15 лет. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Sherali K. lives in the Hamadoni region. He is 53 years old. He is married and has eight children. Sherali has a vendor spot on the market where he sells national fabrics. He has been in this business for more than fifteen years. He is asking for a loan to increase turnaround of goods.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase turnaround

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sarwari Begum Muhammad Ali Group

texts.en:
Sarwari begum baji is the wife of M. A. and has resided in a city called Arifwala, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Her husband has a milk-selling business. He buys milk from the milk shops and sells to the community and earns income. Sarwari baji is also a very hard-working lady. She has a clothes-sewing business to share the financial burden of her husband. She is applying for a loan to buy a buffalo for her husband so that he will be able to start his own dairy business.

This loan consists of four additional people:

Latifan baji wants a loan to buy a movie camera for her movie-making business.

Motia baji wants a loan to repair her family's auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Manzooran baji wants a loan to buy repairing tools for her family's motor workshop.

Shabana Afshan baji wants a loan to buy ingredients (lentils, cooking oil, and spices) for her food-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. Note: Sarwari baji is seated in a blue shawl and showing her clothes-sewing business in this photo.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo to start a dairy business

loans.name: Siem's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of five low-income people who live together in Chong Kneas Commune, in Siem Reap Province. Mr. Siem S., age 35, has been selected to be the leader of the group. Siem S. is a married father, blessed with two kids, both of whom are going to school. His wife stays at home to care for their children and cook food for the family. Beside her daily housework, she also sells a few groceries out of her home for income.

Siem S. currently owns a motorbike that he uses to pick up passers-by to earn a living. Recently he can’t attract as many customers as before because his motorbike often breaks down; he is therefore applying for a loan to add to his personal savings in order to buy a new one to replace the old broken one. The other four borrowers who are jointly taking out this loan:

Mr. H. is a tuk-tuk driver, who is asking for a loan to replace his existing motorbike that has broken down.

Mrs. S. is a single woman selling groceries, who requests a loan to buy more grocery inventory to sell.

Mrs. Y. is a chef for wedding parties and she seeks a loan to buy a motorbike to ride to work.

Mrs. S. will be using the loan to purchase additional grocery items to sell.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike to replace his old broken bike

loans.name: Huong's Group

texts.en:
Hướng Thị Nguyễn was born in 1954. She lives in Dong Dau, Dong Anh, H. Noi with her mother-in-law, her husband and three children. Her husband and children have jobs. Her husband is a construction worker. She sells insurance for an insurance company and breeds pigs.

She is a group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA and she is a cluster heads, too. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. She is enthusiastic and dynamic. Everybody confident and loves her. Her family has an average income per month of about 5.000.000 VND. Ms Huong has participated in SEDA for three years. This time, she wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND ( or 280 USD) to breed pigs and poultry.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

Hiền Thị Nguyễn was born in 1979. She has two children. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND (or 280 USD) to buy a brick for sale.

Lợi Thị Nguyễn was born in 1964. She has two children. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND (or 280 USD) to buy food for her chickens and musk ducks.

Hương Thị Hồng C. was born in 1971. She has three children. She sells fruit. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND (or 280 USD) to buy more fruit for sale.

Minh Thị Hà was born in 1978. She sells vegetables in the market. She has three children. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND (or 280 USD) to buy more kinds of vegetables for sale.
( the people in the purple shirt in the image transfer to other groups)

loans.use: To breed pigs and poultry

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace O. is 50 years old and married with 8 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more yams to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell

loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.ru: Абдусалом Махмудов проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 54 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Абдусалом более 3 лет занимается торговлей. Он в основном торгует детской одеждой. Клиент на  полученный кредит хочет закупить детскую одежду из г.Душанбе. Часть товара он продаст на Районом рынке по оптовым ценам, а другую часть пустит в свой оборот.
texts.en:
Abdusalom M. lives in the Hamadoni region. He is 54 years old, married and has three children. Abdusalom has been in the retail business for more than three years. He mainly sells children's clothing. He will use the loan to buy children's clothing from the city of Dushanbe. Part of the goods he will sell on the Regional market at wholesale prices and the other part he will sell in retail.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy children's clothing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kifea Group

texts.en:
Asha is a member of the KIfea borrower group in Msamvu, Morogoro. She is a 48-year-old woman, She is married and the mother of four children. Her children are ages 22, 14, 19, and 8 years. She also cares for one other dependent. 

Asha started her own business selling charcoal two years ago . She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 50,000 Tanzania Schillings. 

This is Asha’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 150000 TSH in order to expand her business. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Asha hopes to get more food, save money, pay school fees and expand her business.

Siwatu, another member of the KIfea borrower group, has also requested 200,000 TSH in order to support her own business of selling food.

loans.use: To expand her business of charcoal

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther O. is 49 years old and married with eight children. She sells firewood to enable her to raise money for her children's education. She is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more firewood to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбуба Муродова проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 33 года. Состоит в браке, имеет 3 детей. Махбуба более 25 лет, занимается бизнесом. Она имеет торговую точку, где торгует разными мелочами, т.е. напитками, жвачкой, конфетами и т.д. Ей в этом также помогает ее дочка.Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Mahbuba M. lives in the Hamadoni district. She is 33 years old, married and has three children. Mahbuba has been in business for more than 25 years. She has a market stall where she sells various small items, such as beverages, chewing gum, candies and the like. In this way, she is able to support her children. She is requesting the loan in order to expand her inventory.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding her inventory

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Uyên's Group

texts.en:
Uyên T. N. has a store at home selling cakes, sweets, Coca Cola, fruit, etc., and she breeds a pig. She was born in 1966 and lives in Dong Dau, Dong Anh, Ha Noi with her husband and two children. Her husband is a driver. Her two children are small. They have been in business for over five years and earn approximately 5.000.000 VND a month from these activities. She is now requesting a loan of 5.450.000 VND (or ~300 USD) which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.

Uyên T. N. is the group leader of this five member group sharing a loan offered by SEDA. While each member receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. No.010103040043.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

Huế Thị N. was born in 1977. She has two children. She is a teacher. She has a monthly income of about 3.000.000 VND. She wants to borrow 5.450.000 VND (or ~300 USD) to breed pigs and poultry. No. 010103040045.

Doan T. T. N. was born in 1980. She has just married. She wants to borrow 5.450.000 VND (or ~300 USD) to buy goods for her store. No. 010103040046.

Chất Thị N. was born in 1960. She has one child. She wants to borrow 4.570.000 VND (or ~250 USD) to buy feed for chickens. No. 010103040052.

Hồng Thị Thuý N. was born in 1973. She has two children. She has a restaurant serving rice, noodle soup, etc. She wants to borrow 5.450.000 VND (or ~300 USD) to invest in her restaurant. No. 010103040049.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offerings

loans.name: Mairambi

texts.ru: Майрамби Рахимова проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 41 год. Вдова, имеет  5 детей. Майрамби более 2 лет занимается животноводством. Она откармливает и продает крупно рогатый скот. В данный момент она на полученную сумму хочет купить теленка, чтобы в дальнейшем продавать молоко.
texts.en:
Mairambi R. lives in the Hamadoni district. She is a 41-year-old widow with five children. For more than two years, Mairambi has been engaged in raising cattle. She raises and sells bighorn cattle. At the moment, she wants the loan amount to purchase a calf, in order in the long term to sell milk.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a calf

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Khiem's Group

texts.en:
Khiêm Thị Nguyễn sells fruits in the market. Her family has a carpentry workshop at home where her husband works. She was born in 1974 and lives in Ngoc Loi, Donh Anh, Ha Noi with her husband and two children. She has a monthly income of about 3.000.000 VND. She needs 3.706.000 VND (or ~200 USD) which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. 

Khiêm Thị Nguyễn  is the leader of this five member group sharing a loan offered by SEDA. WhiL. each member receives an individual loan, they are all responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 
No. 010103070045. 

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

 Chiến Thị Hoàng was born in 1965. She has two children. She has a shop selling breakfast: bread, instant noodles, soup, etc. She wants to borrow 4.578.000 VND (or ~255 USD) to invest in her small business.
No. 010103070047

 Thuốc Thị Lê was born in 1964. She raises wild geese. She wants to borrow 4.578.000 VND (or ~255 USD) to buy food for them.
No. 010103070046

 Xuyền Thị Lê was born in 1966. She has one child. She wants to borrow 4.578.000 VND (or ~255 USD) to buy wood.
No. 010103070049

 Oanh Thị K. Lê was born in 1959. She sells pork-pie in the market. She wants to borrow 4.578.000 VND (or ~255 USD) to expand her product offerings.
No. 010103070051

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offerings

loans.name: Emomali

texts.ru: Эмомали Саидов проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 45 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Эмомали более 25 лет занимается услугой такси по маршруту Хамадони-Душанбе-Хамадони. Кредит просит для отремонтирования своей автомашины. В дальнейшем он сможет предоставлять качественную услугу.
texts.en:
Emomali S. lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 45 years old, married and has five children. For more than 25 years, Emomali has engaged in providing taxi services along the route Hamadoni-Dushanbe-Hamadoni. The loan request is for repairs to his vehicle. In the long term, he will be able to offer higher quality service.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car repairs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing maize and manioc
